story:
My name is Jason Compton and I am the founder and CEO of Snake Snap.  The idea of Snake Snap came about 3 years ago when we had a snake in our pool.  Being from Florida snakes were actually my biggest fear and I did not know how to detect a single one.  I have two young children and I thought to myself what if we could take a picture of this snake and know immediately what it was so that I could help educate my children as I was ignorant on the topic.  I started to research what that snake was and found out it was a harmless Ringneck snake and is commonly found in swimming pools to get a drink of water but is too tiny to get out.  I thought how sad and at that moment Snake Snap was born.  As I studied I quickly learned that detecting snakes was not that difficult and through the process my fear wall started to come down and I began to appreciate snakes, their beauty and what their purpose is in our ecosystem.  By learning how to detect,  also what they eat and where they hide I became enamored with it.  I was a financial advisor for 17 years and it was great but I felt as though I stumbled upon my passion in life which is to educate and help make a difference in this world.  Never fathomed that would come from the animal I was deathly afraid of.  I saw an opportunity to create change by educating and build a business on a global level since snakes are on almost every piece of land on the planet and is also one of the most feared and misunderstood creatures in the wild.  I do not have a technology background but was able to find a development company and also meet some very key people in the herpetology industry that believed in me and my project.  I launched the app in June of 2019 and since that time we have over 95,000 downloads and submissions from every state in the US and over 180 different countries.  We currently get over 600 downloads a day and growing rapidly.  This has been a self funded endeavor and I have spent every penny I ever saved on this.  I have a team of 13 people that volunteer and help identify manually until we can get the funding for automation and are able to scale our business.  This has grown organically and we have changed over 40,000 peoples view of snakes and their importance while also saving just as many snakes from being killed.  We need funding to implement the artificial intelligence to take the load off of manually identifying, pay and grow my ID team and have marketing funds to spread the word globally.  We also have game ideas that will be inside the app and unique ways to educate in a simple manner.  In exchange for your contribution we have merchandise and will also refund any in app upgrades or future costs associated with our App.  We are about to release our updated website with every snake in the nation and connections to removal services and organizations in other countries we have partnered with that have information on snakes specific to their country.  

Cheers!

story:
At 6:06 p.m. on Wednesday, November 26  2014, a team was born in Chatham, ON, Canada:  the C. K. Cyber Pack Robotics Team.


We had big goals for a brand new team in a brand new city. Where most cities have a team for every high school, we decided to merge four different schools to create a powerful cooperative community team. 
The mission began with a challenge: we needed to build a robot from scratch in 6 weeks. We didn't have much in terms of money or parts, but what we did have was more important: a strong, shared passion. This element, we would soon learn, is the key to success in both a robotics competition and in life.
As the 5689th team to be formed in the world, we aimed to compete in our first regional competition in Windsor, ON, across the river from Detroit. Out of 48 teams, we were named the Rookie All-Stars of our region. Because of that, we shot right to the top and were invited to compete with our robot at the INTERNATIONAL COMPETITION held in St. Louis, Missouri, USA on April 22nd, 2015. 

What We Need In Two Weeks

We started out with little and scraped together around $9,000.00, given to us by community sponsors, to qualify for the regional competition. It took us 4 weeks to raise that amount, but now we have a bigger challenge... for each member we send to the competition in St. Louis, it will cost us roughly $1,250.00. We need to send 12 members to the competition, which means that our final cost is $15,000.00. This cost covers the 10 hour drive, the 4 nights of hotel rooms, the food, and the registration fees. We only have two weeks to raise the amount.


The Impact That You Can Make

This trip will make an impact on students in high school who will benefit greatly from the competition. Already the team has met the challenge of building a robot and raising funds, which has given us real world experience in business and technology.

Haven't you benefited before by being a part of a community team? The sense of community builds stronger and stronger as you and your fellow team members work towards a common goal. You might even know how amazing it is to get to the highest point of a competition; whether you were part of a new team like ours, or a veteran team of many years, the experience is thrilling. Our team is just like any sports team; we have banded together, each of us with different strengths and weaknesses, and have built a product and honed our skills over a period of 6 weeks. The ones who don't drive the robot, cheer as loud as they can for hours  on end. The experience is phenomenal, and we have only yet seen a regional competition. 

However, finances are a barrier to our participation. Up until the point when we won the chance to compete, we weren't struggling for funds. Now, we are struggling. 

Honestly, without the rapid support of others, our team will lose the chance to go to St. Louis, and we might not get the opportunity again for several years. The contributions that you choose to make will mean the difference between a team of young, dedicated students who get to compete in an international competition in their first year as a team, or a group that is forced to turn down the offer because we couldn't get the funding. 

We need generous donations from sponsors or donors like yourself, and any amount, even a single dollar, will help to bring our team to the F.I.R.S.T. Robotics world championships in St. Louis, Missouri.


Other Ways You Can Help

Of course, money isn't everything; we would benefit greatly if you told just 5 people about our team today. We ask that you visit us on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/CKCyberPack5689 and like the page. Share some of our posts.

Any questions? Send us an email at ckcyberpack@gmail.com and you might just get a special surprise if you have a quality question.

story:
Our Story

Hi. My name is Katie Fiebig. I'm a single mom to a beautiful girl. She's a strong, spirited, creative, vivacious, outside-the-box thinker. She always has been and hopefully, that will never change.
 
In my work as an Oncology Nurse, I loved helping people.  I knew that if I couldn't get you want you needed, I would find the person who could. That's my passion--connecting people with what they truly need. 

When it was clear that my own daughter needed something different than what a typical school had to offer, I got to work. I spent years looking for a place where her gifts and unique way of seeing and experiencing the world would be valued, supported and reflected back to her, rather than one where her differences and challenges were too often the main focus of time and attention.

I couldn't find that place in Cincinnati, so I decided to create it and The Ethel Streit School (TESS) was born.

In September, TESS's Pilot Program will open its doors. We're launching this fundraiser to ask for your help to make this program the rich, exciting, multi-disciplinary, sensory-smart experience we know it can be! We have 30 days--help us reach our goal!

TESS's Pilot Program is a mindful collaboration of children, parents, educators, and community members that supports and guides students to take ownership of their learning. Our school creates a real-world, interdisciplinary context that fosters joyful exploration and develops students’ natural curiosity, personal interests, and individual potential. 

At TESS, we know that kids who think outside the box can’t learn inside a box. 

We believe in the philosophy of Collaborative Problem Solving, a powerful and fundamental understanding that Kids Do Well When They Can, rather than Kids Do Well When They Try. 

If a student is struggling, we know that our first job is to presume competence. That means we assume two things: All kids are doing the best that they can, and, All kids want to do well. Our task--our responsibility–is to discovery whatever is getting in the way, and work as a team to clear it out of the way. 

Our Mission is to establish an inclusive and collaborative educational community where each individual’s academic, social, and emotional intelligence is fostered in a warm, authentic, and purposeful way; where the students' passions and interests are discovered, nurtured, and respected; where bravery and curiosity are cultivated and encouraged in a safe and flexible environment; and where innovation and creativity are embraced as essential tools for lifelong learning and success.

All children are curious. All children deserve to have their brilliance reflected back to them. Please join us in this worthy and much-needed endeavor!

What We Need 

What we have: A vision, a plan, a committed staff, a small and excited student body, and a welcoming space. 

What we need: The basics and more! Art supplies, math manipulatives, iPads, a project table, bean bags chairs, a rug, a filing cabinet, a giant whiteboard and chalkboard, outdoor play-space equipment, a small budget for outings in the community–an essential ingredient of any outside-the-box learner. 

Every little bit truly does help! We are grass-roots, creative, and thrifty! A handful of $1.00, $5.00 and $10.00 donations very quickly becomes enough to stock our shelves (heck, to first buy the shelves!) with supplies a group of kids can eagerly use to inspire, design, and build.

Help Us Spread the Word

Even if you aren't in a position to contribute funds, you can make a huge contribution by spreading the word!  Use the Indiegogo share tools on this page to let others know who we are and what we are about. We have 30 days to raise this money before we open our doors!

Thank you!

story:
Education for nearly one million children in Nepal is in jeopardy. The two major earthquakes and aftershocks that hit the country and surrounding areas devastated over 24,000 classrooms. In the severely-affected districts of Gorkha, Sindhupalchok and Nuwakot, it’s estimated that more than 90 per cent of schools have been destroyed.

My name is S Uthayakumar Biravar, my recent visit to the schools in Kavreplanchok about 30km away from the capital of Katmandhu was in a very bad and pitiful situation. The children totalled  90 were studying under a tree and under a tent. I am from Singapore, I together with my friends raised about $4800 to rebuild a temporary shelter consists of wood, bamboo, and zinc for the school Sundar Surya Dev school in Kavreplanchok district. There are about 7 such schools that needs help in the mountainous regions of Kavreplanchok.  Total amount needed will be $32000 dollars.

Education gives hope and a good future to the children of Kavreplanchok.  We are appealing to the kind hearted souls to contribute, to this good cause of rebuilding the children school. Compassionate souls who contribute to this good cause will be greatly remembered by the Creator. All funds will be directly used to buy materials, labour cost, stationaries for the children. 
Putting a smile back into the children's life is something that  cannot be expressed by a million words. And the impact is contagious for all those who had contributed for a good cause.   
I am also working with Sanctuary Foundation to collect funds for the victims of Nepal Earthquake disasters
https://www.facebook.com/pages/Sanctuary-Foundation/110129842353879

story:
"Let them know" is the new campaign launched by SADIL - TOGO, a small non-profit from Togo, working hard since 2008 to let underprivileged children from the Central Region of the country go to school. 

This has been made possible through one program: Education Pour Tous, translating to "education for everyone". This program offers the possibility for international sponsors to finance the education of one child at least. We target orphans, impoverished and disabled children from the rural areas of the Central Region of Togo, for whom it would be impossible to go to school without our support.

Getting an education in Togo is critical not only to get a sufficiently paying job, but also to live more conveniently. Because more than 40 ethnic groups live together in one country, their only means of communication between each other is often the French language. This is only learned at school.

Being educated also means contributing to the development of Togo, and supporting one's family. It means not needing the help of NGOs to send one's children to school anymore. By investing in these children's future, we are investing in the development of a country.


To this day, SADIL - TOGO has helped more than 175 children go to school. Today, some of them are getting to the end of their education: a student from our program got her high school diploma this year and is ready to pursue her education at a higher level, with the help of our new program, Université Pour Tous. This was only made possible by our generous sponsors and partners. But we can do even more!

Let them know

Who are "they"? They are:

  • the togolese children needing our support 
  • the team of our organization fighting so that these children can go to school every year,
  • the sponsors providing the funds.

While the children supported by our program "Education Pour Tous" get money every month from their international sponsors, the team of SADIL - TOGO rarely gets any funds to pay for supplies, except from a few donations.

This is resulting in them lacking the means to really carry out  the program effectively. They struggle to work without computers, or to pay for gas when visiting the children for the 3 yearly follow-ups. (The only way to get around here is driving their motorcycles.) This leads to poor communication and a lack in effectiveness. Indeed, the team is only composed of volunteers, sometimes sent by a national program which pays them only enough so they can survive.

Simply said: if the working conditions of the team are not fixed, the program will suffer from the lack of resources, no matter how hard-working the team is.

In order to prevent these communication and technical problems, we have put together this "let them know" campaign.

What do we need funds for?

Every donation on this campaign will help our team work more effectively.

  • Our team will be able to communicate more with the families and local communities. We need updates about the family situations, especially because we have had cases in the past where children were sent to work in other places instead of going to school, sometimes within child trafficking networks. With more resources for gas and telephone, we will be able to visit them and phone them more often.
  • More communication with the international sponsors is also one of our goals. To communicate with them, the team presently relies on their private internet connection or the connection of temporary communications interns. They need a common internet connection at the office and their own computer (we only have 3 computers at the office, 2 of which are really slow and not adapted to go on the internet). It will allow more trust between them and the organization.
  • With a domestic internet connection, they will be able to work more effectively on computers, write reports, articles, organize the data relevant to the program, communicate with other local organization, set up work groups in the area.
  • Professional communication material will convince more international sponsors to support children through the organization.
  • The team will be able to organize their resources and files more effectively with additional office supplies. Right now, everything is stuffed in a big cupboard, and we lack a safe place to store our cash money.
  • In general, we will create more means for our team to rely on for their work. They will not use to use their personal resources so much, and work more effectively, as they will not feel limited by their own means. They are already giving out a lot to our children: helping them or not is up to you now!

Why your help matters

Nowadays, one of West Africa's biggest assets is its youth: more than 40% of Togo's population is less than 15, meaning it is a dynamic and fruitful population, ready to take over the heritage their parents left them with and develop a country that has been harmed for too long.

However, to do so, the most vulnerable of them need support. Education is still a privilege, especially for young girls. This youth needs the resources their parents can unfortunately not offer them.

We cannot let this new generation down: we must let Togo and the whole world develop the great potential of its youth.

When asked why they wanted to send their children to school, most of the parents and tutors from our program tell us they did not want their children to be illiterate like they are. Let this dream be a reality!


What can you do?

Making a donation to help us, you will help the work of a small, local team of dedicated development workers who know the needs of the communities that are theirs. By doing so, you will empower a generation and support the next. Give these children a chance, make a donation!

To let you know how grateful we are, we will send you unique gifts, including hand-crafted art work from Togo! So you can make a good deed and get a glimpse of the beauties from this country!

Even if cannot support us financially, you can still help us a lot : share this campaign with your friends! Check out our blog to learn more about our past achievements, share our video, like our Facebook page, keep the word out!

Why your help mattersNowadays, one of West Africa's biggest assets is its youth: more than 40% of Togo's population is less than 15, meaning it is a dynamic and fruitful population, ready to take over the heritage their parents left them with and develop a country that has been harmed for too long.However, to do so, the most vulnerable of them need support. Education is still a privilege, especially for young girls. This youth needs the resources their parents can unfortunately not offer them.We cannot let this new generation down: we must let Togo and the whole world develop the great potential of its youth.When asked why they wanted to send their children to school, most of the parents and tutors from our program tell us they did not want their children to be illiterate like they are. Let this dream be a reality!What can you do?Making a donation to help us, you will help the work of a small, local team of dedicated development workers who know the needs of the communities that are theirs. By doing so, you will empower a generation and support the next. Give these children a chance, make a donation!To let you know how grateful we are, we will send you unique gifts, including hand-crafted art work from Togo! So you can make a good deed and get a glimpse of the beauties from this country!Even if cannot support us financially, you can still help us a lot : share this campaign with your friends! Check out our blog to learn more about our past achievements, share our video, like our Facebook page, keep the word out!

story:
Summary 

Help me raise $18,000 to sponsor an underprivileged student to study at the Vedanta Academy in India for 3 years.

Background 

Hello! Many years ago I returned to Australia, from India, after six years of studying Vedanta — a practical philosophy that originated in the Himalayas over 10,000 years ago.  

The ancient wisdom of Vedanta introduces us to our true Self. It is the source of all knowledge and from it all religions and philosophies have emerged.

Vedanta completely changed my life. Before Vedanta I was superficial, disconnected and unhappy, but after Vedanta I felt connected and content — and ever since I have been communicating to people about how to live a more fulfilled, focused and harmonious life. 

However I am well aware that a teacher can only pass onto their students the level of their own understanding. That is why I feel it's time to return to the academy to raise my level of knowledge.

I plan to go back at the end of October for two months. However I cannot go empty-handed. After all the academy has given me so much already and continues to give so much to so many.  

It's Time to Give Back 

The Vedanta Academy offers a 3-year full-time residential course and sponsors students, from around the world, who cannot afford to pay. In essence, many students study at the academy for free. All their food, tuition, books, stationery, accommodation and medical costs are covered by sponsors.

This is very dear to my heart because initially when I studied at the academy I saved enough money to pay for my first three years myself. However after the course I wanted to stay on and continue my studies, but I couldn't afford to pay, so I was sponsored — and to my sponsor I am eternally grateful, because without his generous support I would not have had the education that I was fortunate enough to have. 

Sponsoring a Student

Sponsoring a student for three years costs $18,000. This covers food, tuition, books, stationery, accommodation and medical expenses.

The Impact

After completing the 3-year course at the Vedanta Academy students go out into the world and teach the higher values of life and living and help change peoples' lives for the better.

Your contribution will not only make a difference to a student's life, it will have a ripple effect and make a difference to many peoples' lives.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute financially you can still help us by sharing this campaign with others though social media.

What happens to the money if we don't make the target?

Irrespective of whether this goal is reached or not, all the money raised goes to the Vedanta Academy to support students who cannot afford their tuition and board.

Thank You!

Thank you for taking the time to read this campaign and sharing what you can towards making a positive difference in the world.

Bye for now, 

Meredith

story:
“Programming” the future…

Hello World!

>>> How everything started? 

# I was about 15 years old when I started to feel attracted to computer’s world. I remember like it was yesterday about the first Informatics lesson in high school when the teacher brought into discussion Augusta Ada King. She was the one that created the first algorithm supposed to run on a machine. Impressed by her story, I began to pay attention to the lessons, wondering if I could ever be able to write a sequence of operation to make sense. 
I wanted to study computer science but I was afraid of not being prepared for such an undergraduate program due to the fact that I did not own a personal computer at that time and I postpone it. Every now and then I encountered  reasons that made me desire even more to learn code:  the challenges that I faced at work, the wide range of jobs within computer science area or the inability to understand programmers’ jokes are only a few examples. 

This year I decided to take my chances and apply at Cardiff University for a Computer Science Master Program. In about two weeks, while I was checking every 30 minutes the e-mails, University's  answer arrived. The emotion that I felt at that moment was ineffable! I barely could read the entire message, which in a few words screwed " Unconditional offer!!!!!!!". I felt the joy for about two days and a half when I realized that...

PRINT (‘I solved one problem and gained seven more…’)

The fact that I was accepted is just amazing but I did not considered the possibility of not being able to pay for the program.

>>>  Which choices did I explore? 

 I assumed that, as many other students, I will manage to procure the money through Student Finance. Unfortunately, they only support undergraduate students. I started to look after bank loans but in my country there are only two student loans, they also require monthly reimbursement and interest and I could not afford them in the subsequent year. 

I also applied for a scholarship and based on my previous academic and professional performance I would say that there are 50% chances to obtain it but still there is nothing sure...

Running out of possibilities, I open this campaign. 

The tuition fee for this year of study is 7560 £ but my purpose would be to rise the amount of 2520£ . This is the sum of the first installment, due on 22nd of September. 

>>> Why Cardiff University?

# I choose Cardiff University because of its special postgraduate program which allows me to reconsider the architecture of my career.  Most of the Universities do not dispose of conversion master programs  like the above mentioned one. There were about two other options in UK: University of Kent (Canterbury) and UCD Dublin. Although Cardiff University seemed to be more developed in terms of computational infrastructure and more focused on research. Also, for this particular institution I received a very good feedback from two of my friends who studied there.

>>> Why help me?

# I assume that for every person it is difficult to ask for financial support but as unpleasant and shameful this might be I would not like to miss this unique chance without having exhausted all possible ways to procure the money. 

I will apply for a part time job in Cardiff as soon as possible but I assume that the whole salary will be used for books and living expenses. Even if I will be able to save a small amount, there will be no time for me to gather the money for the first installment. 

No contribution is too small for my dream! Any kind of support is highly appreciated - providing me feedback or sharing the information can be as helpful as a financial participation. 

>>> What would be your reward?

I created different types of perks in order to reward your contributions in a funny manner. Hopefully they will seem interesting to you, otherwise, please let me know about your suggestion.


Thank you so much for reading! I really appreciate your contribution to my campaign! 


Ana-Maria

story:
Why #codeNepal

On April 25th, Nepal experienced a devastating earthquake that took the lives of more than 8000 people and have left thousands more injured and homeless. 
Along with world heritage sites, several schools, colleges and offices have been destroyed, leaving the Nepalese people feeling hopeless and void.


Now it is time to bring a long-term contribution after the immediate post-earthquake relief. 

The Impact in Nepal

In 3 months, CodersTrust will impact the lives of more than 1000 people in Nepal directly.
90 students will learn basic data entry skills, more than 100 will learn Front-End Web Development and approximately 1000 existing students will take part in seminars to kick-start their freelancing careers. 

The students enrolled in the Basic Data Entry training will receive the tool to start earning $ 2/3 per hour after 3/4 months of constant practice. This is a lot of money for people who are used to earn $1 a day.

The students enrolled in Front-End Web Development will be instead able to earn 10/12 $ an hour after 5 months of practice. 

We will help the students finding jobs with a dedicated team of bidders who will look for jobs on the freelance portals such as Upwork.com.



We will be focusing on both the central area of Kathmandu and the rural areas around the city, in order to impact people from different backgrounds and who have been highly affected by the earthquake.


CodersTrust needs you!

We will bring qualified mentors, project managers and top notch curriculum. However, we also need a fully equipped tent that will accommodate at least 30 people, laptops and internet access. 
We will bring our expertise and need your support to provide everything else, absolutely free of cost for the students!

Every dollar you spend will be spent to improve the lives of the Nepalese people by providing them FREE access to IT education, and seeking employment opportunities on the online freelancing market. 


CodersTrust believes in borderless access to education and the labor market.

CodersTrust (CT) is a Danish for-profit IT training and outsourcing company. Currently, CT is based in Dhaka, Bangladesh where we have reached nearly 700 talents in 10 months. 
Our mission is to change the lives of 100,000 Bangladeshis in the span of 3 years while expanding our program to other parts of the world. Our program is supported globally by DANIDA and locally we are working in a joint venture with Grameen Solutions, Bangladesh.
Well renowned entrepreneurs and individuals such Morten Lund and Douglas Rushkoff (along with many others) believe in our cause and are supporting us as advisors and board members. 
At CodersTrust, we believe in borderless access to education and the online labor market for everyone, regardless of race, gender, age and geography. 
CT envisions a world where your past does not define your future!



Where money goes

We will use the money to:

- Training room rent,

- Buy the necessary IT equipment,

- Salaries for the mentors and the bidders who will help the students finding jobs,

- Expenses like food and accommodation for the team.


2 locations

We will lead classes in two different locations - one in the city center of Kathmandu and the other one in Bhaktapur, where we will impact students from rural areas and highly affected by the earthquake.


The Team

To run such an operation, we partnered up with a team in Kathmandu that provides experience and local knowledge, key factors to successfully run #codeNepal. 

The local team will be led by Vijay Shrestha, who has held top positions in Nepal's airline industry since the last 20 years, and IT and management education entrepreneur since the last 15 years. Vijay was President of Airline Operators Association of Nepal, Board Member of Nepal Government's Civil Aviation Authority, Board of member of Management Association of Nepal, Advisor to the Mayor of Kathmandu. Started two years ago and running a cancer charity organization (self funded) for creating awareness of cancer and screening of cervical cancer among Nepalese women. Currently, Vice President of Himalaya Airlines, a Nepal-China joint venture international airline. Keen in education and development sectors besides aviation, tourism and hotel. 

Part of the team in Dhaka, Bangladesh.


Success stories from Bangladesh

We currently have 500+ students enrolled in Dhaka, Bangladesh in just 1 year of local operations.

We started from a first pilot of 20 students June 2014, improved our product around them and got ready for a full launch last February.

We have an amazing team of 25 people (of which 23 are locals) running the local CT.

After only two months of education, our students already earn $150/200 a month, with no prior IT experience.  The best case is of a student who landed a $10.000 project with an international client just two months into our education!!

Our students.


CodersTrust with UNDP in Dhaka

If you are determined enough, yesterday's impossible can be today's reality. Coderstrust, together with United Nations Development Programme - UNDP, is starting on a new project to help the most deprived segment of the country. 
We are going to provide basic IT lessons to people living in slums and try to help improve their current living standards. Amidst all the hardships, we see the glimmer of hope for a better future and that is enough to keep us going.

Here is the picture of the selection process.

Women Empowerment

CodersTrust is all about empowering people and get them opportunities to improve their life quality.

Therefore, we are very active in Women Empowerment and host events on a monthly basis to show our girls in Bangladesh how being a freelancer can boost their career without leaving their role back home.

Look at our beautiful women at our latest event!


Meet Ella - and a bit more about CodersTrust


Money is not the only way to give.

-  Donate your time by spreading the word

-  Engage your company by outsourcing your next IT project to the CodersTrust Nepal batch. 

-  Record and share on your favourite social networks a 30 seconds video with the #codeNepal hashtag where you tell us why you supported the campaign - let's spread your contribution around the world!


Nepal, we are all with you!

story:
The Energetic Health Institute (EHI) was founded in 2013 by Henele E'ale, a Licensed Doctor of Natural Medicine, who is passionate about a simple yet powerful concept, using food as medicine. Why? To give families dealing with serious illnesses scientifically-supported natural alternatives that really work. Days before his mother passed away from cancer 12 years ago, Dr. H made her a promise, to help people suffering find better solutions. It's a promise that he keeps everyday thanks to EHI.


The Energetic Health Institute is a 501(c)3 non-profit online school where ANYONE who has the desire to learn can receive the one of the finest Holistic Nutrition educations approved by the National Association of Nutrition Professionals.

No one is turned away for financial reasons. That’s why this campaign is so important.  Literally 100% of each dollar you donate will go to fund scholarships for single moms enrolling at EHI and in need of your support.

Just a Few of Our Amazing EHI Students!

So much of what we know of as disease can be prevented through Holistic Nutrition. From heart disease to colon cancer, we have definitive data that proves that nutrition can be of incredible value for those suffering and in need.


In the US, it is estimated that over the next ten years, there will be a 21% increase in the need for nutritionists!  Therefore it is essential that we rise to the challenge and meet that goal, offering a top-notch nutrition education that allows our single moms to become Board Certified Holistic Nutritionists. Our community is filled with people ready to help. People who, like Dr. H, wish they could have even one more day with the ones they love so much. And now, after more than a decade of development, that is possible.

This is where you come in...every dollar spent is a vote cast. Every dollar you donate to our scholarship fund is a vote in favor of helping single moms become trained healthcare professionals. They are needed in our hospitals and classrooms now more than ever. You have an incredible power to make a difference!


The World Health Organization and CDC estimate that over 10 Million people die of cancer and heart disease each year, with approximately 3 Million of those occurring in the United States alone. And here's the important part...they estimate that at least 1/3rd of those could be prevented through education and Holistic Nutrition. Now factor in that reality that more than 110 Million adults and 12.7 Million children are either overweight or obese, and the need for healthcare professionals that are highly trained in using food as medicine becomes even more apparent.

When you support scholarships for our single moms you are literally supporting millions of families, giving them the chance to have even one more day with a loved one.


The EHI Community is made up of many traditionally under served populations like single moms trying to help their family as the make a career change. And there is tremendous opportunity for each of them here.

    Jolene Goring, EHI Graduate & Board Certified

According to the Bureau of Labor Statistics, the average annual salary earned by a nutritionist is $55,240!  Imagine a single mom trying to help her family. Imagine how much it would mean to her and her family if she could afford to go back to school to learn something that will help their health as it helps position them for a better financial future. This is why we need your help...your generosity will make a difference in that mom's life, her family's life, and in the life of everyone she is able to help after graduation.


We're devoted to the development of each and every student here at the Energetic Health Institute where we take great pride in our commitment to academic excellence. In academia, the typical drop rate is between 12 -18% per new enrollments. At EHI, our drop rate is currently at an unprecedented 1.35% meaning that only 1 out of every 100 students drops our program. Why? Because of the amount of support we provide for each student. We promise unlimited interaction and we deliver on that promise. When you add encouragement, amazing information, and hand-on experience that students can feel to the mix...the result is a very happy student community progressing towards their future. 

At EHI we are a true community…but it goes even deeper than that…at EHI we are a true family.

Our 1st Core Value at the Energetic Health Institute is EVERYONE MATTERS, and we take great pleasure in serving traditionally underserved populations.

Currently we serve a student population that is approximately 92% female, ranging in ages from 17-72. Of those women, approximately 45% are single moms trying to care for their children and better themselves at the same time. While all of our new students receive some form of partial scholarship, more than 50% still require financial assistance.


We are so grateful for anything you can give and so appreciative for all you can give. Your generosity will make an immediate difference...it is a vote in favor of getting trained professional Holistic Nutritionists into the work force...it is a vote in favor of single mom's providing for their family...

Your generosity is a vote in favor helping family's dealing with serious illness get one more day with the people they love so much.

Thank you for supporting our student community!

Thank you for supporting our mission!

Thank you for making tomorrow amazing!

If this cause resonates with you, then after you support our cause please share this crowd funding campaign with your family and friends on Facebook. You have our gratitude. :)

                                  Together WE Are the Greatest Energy!

110 Million adults and 12.7 Million children are either overweight or
obese, and the need for healthcare professionals that are highly trained in using food as medicine becomes even more apparent.When you support scholarships for our single moms you are literally supporting millions of families, giving them the chance to have even one more day with a loved one.The EHI Community is made
up of many traditionally under served populations like single moms trying to help their family as the make a career change. And there is tremendous opportunity for each of them here.     Jolene Goring, EHI Graduate & Board CertifiedAccording to the Bureau of Labor Statistics, the average annual salary earned by a nutritionist is $55,240!  Imagine a single mom trying to help her family. Imagine how much it would mean to her and her family if she could afford to go back to school to learn something that will help their health as it helps position them for a better financial future. This is why we need your help...your generosity will make a difference in that mom's life, her family's life, and in the life of everyone she is able to help after graduation.We're devoted to the development of each and every student here at the Energetic Health Institute where we take great pride in our commitment to academic excellence. In
academia, the typical drop rate is between 12 -18% per new
enrollments. At EHI, our drop rate is currently at an unprecedented 1.35% meaning
that only 1 out of every 100 students drops our program. Why? Because of the amount of support we provide for each student. We promise unlimited interaction and we deliver on that promise. When you add encouragement, amazing information, and hand-on experience that students can feel to the mix...the result is a very happy student community progressing towards their future.  At EHI we are a true community…but it goes even deeper than that…at
EHI we are a true family.Our 1st Core Value at
the Energetic Health Institute is EVERYONE MATTERS, and we take great
pleasure in serving traditionally underserved populations.Currently we serve a student population that
is approximately 92% female, ranging in ages from 17-72. Of those women, approximately
45% are single moms trying to care for their children and better themselves at the same time. While all of our new
students receive some form of partial scholarship, more than 50% still require
financial assistance. 
We are so grateful for anything you can give and so appreciative for all you can give. Your generosity will make an immediate difference...it is a vote in favor of getting trained professional Holistic Nutritionists into the work force...it is a vote in favor of single mom's providing for their family...Your generosity is a vote in favor helping family's dealing with serious illness get one more day with the people they love so much.Thank you for supporting our student community!Thank you for supporting our mission!Thank you for making tomorrow amazing!If this cause resonates with you, then after you support our cause please share this crowd funding campaign with your family and friends on Facebook. You have our gratitude. :)                                  Together WE Are the Greatest Energy!

story:
Short Summary

Dear Friends and Family

LifeSmart Education provides practical education, which furthers global competencies and international dialogue for Ohio's underserved communities.  One way we address these issues are through our ARISE life skills curricula, which helps youth and adults to learn how to become the architects of their own lives. We provide opportunities for our students which helps them to open their eyes to the possibilities this world has to offer.  We want to empower underserved communities to see beyond their neighborhood, to find a reason to make the best choices in life for themselves. We want to help our students realize their potential in a global world. 

Through our educational programs, we give underserved youth and adults the resources to succeed and to see beyond their current life circumstances. We provide opportunities that their schools or families may not be able to. WE TEACH REAL LIFE EDUCATION WITH REAL WORLD EXPERIENCES. 

LifeSmart Education is a 501 (c) 3 grassroots organization that has successfully sustained five programs of coursework in professional job development, health & nutrition, financial literacy and two national travel study tours from Columbus, Ohio to Washington D.C. 

We are currently planning study abroad tours to China, Japan, Europe and South Africa through our program Global Diversity Abroad (GlobalDiversityAbroad.org).

Because we are a grassroots organization we need start-up funding to help sustain our initiatives and to host our first meet and greet event to the community. Your contribution will magnify the work we are able to do in the community and help us to bring our programming to communities where education in life skills and global awareness are severely lacking.  

What We Need & What You Get

Support for our programs

  • We need $2,000 to continue our program marketing and development.
  • All of our $100 or more donors get full recognition in our newest marketing material, website and social media outlets.
  • All donated funds for this campaign will go towards our first annual event. This event is our first meet and greet to introduce the public at large who we are and to learn about the students who have benefited from our programs.

The Impact

Your support for our organization will allow us the following:

  • To reach more youth and adults who want to participate in our life skill courses and national and international study tours.
  • Our past students have benefited greatly from our courses.  We have received overwhelming support from our students and parents about the education we are providing to the community.  Your support would help us to continue to help the students who have participated in our programs.
  • Our programming affords many underserved communities the opportunity to learn skills that will greatly impact their lives and help them to become productive, global citizens. Your support would help us to reach out to local businesses and corporate sponsors who would like to sponsor our students for international educational tours.  

Risks & Challenges

As a new organization, it is difficult to compete for grant dollars, which many times are awarded to larger, more established nonprofits. 

  • We have successfully completed every course of programming we have set out to do. 
  • We will continue to gain the trust of the community by making the best impact in the community that we can with limited funds.
  • We are committed and passionate about educating our students with skills that will help them to become the architects of their lives.  We want to continue to gain the trust of the parents and students who participate in our programs. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our videos and stories. Use the SHARE button to make a difference!

  • If you can't donate money, please ask your employer and/or close family and friends to support our organization.
  • Tell your local media outlets about us and help us to get publicity within your city. We want to expand! 

YOUR DONATION IS TAX-DEDUCTIBLE

story:
I need your help to pay for my Masters Degree, because I cant find the $50,000 on my own! Here's my story:

In 2009 I was the victim of an unprovoked weaponed assault that left me with a broken neck, $75,000 debt and took away my own athletic dreams. I made the choice to dedicate my life to helping others achieve what I no longer could. Since then I have assisted with international (Super XV Rugby, Military) and national level athletes (Australian Rules Football, MMA, Police), been in head positions of 2 state level competitions, competed in power lifting and taught physical education to hundreds of adults at TAFE/Tech. School/Community College level.

University of Miami need $51,273 in tuition fees. Before crowd funding I initially approached my parents who were unable to help, corporate sponsors and large organisations who sponsor the countrys biggest leagues and clubs, the university I completed my Bachelor degree at, with an offer to teach for them for free in return for their help and applied for many scholarships, all to no avail. A bank loan is out the question as I will not be here to make repayments.

In Australia, options for further study are limited. There is one specific Masters in Strength and Conditioning and 2 in Sports Performance. These are all online. I cannot see how such an applied craft and high level of education can be taught behind a computer. My only criteria was to undertake the best Masters in the world for me, regardless of how far that took me. Having spent the past 3 months researching options for the best course worldwide, I have found the USA the place to go - unfortunately the tuition fees are out of my reach.

Australia lead the world in researching sports science, but not applying it. This is an opportunity for me work hands on in an $876 million dollar system (NCAA) with a minimum of 17 teams in an $8.5 million dollar facility. To try that into perspective, 6 of the top 30 NCAA (college students, not professional athletes) teams averaged over 100,000 attendees to a  football game across the season, any night of the week. We get 100,000 to one game, one day a year for top tier professionals. The average NCAA college basketball crowd is just under 24,000, the NBL - our top tier professionals in Australia - averaged 5,100.

Thank you for your time and consideration in reading this pitch, even if you do not donate, please click a share button on the left!

story:
What is The Dream Center?

From awakening dormant dreamers to birthing valiant visionaries, The Dream Center is a multifaceted transformative hub that unearths unlimited possibilities. Our mission is simple: to inspire EVERYONE—regardless of race, age, religion, gender, orientation or shoe size—to dream again. By way of dynamic programming, focused on Leadership Development, Economic Empowerment and Creative Arts, The Dream Center inspires, informs and ignites the imaginations of visionaries and dreamers across a myriad of genres.

The Dream Center truly is a catalytic space. Lives change. Attitudes evolve. Dreams are realized. We develop dreamers, creatives, entrepreneurs, and civic-minded individuals. We fundamentally believe that by abolishing fears and fully realizing potential, we can change ourselves, our communities, and the world.﻿

Why Support our Vision Academy?

Here are some alarming statistics:

a.  From 3 p.m. to 6 p.m. juvenile crime and experimentation with drugs, alcohol, cigarettes and sex peak at a startling rate (Fight Crime: Invest in Kids, 2012). This is no different in Harlem.

b.  We are situated in the midst of the largest school district in the country. There are more students in New York City public schools than people in eight U.S. States.

c.  Of the 1.1 million students in the NYC public school system 72 percent are Latino or black.

d.  Less than half of them will graduate from high school in four years.

While statistics can be disturbing, places like The Dream Center are positioning themselves to change the narrative about the people in our community. Every day, we walk by youth of all ages who are seeking ways to engage and get involved. What if we could transform those peak hours into an opportunity for possibility, exploration and engagement in something that would push youth to be their better selves? 

Vision Academy is a FREE program geared towards assisting high school students in the exploration of real-world challenges and possibilities. Completed over three semesters, with an option of an additional summer session, it provides experiential learning opportunities focused on Leadership Development, Economic Empowerment, and Creative Arts.  Vision Academy emboldens our community of young dreamers to become what they believe. Through self-affirmation and critical thinking, our pedagogical approach incorporates inquiry-based learning and interactive strategies to illuminate new ideas and transformation. 

Our program is also designed to develop skills in literacy, critical thinking, problem solving, public speaking and teamwork. The goal is to create innovative, lifelong learners who have a passion for what is possible and a hunger to make change within themselves, the community, and the world.

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help. $15,000 will enable 30 high school students to complete an entire year of Vision Academy. That breaks down to $500 per student. We are seeking support to help us do the following:

    • $5,600 to pay the facilitators and industry professionals that will teach the students during this program.
    • $2,700 for food and snacks to feed the students. Most will be coming from school and will be hungry. They need to eat to focus.
    • $2,000 to hire a part time program coordinator for one year.
    • $1,850 for a MAC and Adobe Creative Suite 6 Subscription for student projects.
    • $1,200 for field trips and exploratory excursions that deepen the exploration process.
    • $950 for fees associated with putting on a final production in a theatre that seats 1,500 people!
    • $500 for supplies needed for the students to participate in each semester.
    • $200 for marketing materials to promote the program in the community.

    While we are fully confident that we can reach this goal, if we do not we will first seek funding to offset the remainder of the money. We want to help no less than 30 students complete this program. If we still have some trouble we will adjust the number of students we accept into the program for 2016.

FAQ

Q: Will my donations be tax deductible?

A: Yes! The Dream Center is a registered 501(c)3. 

Q: Are the perks listed the only ones that will be available? 

A: Yes! Due to Indiegogo restrictions, we are only allowed to post 20 perks at a time. Some of our perks will be based on availability. Should we run out of a particular perk we will rotate in a new comparable item. 

Q: What will the canvas tote bag and t-shirt look like? 

A: Check them out below! 

Q: Is shipping included in the perks?

A: Yes, if you live in the US. However, for international donors, please add the specified shipping after you choose your perk.

Q: I bought a t-shirt. How do I tell you the size I'd like?

A: One of our staff members rewards volunteers will contact you via email. Thank you!

Q: What if I want to donate but don't want a perk?
A: We appreciate your support for our campaign and we welcome your donation even if you do not wish to pick a perk. That just means 100% of your donation will go directly to The Dream Center!

Q: Can I donate via check?

A: Yes! Please make your check out to "The Dream Center." In the memo line of your check, please write "Vision Academy" so that your money is earmarked for the campaign. Our address is:

205 West 119th Street, Right Side

New York, NY 10026

Thank you!

The Impact

Our youth and teen centered programs ARE making impact.  The Dream Center offers Freedom School, a summer and after-school enrichment program that promotes reading, increases self-esteem and generates positive attitude toward learning.  The age demographic ranges from ages 6-18 and covers a curriculum of five major components: high quality academic enrichment; parent and family involvement; civic engagement and social action; intergenerational leadership development; and nutrition, health and mental health.  In 2014, 78.9% of participants maintained or gained in instructional reading level and did not experience summer learning loss. On average, participants demonstrated a 4-month increase in instructional reading level.

The Harlem Teen Shakespeare Intensive (HTSI) is a free six week program wherein teens and pre-teens (12-18) will learn appreciation, basic mechanics, and grounded understanding of Shakespeare’s work, its importance in literature, and its relevance in their lives. The Dream Center partners with Classical Theatre of Harlem (CTH) for the implementation of this program.

Checkmate is an after-school chess program created to engage youth and teen chess players, from beginner to grandmaster levels.  Chess develops the same skills necessary for academic excellence, critical and strategic thinking, problem solving, memory skill and focus. 

Market Yourself Seminars provide participants with basic online marketing strategies including search engine optimization, building and managing a website, improving online image through social media, using social networking to optimize a product and learning the beginnings of creating a business plan.  

These are just a few of more than 25 original programs and 12 partner programs offered at The Dream Center.  Some other programs include Breathwork Meditation, yoga, dance, This is My Story (writing and storytelling), This is My Voice (public speaking) and The Apprentice Project (entrepreneurship cohort). 

Risks & Challenges

In 2013 and 2014 we ran the Vision Academy program in different ways. We had some successes, but also some obstacles. In the end, we learned a lot about what is necessary to do this program in a way that has real world impact. Teens require a lot of attention and their needs sometimes go beyond the time they spend in The Dream Center. When they walk in, the come with their own fears, challenges, concerns, hopes and dreams. We have to ensure that we have enough people and resources to provide a village to support them in their successes. We know that we can do it. We have a model. We have done programming that has supported 50 youth at a time all day, five days a week for six weeks in the summer. We can and will do this.


Other Ways You Can Help

Q: We think The Dream Center is amazing! What can we do to help?

A: The quickest and easiest way to help us right now is support us with your generous donation! We also welcome help in the following ways:

  1. Share this page with your family and friends, including a personal message describing why the campaign is important to you!
  2. Volunteer in our space. We are always looking for enthusiastic dreamers to support the work we do in a myriad of capacities. Email volunteer@dreamcenterharlem.org .
  3. Follow us on Twitter, Instagram, or Facebook and use the #HarlemVisionAcademy hashtag to spread the word about our campaign!

story:
What is the ChipStore Pi shield?

ChipStore Pi shield is a plug-in module designed to enable technical and non-technical users to kick-start ideas and turn them into reality. It regulates the GPIO logic voltage for Raspberry Pi and other brands pi boards*.

Our simple design leads to rapid product development by eliminating confusing procedures of connecting breadboard, ICs, resistors and clumsy wire connections with sensors and GPIO pins.

It allows seamless connection with multiple devices/sensors that interface with GPIOs enabling the user to quickly bring innovative ideas into reality.

We will provide support with code samples and configured software programs to Chipstore Pi shield users.

Being compatible with existing software libraries easily allows developers to make use of it in their projects. It connects directly onto the 40 pins GPIO header socket making the setup clean to work with.

What challenge does Pi shield solve?

Currently most ARM computer boards with GPIO header pins support 3.3V logic levels and can damage ARM computer board if connected directly to 5V levels. The ChipStore Pi Shield solves this challenge.

Our Pi Shield regulates logic voltage, so when sensors communicate with the board they operate properly. This will ultimately reduce the risk of damaging the boards due to over voltage, making projects more stable and reliable.

How it makes easy to work with sensors?

It eliminates confusing procedure of connecting breadboards with ICs, resistors and other components together to get the sensors to work properly. Our simple design leads to rapid project development as sensors connect directly to the shield.

Features:

  • Regulates logic voltage which allows user to connect sensors/devices directly to the shield's header input/outputs to get the expected result.
  • Compact and simple design with no need of ribbon cables, wires, additional ICs, and breadboard when connected via Pi shield IO pins.
  • Directly fits over 40 pin GPIO socket on the main board (multiple brands ARM processing boards supported see list below.)
  • Practical use in large-scale projects. 
  • Protects ARM boards with risk of over voltage damage; this could happen if peripherals are connected directly to GPIO headers where logic voltage is more than 3.3v. 
  • Compatible with existing code and software libraries, e.g. Wiring Pi library. 
  • Output headers placed at convenient border position for easy access.
  • Comes with an extra 40-pin header to stack other devices on top of the ChipStore Pi Shield, e.g. Audio shield.

What can you do with this product?

ChipStore Pi Shield can be used with multiple brands development boards like Raspberry Pi, Banana Pi, Odroid, Orange Pi, etc. It comes with output connectors with which you can directly connect sensors, relays, LEDs, a dedicated port for 3.3v I²C interface (two wire interface) sensors, an integrated stepper motor shield (support for 2 motors) and a 40-pin header to stack other device shields. 

The following is a list of compatible peripherals:

Most of these are available in perk packs


Some GPIO stackable devices:

  • Display LCD touchscreens (available in a perk pack)
  • HIFI Audio shield (available in a perk pack)
  • CAN-Bus shield
  • Relay shield
  • Arduino shield
  • Autopilot shield
  • LED matrix shield

Compatible ARM development boards (multiple models supported)

Software Support:

We will provide configured operating system for our supporters to install and use the shield quickly.

We will also provide code examples associated with commonly used sensors with GPIOs so user can quickly adapt them to their projects.

Users can use the software library compatible with GPIOs for the respective boards provided by manufacturers and 3rd party software developers.

All software files will be available on our website at following link:

ChipStore.us/index.php/code-and-software  

For ex: Wiring Pi library

Why we need your support:

  1. Prototypes are currently being tested thoroughly. As the results have been promising by far, we want to scale up the production so that Pi supporters and users can benefit.
  2. We are now working on the manufacturing process and part sourcing. With your support, we will get ChipStore Pi Shield manufactured in larger quantities reducing the cost to users - ultimately helping the developer community.
  3. Your support will help getting through the technical compliance certifications CE, FCC and RoHS.

Perks:

We have a large collection of perks that we have tailored for our supporters. Please check them out and grab what suits your needs the best. 

Perks in pictures below shows what supporters will receive.

We have all sensors, development boards and hobby electronics available on our secure eCommerce site as well. 

Chipstore.us

Timeline:

3-6 months

Note: Delivery time may vary a little bit depending on the location and compliance certification approval time, we will make our best effort to deliver on time.
Trademarks and Brands here are for representation purpose, they belong to their respective owners. 
Thank you very much for looking at our campaign.
Updates:
Good news our ChipStore Pi shield is compatible with newly released Raspberry Pi Zero.

story:
I would like to thank everyone who contributed to my original campaign, whether by donating money or sharing my page. 

There are a lot of amazing people out there who are ready to help, publicly or anonymously, while asking for nothing in return. They just believe in you and your right to get a better education. So thank you from the bottom of my heart!

Since I was not able to reach my original campaign's goal despite the very generous contributions I got, I created this page here: https://www.generosity.com/education-fundraising/nour-s-educational-fund-at-psu-part-2/x/12568693 as "part two" for the remaining amount I still need for my education at Portland State University, and am still hoping to raise the full amount required to travel to the United States and pay my first semester's tuition in advance, as required. Once I arrive, I am expected to start working on campus while pursing my studies in order to pay my own tuition and expenses. Your contributions would be a great push towards starting my new university life abroad.

Thank you!

Nour.





I live in a city under siege, were opportunities are severely lacking. I have had numerous chances to travel outside Gaza to show the world that *even girls living under siege and occupation can make a better change* under different conditions; however, I was unable to leave the Gaza Strip for many of these opportunities because of the blockade.

•  As examples of opportunities I was able to achieve, I has extended an invitation to meet with the Deputy US Consul in Jerusalem, where I was the youngest of several women who were asked to discuss the social situation in Gaza and how we can make things better. This invitation gave me the chance to see my capital city of Jerusalem for the first time in my 20 years of living under siege in Gaza, despite Jerusalem being less than 50 miles away. My other major accomplishment was that, during the summer of 2015, I attended a Middle East Partnership Initiative (MEPI) student leadership program in the United States for 6 weeks of training on how to be a good leader in society. I am now working on a project for this program concerning *violence against women*, which teaches young women about their importance in society and involves training them and familiarizing them with true-life stories of successful Palestinian women in order to motivate them. I intend to represent our project team at a conference for MEPI alumni put together by the US Consulate in Istanbul, Turkey, in March 2016.

•  However, I cannot forget other opportunities that I’ve lost because of the political situation on the Rafah border (normally the only exit point for Palestinians in Gaza). One such opportunity was that I was supposed to be the young female representative from Gaza at a conference for children who overcame adversities in Kenya in 2013; I was unable to leave the strip because the borders were closed despite having my visa. Moreover, I lost the chance to represent Palestinian young women at a “Women2Women” Harvard University conference in 2014 as I was unable to leave the Strip to reach Jerusalem and obtain my US visa stamp because of the Israeli war on Gaza that summer.

All of the things I have done, and still want to do, involve leadership and business, and I believe that I am a good spokeswoman. Despite the chances that I lost, I didn't and won't give up because a good leader never gives up, so I am not going to surrender my educational future of studying business administration at Portland State University. I am doing this for me, my family, and as a representative of my country with a goal towards a better future with freedom

Why am I doing this crowdfunding?

This is to help me move from Gaza City in Palestine to Portland State University in the US to study Business Administration – I am very serious about obtaining a better education. I have to pay the first term’s (Winter Term) tuition in advance; however, I also plan to start working on campus as an international student once I arrive. Some of the funds will cover my school fees after my arrival.

What will achieving my goal do?

•  Achieving my goal of collecting almost $7000 will help me restart my higher education properly. Since I finished high school, I attended two different colleges in Gaza; however, I had very limited choices at both institutions at every step, and it reached a point where I was at an academic dead-end, especially as this city lacks opportunities as I mentioned above. After I found a better institution of higher learning in the US during the MEPI program this past summer (watch my video above), I felt that I would be welcomed and supported.

•  Achieving my goal would make my parents, friends, and community proud of me as somebody who was able to obtain a higher education degree, which is one of the most important accomplishments of one’s life.

•  Finally, achieving my goal would be my only hope for a higher education, and I sacrificed a lot to make this dream come true and am really excited about beginning a new life far away from all the wars and the political situation that we live in. Obtaining a better education is all that matters, but if I do not achieve my funding goal by December, I will stuck with limited choices and won’t be able to do any of this.

How people can help?

I would really appreciate everyone’s help by supporting, donating, or sharing this web site with those who may be interested in helping.

PS: Please watch my video above where I explain myself and provide more details. Also, please find in the ‘Gallery’ page a scan of my admission offer from Portland State University in Oregon.

THANK YOU SO MUCH 

BEST 

NOUR 

GAZA - PALESTINE

story:
The Name "Team No Breaks" was coined about 2 years ago. Initially it was intended as  a 'Thank You' from Andrea Nettel to all the amazing people who have assisted her son, Alex Boettger, and with that her family. It was created in order to acknowledge all those who have, over the years, assisted with raising funds and investing their time and energy toAlex's cause. Over the past two years Team No Breaks has become synonymous for anyone who does amazing things with Alex or for Alex. 

Alex Boettger (14) is in need of funds in order to pay for his high school fees. He is permanently in a wheelchair due to Congenital Muscular Dystrophy.  This year we are hoping to raise double his school fee money i.e a total of R 64000 in order to also donate to organisations who are working towards making INCLUSIVE EDUCATION a reality in South Africa.

This year Team “NO Breaks” is made up of Andrea Nettel and Lee-Ann Dawson (friends for 18 years) and those who feel able to join them.
From 28th Nov – 11th Dec. 2015  they are going UP 14000 meters in 14 consecutive days. All 'runs' will take place in the Table Mountain and South Peninsula area. 

So why are they doing it?

Well, according to statistics up to 70% of children living with disabilities are NOT attending school! Why is that – because it is really really difficult to find support when your child does not fit the norm.

South Africa is forward thinking when it comes working on legislation to ensure that ALL children’s scholastic needs are being met. But unfortunately --- The reality is very different! It is hard! It is a challenge! And families struggle financially, emotionally and often even fall apart because of the stressors related to the lack of understanding in our society.

Team “NO Breaks” does challenges to highlight the ongoing struggles and difficulties that people living with disabilities and their families face!

Team “NO Breaks” does challenges to share our passion! Just because you are differently abled does not mean you need to be excluded from ANYTHING – having a disability does not mean you have to put the brakes on!

Team “NO Breaks” does challenges to honour the daily struggles of those living with Disabilities.

Team “NO Breaks” does challenges in order to raise funds so that we can start making a difference.

Help us breaking the bonds that society puts on those who are differently abled by donating towards the cause and clicking on the share button.

For updates and information you can find us on Facebook-https://www.facebook.com/groups/teamnobreaks/

Andrea Nettel is 46 year old single mum of two boys, Dylan (18) and Alex (14). After her marriage fell apart she decided to study and graduated as a Professional Counsellor at  Age 44. Just recently she was retrenched from her job and had no option but to start her own business in order to support her family.... so far so good. Glory to  the God for that!

Lee-Ann Dawson is 45, married and mother of 2 boys, Ashton (18) and Bryn (14). Lee-Ann has walked the past 18 years with Andrea and has been an intrigal part of Alex life too. Lee-Ann is a sports trainer and coach and is involved in uplifting the community through sport and movement.

story:
”Vi vill skapa träningspass och möten där DU mår bra inifrån ut." 

Dina bidrag gör att vi kan hyra en inspirerande lokal och genomföra MindClubs stora föreläsning den 27 april. Med ditt bidrag så är DU med och skapar en mötesplats för personlig utveckling och proaktiv träning för att må bra!






MindClub erbjuder MindShape som ett fristående pass. MindShape kan både vara
öppna för alla och också fungera som företagsworkshop.

Under ett MindShape pass får deltagarna öva sig inom ämnen som: Tacksamhet, Positiv Feedback, Aktivt lyssnande, Målsättning, Närvaro och Reflektion.

Ett vanligt Mindshape pass håller på i 90 minuter och är uppdelat på följande vis:
- Reflektionsövningar
- Mental övningar 
- Sammanfattande övning

MindShape är anpassat för upp till 20 deltagare

Efter MindClubs MindShape pass har deltagarna känt en närvaro och glädje. De djupa samtalen skapar en tillit och gemenskap som bidrar till att många deltagare lär sig nya saker om sig själva och om andra.

Limitless är ett program som hålls av David JP Phillips och Pamela von Sabljar.

Programmet har som uppgift att stärka din självkänsla och självförtroende och lär dig att se världen ur ett nytt perspektiv. Du utvecklar din medkänsla för dig själv och andra och tillsammans i gruppen skapar ni gemenskap, rutiner och uppföljning.

Med hjälp av Limitless kan du tillsammans med andra uppnå mer energi, nya spännande resultat och en själslig framgång. 

Workshopfilm


iTunes podcast, Acast för android podcast

MindClubs vision på sikt är att skapa en mötesplats för mental träning och personlig utveckling. En plats att mötas på och växa tillsammans, äta nyttig kost eller reflektera över olika utmaningar du står för. I starten av MindClub ritade vi upp visionen och alla vi träffade fick mycket lättare att förstå vad vi vill skapa på sikt. Här ser ni en konceptskiss.


Facebook - MindClub

Instagram - Mindclubse

story:
Kurzbeschreibung

Wir, die Abiturientia des Geschwister-Scholl Gymnasiums werden im Frühjahr nächsten Jahres unser Abitur absolvieren.


Zur Finanzierung der anstehenden Abiturfeierlichkeiten haben wir bereits in den vergangenen Monaten zahlreiche Aktionen selbstständig organisiert und durchgeführt.  Jedoch ist der Betrag für unseren Abiball für viele unserer Schüler kaum zu stemmen! 

Unsere Schule, das Geschwister-Scholl Gymnasium steht bereits seit 40 Jahren für Toleranz, Interkulturalität und eine vielfältig engagierte Schülerschaft.

Aufgrund unseres Standorts in einem der "Problembezirke" Münsters hat unsere Schule leider oft mit Vorurteilen zu kämpfen, weshalb die Sponsoren Suche besonders schwer ist!

Auch kommen viele unserer Mitschüler aus weniger wohlhabenden Familien und können deshalb die Finanzierung unseres Abiturs kaum ausgleichen!


Deshalb brauchen wir Ihre Hilfe!

Die Einnahmen aus dieser Kampagne würden zu 100% in die Miete für die Räumlichkeiten unseres Abiballs fließen!

Wir suchen also nicht nach spenden für unnötige Extras!!


Es wäre unvorstellbar wenn einige wenige uns ein wenig bei unseren Bemühungen unterstützen würden!

Wenn Sie kein Geld zur Verfügung haben so würden wir uns dennoch freuen, wenn sie unsere Kampagne hier über das dafür vorgesehene Tool teilen würden.


Beste Grüße  aus Münsters Norden!


Ihr Abiturienten des Geschwister-Scholl-Gymnasiums 2016

Kurzbeschreibung



Wir, die Abiturientia des Geschwister-Scholl Gymnasiums werden im Frühjahr
nächsten Jahres unser Abitur absolvieren. 

Zur Finanzierung der anstehenden Abiturfeierlichkeiten haben wir bereits in den
vergangenen Monaten zahlreiche Aktionen selbstständig organisiert und durchgeführt.  Jedoch ist der Betrag für unseren Abiball für viele unserer Schüler kaum zu stemmen! 

Unsere Schule, das Geschwister-Scholl Gymnasium steht
bereits seit 40 Jahren für Toleranz,
Interkulturalität und eine vielfältig engagierte Schülerschaft. 
Aufgrund unseres Standorts in einem der "Problembezirke" Münsters hat unsere Schule leider oft mit Vorurteilen zu kämpfen, weshalb die Sponsoren Suche besonders schwer ist!
Auch kommen viele unserer Mitschüler aus weniger wohlhabenden Familien und können deshalb die Finanzierung unseres Abiturs kaum ausgleichen!

Deshalb brauchen wir Ihre Hilfe!
Die Einnahmen aus dieser Kampagne würden zu 100% in die Miete für die Räumlichkeiten unseres Abiballs fließen!
Wir suchen also nicht nach spenden für unnötige Extras!!

Es wäre unvorstellbar wenn einige wenige uns ein wenig bei unseren Bemühungen unterstützen würden!
Wenn Sie kein Geld zur Verfügung haben so würden wir uns dennoch freuen, wenn sie unsere Kampagne hier über das dafür vorgesehene Tool teilen würden.

Beste Grüße  aus Münsters Norden!

Ihr Abiturienten des Geschwister-Scholl-Gymnasiums 2016

story:
Green ABCs is a sustainable school supplies company that has been qualified and successfully certified as a BCorporation operating in New York, New York.   We use the latest innovations to create high-quality products made from recycled materials, renewable resources and innovations to help reduce our use of natural resources in schools and teach the next generation about sustainability in the products we use everyday. 

$7B is spent each year on school supplies by the parents and teachers of the 50M students, bridging the challenging gap between classroom needs and funding realities.  In the US one out of five children live in poverty and in New York City more than 250,000 children in our public school system live at or below the poverty line. The parents and teachers of these low-income students struggle to meet the basic classroom supply needs and we want to help.  

As a school supply company we are often contacted by organizations, schools and individuals for support.  As a start-up company the importance of supporting communities and creating a positive impact in our community is core to our vision.  We hope to inspire a green revolution in our schools and make sustainable products the new normal.

Green ABCs is joining #GivingTuesday to match every dollar donated this holiday and provide $10,000 worth of school supplies to schools in need.   We are working with the Department of Education through a non-profit organization called Fund For Public Schools to donate the school supplies to schools across New York City.

story:
I am a teacher advisor to a group of talented individuals who get together to work on robotics challenges.

Our current challenge is a competition run by Skills Canada where we've been given the task of making a robot that can assemble a boat.

So far, my students have gotten a large segment of our bot built and running, as well as some parts and plans for the rest of it. They are also working on some autonomous elements which would make the robot more efficient. 

They produce all their own parts using 3D Printing, CNC Routing and in the metal shop.  They are creating their own circuits and writing their own software. The competition is in May, so it seems that they're well on our way. It's a lot of work.  They have put in about 500 hours so far.

As this is the first year for building the robot, we have had a lot of expenses. Tools and equipment and materials cost a lot of money.

If you agree that robotics is worth pursuing, and would like to be part of this opportunity to improve education, to foster young people who know how to work well in high-tech fields, all of us from the robotics team, strongly encourage you to help us in whatever way you can.
