story:
We need to stop incarcerating people who are yet to be found guilty of crime. 

What's the problem?

Pretrial detention, that is, the incarceration of a person accused of committing a crime before she is found guilty by a court, serves a lawful purpose whenever a court considers the indictee poses a real threat of absconding and/or destroying evidence, threatening witnesses or the like. It is meant to be used as a measure of last resort and thus exceptionally.

Unfortunately, in a system with little to no resort to bail, in Peru prolonged incarceration of indictees while their case moves through the system is the norm. This means months or years imprisoned before conviction. The consequences are several and dire on many levels: detention severely hinders a defendants' capabilities to confront the charges against her; it severs her ties to her family, community, job. Detainees are held in prisons undistinguished from already convicted and/or serious offenders, forcing them to develop a criminal skill set just to survive inside - which then is used for further criminality upon release. As is usually the case, those hit the hardest by this are low-income defendants, which comprise the bulk of criminal cases in all judicial districts around the country. 

What do you suggest we do?

There are a few things we can do:

1. Produce a risk-evaluation protocol for prosecutors and judges. This would push them into ruling on the need for pretrial detention based on data and objective criteria and not the seriousness of the offence or the indictee's looks. The Judiciary has agreed to cooperate and try it but have no funds to pay for it. 

2. Train journalists on procedural law basics and pretrial detention in particular. This will also help the general public understand why not immediately incarcerating an indictee does not mean impunity. The press is powerful in reshaping perception and guiding public opinion.

3. Provide judges with data on the effectiveness of alternatives to pretrial detention, such as bail, periodic monitoring of activities, rules of behaviour. If they know these work, they will use them. Right now they are in the dark about all but detention. That is also a reason why they tend to only use that and nothing else. 

Who's 'we'? 

My name is Gabriel Chávez-Tafur. I am a researcher with an LLM degree (Geneva, Switzerland) and specialised on pretrial justice issues. I live in Peru and have produced or contributed with publications tackling the abuse of pretrial detention in Peru - (available here and here). I recently produced this infographic to help journalists understand what pretrial detention should and shouldn't be used for. It's available to anyone for free. The last three years I worked as programme manager for the Instituto de Defensa Legal - a local NGO. Before that and moving (back) to Peru I worked for a few years as jurist for the International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) in Geneva HQ.  

Who would ever want to fund this?

I know. And that's precisely the problem. Only sound research can produce the policies that can change our world for the better. Unfortunately only a handful of organisations fund research in Peru. On the upside, it is relatively cheap to do a lot: 15,000$ covers a full year's work!

I know this is a long shot - but who knows. Maybe just maybe the right person happens to find this and decides it's worth a shot. Maybe that person is you!

Impact

Funding research sounds like a boring enterprise that will only produce minimum impact on reality and in 20 years' time. Perhaps that's true of some social research, but not here. Convincing only a few judges to use an objective tool to evaluate risk is proved to create a multiplier effect whereby prosecutors start shaping their presentations to fit the criteria, and defence attorneys spend the little time and resources they have also on the criteria that will then weigh the most. When looks or intuition are replaced by data, only those who should be incarcerated will be, and those that don't, well, won't. Justice is more effective. Everyone benefits from it.

Something similar can be said of training journalists. The first group takes home all the tools that then enables each of them train their colleagues back home in turn. With an initial group of 15 you can reach a target audience of 150 easily.    

Other Ways You Can Help

Surely not everyone can or cares enough to contribute. Still, please consider spreading the word, share this with friends or that really nice, wealthy uncle who wants to give back to the world but doesn't know how.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Victor Odhiambo. I am a Christian, first born in a family of 5, and I grew up in Kibera, the second largest urban slum in Africa.  Growing in Kibera, life was tough. I keenly remember spending months at home because my parents could not afford to pay my school fees or even basic school needs. Not being able to attend school, however, is not just a story that belongs to me, but to many who grow up in Kibera.  Fortunately, God sent a generous, open-hearted individual who would later pay all of my high school and college fees. 

Many young people in the slums who have great dreams never achieve them because of poverty or broken families. You could be instrumental in making their dreams possible today! GARDEN OF HOPE FOUNDATION's vision is to become the premiere youth leadership development organization in marginalized communities.  

Through our leadership, development and entrepreneurship programs, we aim to train students who finish high school, but who do not have the ability to attend universities or colleges. Garden of Hope also offers them internship opportunities, giving them various skills to carry with them throughout their lives. 


What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking to raise $7,000. This will cater for:

1. Training 20 students on Entrepreneurship and Leadership skills 

2. Facilitation fee

3. Transport and food during their internship with the organization

3. Training materials and

4. Emergency needs

If you donate:

$10 – You get a personalized Garden of Hope Pen

$20 – You get a Garden of Hope Notebook + Pen

$25 – You get a Garden of Hope Mug

$30 – You get a Garden of Hope T-Shirt

$50 – You get a Garden of Hope Pen + Notebook + Mug

$100 – You get a Garden of Hope Pen + Notebook + Mug + T-shirt

$500 – You get a branded Garden of Hope Pen + Notebook + Mug + T-shirt + a HUGE THANK YOU from Garden of Hope Foundation!


The Impact

This project will help many students who cannot afford to attend university or college start their own businesses and save for school. It will also reduce the financial burden in their families. Equipped with information and experience learned from Garden of Hope Foundation, they can apply for jobs and create jobs through their businesses, reducing the rate of unemployment of young people in Kenya. Idle youths tend to become involved in drugs, robbery, etc. Our aim is to reduce this by providing a safe and secure environment for them. 

Risks & Challenges

Garden of Hope Foundation works in marginalized communities, meaning that security is occasionally a challenge. Some areas require hiring the police to accompany us. Other areas are difficult due to poor roads, requiring certain cars, such as a Land Cruiser, to be used. This requires greater funding for projects such as this

Other Ways You Can Help

Kindly consider sharing our story with your friends and families. If you have any training materials, consider sharing them with us. For more info click here Garden of Hope Foundation or learn more about our work on our YouTube Chanel Twitter Handle and Facebook

story:
About Formula Hybrid

Formula hybrid is part of the Society of Automotive Engineers (SAE) Collegiate Design Series and is regarded as the most complex and dynamic of the series. Students are tasked to design, build and create a hybrid vehicle (roughly 1/3 of the size of an actual F1 race car) which will compete against teams from all over the world. The project is also an academic assessment for 4th year mechanical engineering students, although the team consists of undergrad and graduate students. The team has registered to compete in Loudon, New Hampshire USA on May 2-5, 2016 and would appreciate any form of, and all the support it can get.

About The Competition

The Formula Hybrid Competition is an interdisciplinary design and engineering challenge for undergraduate and graduate university students. They must work collaboratively to design and build a formula-style electric or plug-in hybrid race car and compete in a series of events that put to the test different aspects of the vehicle’s design, capabilities, potentials, and the quality of engineering and innovation put into it. This educational competition emphasizes on drivetrain innovation, fuel efficiency and the use of an alternate source of fuel to build a greener high performance racer. Engineering a hybrid provides an unparalleled interdisciplinary hands-on experience that encourages students to innovate across mechanical, electrical, and computer engineering disciplines. Hybrid drivetrains present greater challenges as the goal is to piece together a car from scratch that runs on a combustion engine as well as an electric motor in harmony with each other to deliver the most effective and efficient amount power possible. Several engineering companies and most of the world’s major automotive manufacturers support Formula Hybrid due to the high quality of engineers it has helped develop, who have learned to work outside of their chosen disciplines, as a team in unison and bring out the best of themselves and others around them.

Lancer Motorsports/SAE Chapter at the University of Windsor aims to compete in the Formula Hybrid event for the very FIRST time, next year (2016). This is a challenge for the team that will be conquered through the vision, dedicated hard work and perseverance portrayed by passionate, enthusiastic and determined students coming together to make the dream come alive.

What We Need & What You Get

We are converting a few parts like the chassis (though modified) from our 2012 Formula SAE Vehicle to build the Formula Hybrid. Also, we’ll be adding batteries, two electric motors, a different internal combustion engine and making adjustments to the frame, suspension and other areas of the car in order to meet with the regulations defined by the rulebook.

Our budget for the project is $25,000 and majority of that goes towards the batteries and the hybrid powertrain. Every donor will have their name printed on the battery housing fiberglass sidewall as shown below:


The Impact

The Impact

SAE (Society of Automotive Engineers) has always been a profound experience for every Engineer at University of Windsor. Students get to make the first hybrid vehicle and compete against several institutions from around the world and leave a legacy. With the implementation of the SAE Chapter in May 2015, there has been a huge increase in the interest of engineering students. 

Let us explain. For the longest time, being a part any SAE team was only sought out as a 4th year project and was only "closely" known about. Engineers from different years were unaware that they could represent their University by helping out the Collegiate Design Series teams. With the implementation of the SAE Chapter, students from both undergrad and graduate degree programs are welcome to be part of several amazing teams (Aero, Baja, Formula, Snowmobile, Supermileage and the new Formula Hybrid). They are introduced to workshop environments where they learn the essential skills (machining, welding, CAD etc.) to build a vehicle.

University of Windsor is well known for its automotive program in Ontario and this project would not only open opportunities to not only future students but inspire other Canadian universities to participate as well. University of Windsor has never had a Formula Hybrid team and has the urge to compete in a category that hasn’t been done before. The Formula Team has gotten a lot of support from the Engineering Faculty and has come up with the following timeline:

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate all support we can get and even supposing, unfortunately, you are unable to contribute to the cause we would be extremely grateful if you could share this with your friends and family who could help us out.

story:
Short Summary

Ithembalethu means I have a destiny.  The vision of Ithembalethu - a transition home in Durban, South Africa is to restore destiny to orphaned/ abandoned babies and children whose futures are at risk of being negatively impacted by the effects of HIV/AIDS. Sadly, the prevalence of HIV in South Africa is highest in KwaZulu-Natal with almost 28% of the population testing positive. The devastating impact on the lives of the children born into HIV families is visible everywhere with the rate of abandonment as high as 3500 babies abandoned each year. More often than not, these little lives are abandoned in toilets, gutters, drains, parks and rubbish dumps. The Ithembalethu transition home provides a sanctuary for these little lives with the goal of finding each child a new "forever family"

What We Need & What You Get

My objective with this campaign is to help fund a house mother. These angels take on the role of nurturing, loving and caring for all the babies and children in their care until a new forever family is found for them. As a mom myself, I know only too well what an around the clock job this is. These ladies earn £150 a month ( yes that's right - £150 a month), an amount that might equate to a big night out for some of us. My goal is to raise enough money to provide the salary for 1 house mother in 2016. That gives me 60 days to raise £1800 - I'd like to think we could actually double that with a bit of effort! 

Whats the impact? How will you know you've made a difference? 

When I first visited Ithembalethu in August this year I met a little boy of 3 whose name is Keke (said Ke Ke). He and his sister Nomvula (2 years) were abandoned by their mother in a flat in town. The caretaker of the block found the children after a couple of days and assuming mum would return, opted to keep an eye on them. 2 months later they were handed over to social workers after it was clear that mum had no intention of coming back for them. Stories like this are commonplace with many others simply abandoned from birth.
There are currently 10 children in the care of Ithembalethu and hundreds more that need to be there. They have facilitated 88 adoptions in the last 14 years and reunited 24 babies with extended family members. Your small donation will go a long way to creating a destiny for children like Keke & Nomvula and that starts with giving them a mum. My request is simple. Ask yourself what a big night out would cost you. This month - decide to  donate what you might spend on that big night out . Decide instead to stay in, make some popcorn and tune into the movie channel. In doing so - you will have just made a very big difference in a very little persons life.

The devastating impact on the lives of the children born into HIV families is visible everywhere with the rate of abandonment as high as 3500 babies abandoned each year. More often than not, these little lives are abandoned in toilets, gutters, drains, parks and rubbish dumps. The Ithembalethu transition home provides a sanctuary for these little lives with the goal of finding each child a new "forever family"   What We Need & What You Get
My objective with this campaign is to help fund a house mother. These angels take on the role of nurturing, loving and caring for all the babies and children in their care until a new forever family is found for them. As a mom myself, I know only too well what an around the clock job this is. These ladies earn £150 a month ( yes that's right - £150 a month), an amount that might equate to a big night out for some of us. My goal is to raise enough money to provide the salary for 1 house mother in 2016. That gives me 60 days to raise £1800 - I'd like to think we could actually double that with a bit of effort!    Whats the impact? How will you know you've made a difference? 
When I first visited Ithembalethu in August this year I met a little boy of 3 whose name is Keke (said Ke Ke). He and his sister Nomvula (2 years) were abandoned by their mother in a flat in town. The caretaker of the block found the children after a couple of days and assuming mum would return, opted to keep an eye on them. 2 months later they were handed over to social workers after it was clear that mum had no intention of coming back for them. Stories like this are commonplace with many others simply abandoned from birth.
There are currently 10 children in the care of Ithembalethu and hundreds more that need to be there. They have facilitated 88 adoptions in the last 14 years and reunited 24 babies with extended family members. Your small donation will go a long way to creating a destiny for children like Keke & Nomvula and that starts with giving them a mum. My request is simple. Ask yourself what a big night out would cost you. This month - decide to  donate what you might spend on that big night out . Decide instead to stay in, make some popcorn and tune into the movie channel. In doing so - you will have just made a very big difference in a very little persons life.

story:
About Restoration Home Orphanage:

Rev Dr Lal Rodinga Colney's orphanage has been operating for 10 years. It is situated in Cuttack, Orissa - one of the poorest parts of India - it accommodates boys aged between 3 and 17. These are mainly abandoned street children or destitute and homeless boys who were rejected by parents. Some of them lost their fathers and mothers who died in the violent wave of persecution against Christians in Orissa three years ago. Others are orphans with no other means of support. 

The orphanage is committed towards the development and empowerment of underprivileged children of India. 

Also each day they feed 100+ street children and teach them basic health and hygiene.

For more information about the orphanage visit the Restoration Church webpage.


What we'll be doing

In Feb/March 2016 Ruth, Marie, Zohern and myself will be going to Cuttack for two to three weeks to help in the Restoration Home Orphanage and with the street children that come during the day. We are hoping to be able to tie in a 3 day training session for evangelists and leaders working with new churches in the villages.

The orphanage greatest need is for a plot of land and to improve the infrastructure of the building. Additionally they need a kitchen and dining space. Therefore any money raised on top of the cost of the trip will be put towards this need. 

This is a self financed trip so any support you can give would be greatly appreciated. I am really excited that this opportunity has come up for me, and I am particularly keep on working with the street children.

Thank you :) 

Registered charity number: 1107952

story:
Many aspiring and jaw-dropping projects here at Indiegogo are tech projects that have shaped our lives in many ways. Most of these projects involves individuals who were once beginners and students of electronics that were now tech developers, programmers and engineers. This project is not as big as these projects, though you may find it useful as your first steps in being the next great innovator, in building your next world changing projects.

Hi! I'm Joseph and I've made a starter cheat sheet posters in learning electronics. I want to make visual materials accessible, easier and presentable for  beginners. Supposedly, it's a hobby project for personal use but I've decided to share it with everyone who might find them interesting and useful.

Why Make a Reference Poster?

Posters are some of the most convenient and accessible way of showing and acquiring information. I always find it hard to remember and memorize component pin-outs, shortcuts and codes even those which are extremely basic. Scanning books and notes consumes a bit of time. I, myself prefer to sketch/print and post them in front of my work desk to always recall them and retain my learning.

As a college student, I've also managed to work part-time for US clients as home-based freelance illustrator and graphic designer. My passion for electronics and illustrations are the two skills that helped me come up with this simple reference project.

What's Included in the TinkrPostrs?

I've designed 2 reference posters: Fundamentals and Schematics. Only the most commonly used but often forgotten contents were prioritized and included in the posters. I've researched on several books and over the internet regarding which information are commonly used. Here's a closer look at the posters and what contents have been included:

Fundamentals Reference Poster
Ohm's Law - Resistor Color Coding - Capacitor Color Coding - American Wire Gauge (AWG) - Diodes and Transistors - Electrical Units - Metric Prefixes - SMDs (Surface Mount Devices) - Basic LM78XX Regulator - Common Opamps - 555 IC Pinouts

Schematics Reference Poster
Sources / Ground Symbols - Resistor Symbols - Capacitor Symbols - Inductor Symbols - Meter Symbols - Electromechanical Devices - Diode Symbols - Transistor Symbols - Logic Symbols - Miscellaneous Symbols

2-IN-1 BIGGR POSTR
The Fundamentals and Schematics Reference Posters combined into a single 24" x 36" poster at a lesser price.

Framed Posters

Optional: If you'd like to make it as a wall deco, you could add some frame to  make them even more stunning.

How this Poster Could Help You?

  • Organized, optimized, accessible essential referencing, saves time and effort
  • Best for beginners, students, hobbyists, techies, educators and even on developers and engineers level
  • Made of high quality posters to be awesomely printed in L.A. at Printful
  • Well designed so that you can display it in your bench lab, study desk, office or even at your own home
* These cheat sheet posters neither teach electronics nor alternatives to textbooks and references. These are only quick references to assist you in learning and not to be considered as tutorials.

Perks: Here's what you can get

Anyone who will be having at least one poster will be able to see their names at the bottom left of the posters. How cool is that?

Shipping & Delivery

Important: Add the corresponding fee/s to your contribution upon checkout using a separate "no perk" contribution to avoid any hassle. Shipping fee accumulates for different product types to be ordered on a single order.

Worldwide Shipping Available! Your learning companion has never been more accessible anywhere in the world.

For STARTR POSTR (18" x 24") and 2-IN-1 BIGGR POSTRS (24" x 36")
US $10, Canada $15, Rest of the world $18
No additional fee for additional posters

For FRAMED STARTR POSTR:
US $15 (Add $5 per additional poster)
Canada $45 (Add $20 per additional poster)
Rest of the world $65 (Add $30 per additional poster)

For FRAMED 2-IN-1 BIGGR POSTR:
US $20 (Add $10 per additional poster)
Canada $60 (Add $40 per additional poster)
Rest of the world $80 (Add $60 per additional poster)

For Shirts:
US $8, Canada $10, Rest of the world $12
(Add $1 per additional shirt)

Perks delivery will be started on June 2015. Some posters will be delivered earlier or later depending on your location. Will keep you updated from time to time in cases of some delays in your orders.

What Needs To Be Done?

The contents of the posters are not yet final. Everyone is very welcome to check for the technical contents, recommend modifications and other errors. If you see any issues or you'd like to add something on the posters, kindly note it in the comments section.
Risks & Challenges

One of the challenges that we may encounter is in maintaining the output of the printed materials. Since the posters will be printed and shipped from abroad, I will keep on monitoring and double check if the materials are being printed accurately and in high quality. I will request photos from the printer company from time to time and ask some samples of the actual products being printed.

Spread the Word: Other Ways You Can Help

Even you're not into electronics, you may still be able to help. Let know your friends, co-workers, bosses and relatives who might find this project helpful and interesting to them. Share it through Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Pinterest, Email and other means of spreading the word through the social media bar at the top.

posters, kindly note it in the comments section.

I will request photos from the printer company from time to time and ask some samples of the actual products being printed.

story:
How are you?  We are inviting you to become a part of a great and exciting historical preservation and education project.

  • How?
 

I am Fred Staff, and I have lived in Bolivia for the past eight years.  I have taught history and social studies for over 25 years. I love the little-known stories that make up this country and was so impressed with Potosi, Bolivia, that my first historical novel was set there.

The more I learned about the city the more I knew that the story had to be made available  to all students and lovers of history. There is also some urgency to our product, as it is estimated that THE RICH MOUNTAIN will soon collapse, due to the hundreds of years of honeycombing in search of its riches. 

 Potosi's role in European and American history has been for too long over looked. It has been designated by UNESCO as a WORLD HERITAGE CENTER, but still is little known.   My goal is to make its amazing story available to all by producing at least three videos of approximately 30 minutes in length, in order to fit with classroom time.

My team consists of:

1. A three-person camera crew from JaqueCreativa;

2.Brian Dott, an interpreter and subtitle specialist; 

3.MicaelaZeballos, a tourism specialist; 

4.Igor ReyneldsLizarazu, a civil engineer and a native of Potosi;

5. William Camacho, a Potosi coin collector and expert on the mining and history of Potosi; and,

6. Dr. Jack Scammahorn, a retired professor who will discuss several points of early Spanish and Inca history, giving the viewer a better understanding of how the city developed and why many of the things happened.

7. Nelson Sanchez graphic designer and the designer of all the books that I have produced to date.

8, Daniel Oropeza an attorney in Potosi who is an expert on the history of the city and also a coin collector.

We will spend at least seven days shooting all of the unbelievable sites and at least five days editing the project.

Due to the difficulty of travel to Potosi — it is a twelve-hour bus trip — we will fly from Cochabamba to Potosi, and I will house the team in reasonable quarters. We will eat at reasonable restaurants, as well as eat local foods.  It will be necessary for us to hire a local, small bus for transportation.  We will also make a four-hour trip to the site of Simon Patino's first mine and museum to present the story of how a man of mixed blood and poor background became one of the richest men in the world.

I have personally paid for several minutes of video featuring one of the world's best  coin collections from the Potosi mint.

I am determined that this project will be completed.  We have raised some of the funds and will start production as soon as we reach another 700 dollars.  If we should surpass our request, we will use the funds to start our second documentary series on the Uyuni, classified as a place from another planet and the world’s largest salt flat, containing more than 70 percent of the world’s lithium. 

The finished project will be available on YouTube, and copies of the series will be sent to any public or private school that any contributor wants to designate.  I have selected five university history departments where I will send the series with instructions that they can duplicate as many copies as they wish to distribute to high school history instructors.

story:
Overview of the project

My name is Rachel Jimenez, and I am the pianist and piano teacher behind this project. I live in Brooklyn, NY where I have been running a successful classical piano teaching studio for over 10 years. I teach 40 students per week ranging from beginner to advanced and from ages 5 to 65. I did my undergraduate studies at New England Conservatory  in Boston and got my Master of Music degree from Yale University School of Music. My degrees are in classical piano performance.

The purpose of this Indiegogo campaign is to raise support for the completion of a new edition of my classical piano teaching method, Fundamental Keys. 

What is Fundamental Keys?

I developed the original edition of Fundamental Keys in 2009 in order to fill a gap in the world of music education. I wanted to create a new way of teaching beginners of any age that would lead seamlessly into serious classical studies. Fundamental Keys teaches the basics of reading music quickly and efficiently using a well-respected, modern pedagogical approach (landmarks & intervals), and then, within a relatively short period of time, the student begins to play elementary level classical pieces. There is no other piano method I know of that deals with the beginning phase quite the same way. There is a complete absence of cartoons, and there are no songs with lyrics. This is because of my interest in teaching in a way that leads seamlessly into the study of classical repertoire. Fundamental Keys is a more rigorous approach that encourages students to take music seriously and strive to reach their full potential -- contrary to the popular methods today that seem to lead more naturally into playing the piano as a casual pursuit.

The original version is a 130+ page book taking students from the very beginning up to what I consider intermediate-level classical repertoire. I have used the book very successfully with my own students of all ages over the past 5 years, I've gotten lots of positive feedback from pianists and piano students all around the world, and I am convinced that its approach is a great way for both children and adults to get a strong foundation in music. My students get consistently high marks on the very challenging national assessments given by the Royal Conservatory's Music Development Program. When kids get this kind of serious instruction early on, most become great fans of classical music, and I believe this approach could lead to more professional classical musicians and concert-goers in the future. This style of music education has the potential to raise the level of interest in classical music in the future.

Right now, Fundamental Keys is in a transitional stage. In early 2014, I started to think about ways in which it could be improved. I decided that certain concepts needed to be explained and drilled more thoroughly, and I found more great classical repertoire that I wanted to work on with my own beginning students. I have decided to create a new edition broken up into 3 volumes, each approximately 60 pages in length. I also want to make a professionally produced video series that would be a major improvement over the home-made videos I started creating in 2009. Finally, this time around, I want to use Amazon.com as the printer and distributor.

Current status

As of now, Book 1 of the new 3-volume series is complete and available for purchase online at Amazon.com. It sold 35 copies in its first two weeks, so I'm confident there is a lot of interest in this project. Book 1 consists of original material, created by me to prepare students for studying elementary classical pieces starting with Book 2. 

I will be recording the videos to go with that first book at the end of this month (January 2015). I have hired the talented Abhita Austin of Hidden Chapel Studios to do the filming.

I am hard at work compiling and formatting the content for Book 2 and Book 3. They will be centered around pieces by classical composers and include theory, music history, and music appreciation content.

Funding needs

I have already spent quite a bit to get this new version of Fundamental Keys off the ground. Expenses incurred so far total about $5,000 and include:

  • The purchase of a new computer.
  • The purchase of various software packages for: music notation, graphics creation, desktop publishing, and video editing.
  • The purchase of several volumes of sheet music and guides to repertoire graded by difficulty level so I can be thorough in my research.
The expenses coming down the line mostly have to do with video production. It is important to produce high-quality videos to go with Fundamental Keys. Videos are essential to self-directed adult learners, and that is a demographic that has already shown great interest in and great success with my method. Videos would also be very helpful for teachers interested in using my method with their students. My plan is to offer the books and videos to teachers at minimal cost in order to encourage wider adoption of the method. 

The cost for filming all three sets of videos will be approximately $1,500, and the cost for the portion of the editing job that will be done by the film-maker will be approximately $3,000. I need  the film-maker to do the bulk of the editing, because if I had to do it all myself, I just couldn't get it done in any reasonable amount of time with all my other commitments. It would be a shame for people to have to wait months or years after each book was released to be able to get the videos. 

So, in all, the cost of the project is in the neighborhood of $10,000 not including marketing. I would love to be able to market the method in music education magazines and online. Even with great success, it is unlikely that I would make that amount back in the first few years of it being on the market, and that is where Indiegogo, and you, come in.

Your Role

Indiegogo makes it very easy for you to lend your support. Select the amount you'd like to donate, choose a perk if you would like one, and enter your credit/debit card details. That's it! Only takes a minute!

Without support from generous backers, I will not be able to get the videos done. I simply do not have the time and resources to do all the work on my own, and this past year has brought some unforeseen personal expenses (related to the health of a family member) that have made it impossible for me to put any more money into this project up front. Without the videos, the books will be of very limited benefit to self-directed adults, and it will be harder to convince teachers to switch to the Fundamental Keys method.

Without support, I will not be able to market the method online and in music education magazines and journals. I think this kind of marketing will be very important to its success.

If you are an adult beginner interested in Fundamental Keys for your personal use, the perks I offer will be great for you. At the $50 and $150 levels, you are essentially just pre-ordering Fundamental Keys.

If you are a piano teacher with a classical background, support Fundamental Keys  so that you will have access to a unique and effective way to teach your students.

If you have young children that you would like to enroll in piano lessons, I believe the best thing you could do for their development is to support Fundamental Keys  and urge their teacher to use it.

If you love classical music, support Fundamental Keys to give more kids the opportunity to learn to play the piano in a way that will foster an appreciation and love for classical music.

I hope the perks I am offering will give you even more reason to partner with me  in this endeavor! But remember, contributing any amount also comes with the satisfaction of being a part of bringing this dream of mine to fruition.

Here is what I will be able to accomplish depending on how much I raise (taking into account processing fees):

  • $1,600: I'll be able to produce the videos for Book 1.
  • $3,200: I'll also be able to produce the Book 2 videos.
  • $4,800: I'll be able to produce videos for the whole series.
  • $7,500: I'll also be able to market the method extensively in print and online, and even attend a national music teacher's conference to promote it. 
  • over $7,500: Anything "extra" will be put back into the project somehow -- more marketing, software development, wider distribution, etc.
I'm making the project goal $7,500, but I also chose "Flexible Funding". That means whatever support I get (even if I don't get to the goal) will be able to go towards making Fundamental Keys as successful as possible. But, the more I raise, the more successful the project will be, and if you've read this far, you obviously want to see it succeed, so.............................

Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out!   Whether you can contribute monetarily or not, please  share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, on web forums, by email, by phone, by snail mail. Tell your friends, family, and anyone you know of who might be interested in the future of classical music. Small amounts from lots of people can make this project a huge success! Let's make it to the goal so that Fundamental Keys can be as great as it can be and so people around the world will hear about it!

THANK YOU FOR YOUR INTEREST!!!

This is because of my interest in teaching in a way that leads seamlessly into the study of classical repertoire. Fundamental Keys is a more rigorous approach that encourages students to take music seriously and strive to reach their full potential -- contrary to the popular methods today that seem to lead more naturally into playing the piano as a casual pursuit.The original version is a 130+ page book taking students from the very beginning up to what I consider intermediate-level classical repertoire. I have used the book very successfully with my own students of all ages over the past 5 years, I've gotten lots of positive feedback from pianists and piano students all around the world, and I am convinced that its approach is a great way for both children and adults to get a strong foundation in music. My students get consistently high marks on the very challenging national assessments given by the Royal Conservatory's Music Development Program. When kids get this kind of serious instruction early on, most become great fans of classical music, and I believe this approach could lead to more professional classical musicians and concert-goers in the future. This style of music education has the potential to raise the level of interest in classical music in the future.Right now, Fundamental Keys is in a transitional stage. In early 2014, I started to think about ways in which it could be improved. I decided that certain concepts needed to be explained and drilled more thoroughly, and I found more great classical repertoire that I wanted to work on with my own beginning students. I have decided to create a new edition broken up into 3 volumes, each approximately 60 pages in length. I also want to make a professionally produced video series that would be a major improvement over the home-made videos I started creating in 2009. Finally, this time around, I want to use Amazon.com as the printer and distributor.Current statusAs of now, Book 1 of the new 3-volume series is complete and available for purchase online at Amazon.com. It sold 35 copies in its first two weeks, so I'm confident there is a lot of interest in this project. Book 1 consists of original material, created by me to prepare students for studying elementary classical pieces starting with Book 2. I will be recording the videos to go with that first book at the end of this month (January 2015). I have hired the talented Abhita Austin of Hidden Chapel Studios to do the filming.I am hard at work compiling and formatting the content for Book 2 and Book 3. They will be centered around pieces by classical composers and include theory, music history, and music appreciation content.
Funding needs
I have already spent quite a bit to get this new version of Fundamental Keys off the ground. Expenses incurred so far total about $5,000 and include:

The purchase of a new computer.
The purchase of various software packages for: music notation, graphics creation, desktop publishing, and video editing.
The purchase of several volumes of sheet music and guides to repertoire graded by difficulty level so I can be thorough in my research.

The expenses coming down the line mostly have to do with video production. It is important to produce high-quality videos to go with Fundamental Keys. Videos are essential to self-directed adult learners, and that is a demographic that has already shown great interest in and great success with my method. Videos would also be very helpful for teachers interested in using my method with their students. My plan is to offer the books and videos to teachers at minimal cost in order to encourage wider adoption of the method. 
The cost for filming all three sets of videos will be approximately $1,500, and the cost for the portion of the editing job that will be done by the film-maker will be approximately $3,000. I need  the film-maker to do the bulk of the editing, because if I had to do it all myself, I just couldn't get it done in any reasonable amount of time with all my other commitments. It would be a shame for people to have to wait months or years after each book was released to be able to get the videos. 
So, in all, the cost of the project is in the neighborhood of $10,000 not including marketing. I would love to be able to market the method in music education magazines and online. Even with great success, it is unlikely that I would make that amount back in the first few years of it being on the market, and that is where Indiegogo, and you, come in.

Your Role
Indiegogo makes it very easy for you to lend your support. Select the amount you'd like to donate, choose a perk if you would like one, and enter your credit/debit card details. That's it! Only takes a minute!
Without support from generous backers, I will not be able to get the videos done. I simply do not have the time and resources to do all the work on my own, and this past year has brought some unforeseen personal expenses (related to the health of a family member) that have made it impossible for me to put any more money into this project up front. Without the videos, the books will be of very limited benefit to self-directed adults, and it will be harder to convince teachers to switch to the Fundamental Keys method.Without support, I will not be able to market the method online and in music education magazines and journals. I think this kind of marketing will be very important to its success.
If you are an adult beginner interested in Fundamental Keys for your personal use, the perks I offer will be great for you. At the $50 and $150 levels, you are essentially just pre-ordering Fundamental Keys.
If you are a piano teacher with a classical background, support Fundamental Keys  so that you will have access to a unique and effective way to teach your students.
If you have young children that you would like to enroll in piano lessons, I believe the best thing you could do for their development is to support Fundamental Keys  and urge their teacher to use it.
If you love classical music, support Fundamental Keys to give more kids the opportunity to learn to play the piano in a way that will foster an appreciation and love for classical music.
I hope the perks I am offering will give you even more reason to partner with me  in this endeavor! But remember, contributing any amount also comes with the satisfaction of being a part of bringing this dream of mine to fruition.
Here is what I will be able to accomplish depending on how much I raise (taking into account processing fees):


$1,600: I'll be able to produce the videos for Book 1.
$3,200: I'll also be able to produce the Book 2 videos.
$4,800: I'll be able to produce videos for the whole series.
$7,500: I'll also be able to market the method extensively in print and online, and even attend a national music teacher's conference to promote it. 
over $7,500: Anything "extra" will be put back into the project somehow -- more marketing, software development, wider distribution, etc.

I'm making the project goal $7,500, but I also chose "Flexible Funding". That means whatever support I get (even if I don't get to the goal) will be able to go towards making Fundamental Keys as successful as possible. But, the more I raise, the more successful the project will be, and if you've read this far, you obviously want to see it succeed, so.............................

Other Ways You Can HelpGet the word out!   Whether you can contribute monetarily or not, please  share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, on web forums, by email, by phone, by snail mail. Tell your friends, family, and anyone you know of who might be interested in the future of classical music. Small amounts from lots of people can make this project a huge success! Let's make it to the goal so that Fundamental Keys can be as great as it can be and so people around the world will hear about it!THANK YOU FOR YOUR INTEREST!!!

story:
"Alas; who, what are we, without our tradition?"

                                                                                             - Anonymous

Short Summary

Hi! My name is Ben Yehoshua, and today I am raising funds for the translation of my beloved grandfather's book, Behind The Silk Curtain (מאחורי מסך המשי) from Hebrew into English. My grandfather, Ben-Tzion, lives in Jerusalem, Israel and is the son of Afghani and Persian parents. My great grandfather was a community Rabbi as well as the local "Maggid," (storyteller) and my grandmother was a loving and beloved housewife. Seeing that the apple doesn't fall far from the tree, my grandfather has always been able to keep me enthralled for hours with his stories, the stories passed down to his from his father, and the stories of our family and our people. When my grandfather was 12 years old, his father was fatally wounded in battle while rescuing the women and children of his village from enemy gunfire. He died shortly after the battle from wounds inflicted to his torso by a grenade, and my grandfather became the family breadwinner. After working for a year to support his family, my grandfather's mother said "Bentzi, the time has come for you to return to school." He replied that he was done with school, and that he needed to continue working to provide for the family. His mother -my great-grandmother- then sat on the 22nd step of the entrance to their apartment, and began to cry. She told my grandfather, "Bentzi, it is because of you that I am crying, and it will be because of you that all of my tears will dry up. I will not stop crying until you go back to school!" Deeply moved, my grandfather agreed to return from school, and in his words - he "hasn't stopped learning since!" 

My family and our history has always been very important to me. This is a trait that I must have inherited from my grandfather, and that is why I am running this crowdfunding campaign today. Today, my grandfather is an author, and we are seeking $50,000 to translate, print, and market his magnum opus - Behind The Silk Curtain (מאחורי מסך המשי). This huge (nearly 1,000 page) book explores the history, culture, and tradition of the Persian, Afghani, and Bucharian Jewish communities throughout history. As an author and international tour guide of these areas, my grandfather is known as one of the authoritative historians who specialize in those aforementioned communities. I have read the book (my grandfather's 11th one, in fact), and it is simply a priceless treasure - especially for the Persian, Afghani, and Bucharian communities of the world. My grandfather has given me so much - knowledge, warmth, and love; it is now my turn to give back. Translating this book from Hebrew into English will be the ultimate gift to my grandfather, to our community, and to the world. By helping us translate this book, you will be helping hundreds, perhaps thousands of people reconnect to their roots. Those who were able to read the book in Hebrew have constantly expressed their admiration for the completion of such an important work, and continue to urge us to make this priceless information available to the English-speaking community. Please help us make this dream into a reality!

What We Need & What You Get

Let me break it down for you folks in more detail:

The funding we need is as follows:

  • $35,000 to pay the Translator
  • $20,000 for editing, printing, and binding the book. This includes high quality paper to print on, color hardcover binding, color photographs inside the book. 
  • $7,500 for marketing the book in an online Adwords campaign as well as in community newspapers throughout revel major U.S. cities. 
  • $5,000 for shipping the books to us and to retail locations. 
  • If, for some reason we don't reach our entire funding goal, we will allocate the funds according to their priority - Translation fees, editing, printing, binding, shipping, marketing. 

The Impact

  • This project is valuable to the you and to the world because it will reunite thousands of English-speaking people across the world with their roots. A wise man once said, "know from where you came, and to which destination you are going." He therefore implied that in order to know where we should go in life, it is integral that we know from where we have come. 
Risks & Challenges

Our greatest risk is the lack of recognition of this book by our target audience. In order to overcome this hurdle, I have been (and continue to be) in touch with published authors who have written books in English for our target audience. So far, the most widely successful of these contacts has agreed to oversee our entire marketing campaign. All we are waiting for is to have enough funds to cover the translation and production of this book, and thus initiate the revolutionary publication of my grandfather's book!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • As a college student, I completely understand how it feels wanting to help, but lacking the funds to do so. Thankfully, you can help us even without a contribution to our campaign! You can spread the word and make some noise about our campaign on your blogs, YouTube videos, social media accounts, and especially by word of mouth! Anyone and everyone can have their share in making our dream come true in your reality!

And that's all there is to it! :)

story:
EPEC trains in family-flexible, high-demand trades that pay $18 or more an hour, can be learned in under a year, and accept individuals with criminal records. The first trade is animal grooming.

EPEC stabilizes the needs of our students (single parents living in generational poverty) and their children by partnering with housing, childcare and community mentors to assure their success in our grooming school. Groomers can choose to open a business, work from their home or work for a salon. They can flex their schedules around the needs of their children.

Help us raise $20,000 for the grooming equipment needed to start! Parents in our first cohort will have children at Operation Breakthrough and living under the poverty line.

EPEC will break the cycle of poverty through a multi-generational approach that starts with a job.

EPEC will break the cycle of poverty through a multi-generational approach that starts with a job.

story:
The Campaign:

Children with life-threatening illnesses suffer a routine which constantly reminds them of the things they are unable to do. Home - Hospital - Chemo treatment - and back home again. They are usually unable to take part in social activities or go to school, and those with siblings will have to watch their brothers and sisters playing, while being unable to join in. 

This pantomime offers a break from their routine - not only entertaining them and allowing them to play with others their own age undergoing a similar experience, but also taking their mind off the illness for a few hours, and giving them a great memory to take home.

The intended outcome of this campaign is to promote a leisure activity that helps ill children and their families by encouraging social inclusion and breaking down the barriers which make them feel isolated from the world.



Our Funding Goal:

We are asking for your support to raise £3000 to cover the cost of the performers, theater hire, props and accessories, ticket + refreshment costs and coach hire to transport the children and their families to and from the venue.

If we are unable to raise the full amount of money, then we will ask the families of the children to provide their own lunches or make a contribution to the cost of the event.
In the happy event that we raise more than the £3000 the remaining money will go on extra events on the day itself, and funding towards a Goody-bag for each child.


About Us:

Liesel Angel Trust is a registered charity dedicated to supporting children with cancer or other life threatening illnesses and their families.

We were founded in March 2011 by Lovia Ofori-Agyemang and Francis Appiah-Boakye, in the name of their only daughter Liesel Angel who survived Neuroblastoma stage IV childhood cancer.

Unfortunately, a few months later, Liesel Angel relapsed and died of the disease in February 2012 aged three. The charity carried on under Liesel Angel’s name not only to keep her memory alive but most importantly to support families who may undergo a similar misfortune of dealing with childhood cancer.


Liesel Angel Trust is a registered charity in England and Wales (1152076) with a history of successful and ongoing projects at Hillingdon hospital children's unit - Peter Pan Ward - and elsewhere. For example last year we ran a successful parent support group sponsored by Macmillan Cancer support.

The only obstacle standing between us and our goal is raising the funds to hold this children's pantomime and put a smile back on their faces.


Helping in other ways:

We are asking for your generous support in raising this money, however if you are unable to make a monetary contribution towards this projects on this occasion but still want to help out then we would ask you to get involved in our social media campaign: Visit our website, Find us on Facebook, follow us on Twitter  @Liesel_Angel, and tell your family and friends about us and our campaign.

A big thanks from everyone on the team for reading this far,

Liesel Angel Trust

story:
Please support high-quality indoor and outdoor learning environments through a contribution — and help outfit classrooms with books, puzzles, toys, and hands-on age-appropriate math and science kits.  

Thanks to a matching grant, if you donate now your dollars will go twice as far. 

Educare of California at Silicon Valley – the first school of its kind in the state – will provide a high-quality education to low-income children from birth through age 5 in our region. The journey to bring comprehensive, early childhood education and community-based services to these children is tantalizingly close to fruition. This public-private partnership, which has been five years in the making, needs your help to reach the finish line.

The Educare model – successfully implemented in 20 other locations throughout the country -- is built on more than 40 years of research. It means well-trained teachers in every classroom, in addition to small class sizes. It means full-day, year-round learning focused on language and cognitive development, numbers, the arts and problem solving. And it’s a place where parent involvement is both expected and strongly supported.

Decades of research shows that low-income children frequently start school far behind their higher income peers, and often fail to catch up. High-quality early childhood experiences can make a permanent difference in the life of a child whose potential might otherwise be limited.

Educare will be located on the campus of Santee Elementary School in San Jose in the Franklin-McKinley School District, which serves a high-need population facing a number of challenges to school success. 97% of students receive free or reduced price lunches.

Educare gets results. Research shows children who start Educare between birth and age two meet national averages on measures of school readiness, and kindergartners who spend their early years at Educare arrive at elementary school on par with middle-income peers.

Why we need your help

Educare is scheduled to open in August 2015 (you can watch a video of a hard-hat tour of the facility's construction here). So, what’s missing?

Just one thing – but one very important thing.

We need your help to outfit Educare’s indoor and outdoor learning environments. We need age-appropriate math and science kits (e.g. shapes, building materials, light, magnets). We need easels in the art classes. We need books, toys and puzzles. How can a child reach his or her full potential without the opportunity for hands-on learning? How can we help create the next Steve Jobs or Sheryl Sandberg?

Our Indiegogo goal of $25,000 will help us meet our ambitious vision – to ensure that all children are ready to enter kindergarten. In addition, the County of Santa Clara has agreed to match your dollars -- so your donations will go twice as far. Because Educare is a 501 (c)(3), donations are tax-deductible. 

How the neighborhood benefits

Educare will house a Family Resource Center that will provide early literacy, arts enrichment and family support to members of the local community, regardless of whether or not their child is enrolled in the Educare school. The Family Resource Center will also provide developmental screening and a range of other developmental and health services, information and referral services, oral health information, health insurance information, enrollment assistance, preventive health information, baby-well checks, immunizations, and medical home provider access.

Educare will also serve as a satellite space for the Children's Discovery Museum of San Jose. The display emphasizes outdoor play, and provides safe learning stations where children and their parents can practice skills and activities for future use in nature. 

How the region benefits

The power of Educare will expand far beyond its doors. The school will house a Professional Development Institute that will offer resources and professional and career development opportunities for teachers and early educators. In Santa Clara County alone, there are over 6,000 early childhood teachers who would benefit from the high-quality best practices being taught at Educare of California at Silicon Valley. Our conservative estimate for the initial years of operation suggests we will impact over 5,000 children each year.

How everyone benefits

Educare is an opportunity to prepare early childhood education teachers, impact the local community, and help transform early education practices throughout the country. Closing the nation’s racial achievement gap and the income achievement gap would annually generate between $710 billion and $1.2 trillion higher US GDP.

“Every dollar we invest in high-quality early education can save more than seven dollars later on – by boosting graduation rates, reducing teen pregnancy, even reducing violent crime.” – President Barack Obama, 2013 State of the Union Address.

save more than seven dollars later on – by boosting graduation rates, reducing
teen pregnancy, even reducing violent crime.” – President Barack Obama, 2013
State of the Union Address.

story:
Reduce The Cost of Gas And Improve The Environment!

We'd all like to do something about the cost of gas, and we'd all like to use our resources more efficiently. And if we could cut down pollutants and reduce dependence on foreign oil in the process, so much the better. Well, we at StewardTech believe we may have found a way to help do all of these things. And you are invited to join us in the process of bringing this dream to life.

We have a unique design for a turbine that we believe could replace piston engines in everything from lawnmowers to freight trains. And we believe these turbines will be more efficient, lower maintenance, easier to produce and more durable than their internal combustion counterparts. We think this idea has the potential to revolutionize the transportation industry, and this is your chance to be a proud part of the revolution.


The Impact

  • Your contribution helps advance technology, while helping the environment. The high efficiency turbine will use less gasoline than an equivalent piston engine. 
  • It costs less to build than a comparable piston engine, and has fewer moving parts, so there's less to break down. You make things cheaper, cleaner and more reliable. That's a pretty big win for everyone.
  • By helping people use less gas, you also take away dependence on foreign oil. By doing this, in many cases, you take money away from terrorists. 
  • Your contribution will help create jobs. Maybe a few; hopefully a lot.
  • You help create something really new that has the potential to make life better for a lot of people. That's a good legacy to have.

About The Company

In many ways, StewardTech is a different kind of company. It's a company founded with its primary goal of creating a legacy. One of the things that we will be doing is instead of paying out dividends, when we meet our operational needs, any profits will be used to support charities and social programs that are important to us. Programs like food banks, family crisis centers and missions, first in our own communities, then hopefully reaching out nationally and even internationally.

Another difference in StewardTech is that we want to be so much more than just a place to build a career. We want to be a place where we help our people to build rewarding lives, both inside and outside the company. Toward that end, we want work to be as much an experience in corporate worship as it is in producing products. We believe that if we invite God into our work lives, that helps us make better products, and makes us a better company. It also helps us make better decisions along the way. We also want to create an environment of family. We firmly believe we were put here to serve one another, and to help one another along the road of life. Our unity is one of our greatest strengths.

We want to build products that make life better. We want our products to use resources more wisely, both in the production of the product, and in its lifetime. We want to create for you not just products that do the job, but that do the job better with less waste along the way.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Let's be honest here: we're just getting started, so what we need is basically everything. Hardware, software, facilities, you name it. And this venture is not without risk. But we believe the basic design is solid, and we think the potential value of our product far outweighs the risk. We think this turbine is a real winner, and when it goes into wide production, it will make people's lives better by reducing their fuel usage, and creating less pollution in the process.
  • The most important perk is not on our list. The most important perk is the knowledge that you worked to make life a little better for yourself, your children and your fellow man. Isn't that what makes life worthwhile? But do take a look at the perks offered. Some of them are quite valuable (a turbine-powered sports car, for example). But if you add up the total contributions that can be made, every single perk carries the potential to be worth more than the total goal for this campaign. Why is that? Well, this is a marathon, not a sprint. The total project will cost on the order of 14,000,000 USD to get from concept to final production. We want to prove to you that we can do this, and the best way to do it (for us and for you) is to do it in stages. For the first stage of the project, we wanted to make it small enough so that it could reasonably be done by a first-timer, but big enough so that it would still be a real accomplishment. So the first real need is a first rate CAD system, and a pair of commercial 3D printers so we can do prototyping in plastic. Once we get a successful plastic prototype, we will use the plastic parts to create a sand cast, which can then be used to create an aluminum prototype.
  • So what happens if we don't get to our goal for this phase? Well, from a financial standpoint, we buy what we can with the funds from this campaign, and try to get funding for the rest of this phase elsewhere. Failure to get funding in this phase does NOT mean the project is dead. It only means we failed to do what was needed to make this phase successful in this forum. We'll take a hard look at what we did, and how we could do better. And we will do better. We will make this happen, one way or the other. And we want you at the finish line with us when that first series of turbines comes rolling off the line.
  • What happens if we completely overshoot the goal for this phase? We'll use the extra to fund the next phase of the project. Whatever happens, everything donated will go toward funding this project alone. If we don't get enough, we seek additional means of funding. If we get more than we need, we'll use the extra to build extra capacity on the manufacturing floor, and hire more people to get the turbine into production faster.

Other Ways You Can Help

So what if you cannot contribute financially? Well, whether you can contribute financially or not, you can still help out, and maybe in the process, take away a little bit of history for yourself:

  • Tell people about the turbine and about StewardTech. Talk to friends, relatives, coworkers and other associates about what we are doing here. Be a valuable part of the team by using your network to get us on the radar. Hit every social media outlet you can think of, and get the word out about us.
  • Find people who you think can be investors and let them know what's going on here.
  • So, what's in it for you? We're SO glad you asked (no, really, we are). When you use the Indiegogo sharing tools to refer others to the project, 10% of all new contributions you refer go towards getting YOU the perks we offer. For example, if the total contributions of everyone you refer exceeds $1000, you get a StewardTech T-Shirt and a copy of the CD Pearls. If the total contributions of your referrals exceeds $10,000, you get an aluminum air powered turbine (execution of notarized non-disclosure agreement required). Who knows? You might even wind up with a brand new, turbine-powered sports car, just for using your network to refer contributors to us!
  • Also, for every new person you refer to the project, we will enter your name into a drawing. If the person you refer becomes a financial supporter, we'll enter your name into the drawing nine more times. And every perk level that that person ascends gets you ten more entries into the drawing. The drawing will be held the day the first production turbine rolls off the line, and first prize is Production Turbine #1, signed by the heads of the Management, Design and Production teams and installed in a new, custom motorcycle, plus a tour of the production facility (round trip economy air fare for two to DFW or DAL from any major airport in the US included), $1500.00 spending cash, and your name and photo recorded as a founding investor on a laser etched plaque placed proudly on permanent display at StewardTech. Second prize is a signed book of engineering drawings used to create one of our turbine prototypes. Third prize is one of 100 limited edition StewardTech I Helped Create a Revolution T-Shirts. The usual legal mumbo jumbo applies (Void where restricted or prohibited by law. Employees, suppliers and board members of StewardTech and their families are not eligible, and StewardTech reserves the right to interpret the rules of the contest. Winners are responsible for taxes assessed on prizes. Judges' selections are final, and limit 1 prize per person).

story:
THE PROJECT

We will be taking 10 Rotarians, three of which are over 70 years young, to climb Mount Kenya to Point Lenana (4,985 metres or 16,355 ft).  This is to raise funds via sponsorship of the climbers for our nominated beneficiaries. Each climber is funding their own travel and accommodation costs, so that every $ we raise, as a team, goes to the beneficiaries.


THE BENEFICIARIES (click on the three beneficiaries for project information)

1. LEGACY AUSTRALIA

Legacy is a charity providing services to Australian families suffering financially and socially after the incapacitation or death of a spouse or parent, during or after their defence force service. Legacy Australia currently care for around 90,000 widows and 1,900 children and disabled dependants throughout Australia.


2.  The ORK - Orphan Rescue Kits (Kenya)

Through Rotary we support vulnerable and at risk orphaned children that our Rotary partners in Kenya have identified as being in need of help.  This could be an individual or a whole school in Kenya.

Tracy Ochieng one of the girls that we met at Mathare in 2011 and have since sponsored Tracy to High School.  2nd in her class of 126 students , Tracy will be our first graduate to have a university education and degree, made possible with your assistance. We are confident that after your consideration of these, the most vulnerable children on the face of the earth, were our children and grand children we would like to think that we could all help them to achieve their goals.

Mathare, where Tracy and her sister live, used to be the vegetable gardens of Nairobi.  Now the area houses 500,000 people who have moved from the country to the BIG city of Nairobi looking for work.

“It is hard to reconcile my ability to see the beauty, joy and goings on of life in the slum, with the revolting site you have to process in order to know it must be changed. The land is sucked of the green. The water is scarce, the trash unbelievable. Children meander through filth, shining their glorious youth and innocence in order to make it human, to make it bearable.

There is music, constant music.There are babies being held, old men shooting the breeze, hunched grandmas walking together. It is life, at the same time as it should, and never should, be.“  Megan MacDonald. Rotary Ambassadorial Scholar.

3. Coolamon House Hout Bay Cape Town.

We support the Hout Bay Rotary Club and their work with Operation Medical Hope, supplying Comfort Boxes which will look after the needs of the families in Hout Bay with supplies of medication and nutrition.  Coolamon House is saving lives each and every day and with your support will continue to do so.


PAST SUCCESS

So far our Rotary Road MAPS to Africa programme through climbing Mount Kilimanjaro and the Mountains of the Moon as well as amazing support from Rotary District 9700 and in particular Past District Governor Fred Loneragan 2008-2009, has raised $250,000 for our projects in the past.  This has resulted in the building and refurbishment of a medical care clinic in Hout Bay, South Africa the provision of materials and wages to help run the School of St Jude’s in Tanzania.

We have also provided many Orphan Rescue Kits for children of Mathare in Nairobi which has now moved into sending children of secondary school age to secondary education.  Secondary education in Kenya is not free at the moment and requires organisations such as Rotary to identify those in greatest need.

THE LONGER VERSION OF OUR STORY


THE NEXT CHILDREN WAITING FOR A SCHOOL!

REWARDS

Donation or Reward?

Provided you want Australian Taxation Office receipts and qualify, when you make a donation here to the Rotary Mount Kenya Climb beneficiaries. We will provide you with a tax-deductible receipt. However your pledge will not be tax-deductible if you choose one of our rewards.


Sky Donation $50

A great way to start helping the campaign donate $50 and receive a beaded Maasai necklace.

Earth Donation $100

Donate $100 and get a beaded Maasai bangle.

Bronze Donation $150

Donate $150 and receive a pair of Maasai Earrings hand-crafted in the Oloimugi Maasai Village in Kenya.

Silver Donation $500
Donate $500 and receive a beautiful Oloimugi Maasai Belt suitable for women and men.


Gold Donation $1,000
Donate $1,000 and receive  one of the top artifacts made by these women artists at Oloimugi a beautiful ceremonial  Maasai circle Collar.

Platinum Donation $20,000
Donate $20,000 and you will receive a ticket to Kenya from your home and back.  Included in the trip will be a visit to the Oloimugi Maasai Village and two nights accommodation and transfers to the Mount Kenya Safari Club and a visit to the village.
