story:
Resume

This is a project of our community to welcome the orphans and street who have to live and help them through sport and studies to be good citizens and help them achieve their goals children.
will raise money it is nothing compared to what this means for homeless children this means that not drugged
will not be violent
and they shall walk on the right path with the possibility of being what they should be! and it is to be children 

 

  •  I'm Diego Torres I am a former baseball player
    during my player times as a child I had the opportunity to know the good and bad of the streets! see how children are lost in drugs for not having a motivation or a parent to teach them the good and the bad
    I met / saw people who did not take bad deciciones through sport as their lives changed just by opting to do sport and not steal or take drugs! so me and the community where I live decided to do this fundraiser to register a foundation to help homeless children and give them shelter education and teach them to live a healthy life with sport.
  • with this project we lift many street children giving them safety and education that is essential for these children grow up as good citizens and not as criminals but obviously we do not have enough money because our country is going through a deplorable situation and none it has helped us to go forward with this project if we can raise sufficient funds get not only change the life of a child if not an entire society that unfortunately every day lost more values and respect for others
 

 

What we need and what you get 

 

Details

  • we need $ 10k to fund this entire project
    - Registration of the foundation.
    - We need to project the spaces where these children are harbored.
    - School and sports tuition.
    - Logistics for food and maintenance.
    - Workers and caregivers.
    - Rental of sports facilities (gyms / sports fields).

    We have analyzed in detail the amount of funds that nececitamos and even more the number of children we could help with these funds would be around 60 children homeless.

 

this would be great because what little much we can do with your help! these children will thank us forever and that would be the most beautiful thing that we could pay these children pay them with gratitude and affection.

the road will be difficult but we know that working together and with your help everything is possible!

 

CAN NOT HELP ECONOMICALLY? SPREADING THIS CAMPAIGN HELP CHILDREN OF VENEZUELA WILL THANK YOU!

story:
These prototypes are designed to be delivered complete, yet moddable and hacker-friendly, thanks to your friends at and made with Raspberry Pi (™).

 

Each unit is handle-assembled and coded on-demand just for you - your stop, your line, your size. After that, you are free to do whatever you like. Hack it, redistribute it, or contribute more to the campaign for an upgrade! It's kind of like "open source", but there aren't any restrictions on legal use.

 

Frames are locally-sourced and assembled, and made custom for each unit. (Don't worry, it will be some Bushwick hipster-quality material.)

 

5% of campaign contributions go directly back to youth technology education, even if I take a loss on the whole campaign.

 

The end game here is to get these into schools and workshops as affordable hacker units. When I started programming, 15 years of coding education was far less accessible. We’re  much better now, but we still need to train young hackers! A highly effective hacking lesson for children is "reverse engineering" - the processes of tearing something down and rebuilding it from the ground up. This device incorporates many learnable aspects of technology, including coding, hardware, public networks and data, and how to apply it practically in your hands. This will be another venture in itself, but this campaign is designed to jumpstart it. For now, I will be taking a poll from all contributors to decide how we allocate 5% to education. My favorite considerations are codenow.org, girlswhocode.com and under-funded NYC public schools.

 

PLEASE NOTE: All upgrade/app perks are not the actual sign! You must contribute to a physical sign perk, and the upgrade/app perks will be retrofitted when they are available.

 

Please ask lots of questions before contributing! I would like the most transparency possible, however I do have a full-time job and will do my best to get back to you ASAP!

 

Faq:

Q. Are these really live and accurate?

Due to MTA policy, I am unable to use certain words in this claim. What I can tell you is I’m working with the same exact data as they are! In short, I can’t promise accuracy, only consistency with their systems.

Q: Do you support line besides 1/2/3, 4/5/6 & L?

A: Unfortunately not even the MTA has that data. I can only program for lines that physically have LED signs on their platforms. Technically the S and Sir are also available. I can substitute schedule values, but they wont be live.  However, NYC Buses and other non MTA Subway trains are available live!

Q: What does the sign do when there is a delay?

A: It's designed to be a replica of the signs underground, so in short, it will do what they do. If there's a delay, it will say, “delay”. If there's a glitch and the system goes down, yours go down. It's only as good as the data it's pulling.

 

Q: What happens when the L train shuts down?

A: I'll reprogram it for a supported stop of your choosing. But that’s a long time off, and I'll have these out way before they pull a 2nd Ave.

 

Q: What happens if I move to a new stop?

A: Contribute to the app upgrade with line and stop switching, or hack it!

 

Q: What kind of frames do you offer?

A: The prototype was handmade in my neighbor's garage workshop with reclaimed wood. He charged me $200, so he will be honoring the same price for prototypes. If you want metal, or glass I will locally source a custom fabrication solution just for your size at cost.

 

Q: What are the mounting / stand options?

A: That will depend on your frame. Bare bones will have simple magnet mounts! Options are pretty limitless, and I will work with you for the perfect solution.

 

Q: What about other transit agencies like BOS (MSHTA?), Bay Area (Bart), DC, Tor, or buses?

A: After some research and development I am confident that integration will be possible, however it is currently unapproved and not demonstrated. If you make this contribution, and I am not able to deliver, your money towards this perk will be refunded.

 

Q: What sizes are available?

A: For reference the prototype in the video is a large, single-wide.

 

- Small:

- Small Double-Wide:

- Medium

- Medium Double-Wide

- Large

 

Q: What if I purchase a prototype early, but upgrades aren’t available until a later delivery date, what about software upgrades?

A: Any prototypes purchased will be compatible with future software releases, and for purchase, and retroactively applied. You will not in any way be penalized for buying a prototype. If you are unhappy with your prototype, I will be happy to exchange during a later release stage.

story:
About Shift:

Militancy, corruption, and violence dominate the news about Pakistan. The country’s public profile is associated with a variety of security threats and Pakistanis are often written about as either perpetrators or victims of injustice.

But Pakistan, a country of more than 200 million people, is undergoing a tremendous shift. While militancy, corruption, and violence are indeed a part of everyday life, Pakistanis are also using the arts, politics, technology, law, and sports, to push back against these forces and create a space for Pakistanis to have a conversation about what they want their country to look like. Their efforts are creating a deep shift not only in civil society and the country’s institutions but also within the broader culture itself.

A growing middle class, greater international cooperation, a robust media presence, and the existence of social media have all contributed to a growing dynamism inside Pakistan. This dynamism is on display in ordinary ways by ordinary people. Whether it’s a transgender woman openly campaigning in an election, dissidents using social media to shed light on the State’s activities, digital rights activists pushing for greater accountability, or an internet star pushing the boundaries of a conservative culture, Pakistanis are trying to change the direction of their social and political culture in big and small ways.

News Lens Pakistan is a news cooperative based in Pakistan and employs local Pakistani journalists to tell the stories of this vast and varied country. We are launching a project called Shift. This project will include a series of reported stories from all over the country that, collectively, will show how Pakistan is changing and the consequences of those changes, both positive and negative. Our aim is to use the stories from Shift to show how a country like Pakistan, both modern and deeply traditional, is grappling with change and how Pakistanis are re-imagining their future.

Why we need your help:

News Lens Pakistan is a small news cooperative with international partners that help boost the professionalism of our journalists by offering training and development opportunities. Our reporters and editors have taken on scores of stories about government accountability, corruption, the deep state, militancy, workers’ rights, women’s issues, minority rights, business, arts, and more. We publish our stories in English as well as local languages - Urdu, Pashto and Sindhi. Our journalists are ready, willing, and able to take on the important stories that will benefit Pakistanis and international audiences.

One thing we do need help with is money. Serious news outlets are under tremendous financial pressures across the board. News Lens is no different in that sense.

We need to raise USD $5000. In Pakistan, a little goes a long way and this small amount of money will allow us to fund five reporters across the country to report on 12 stories. We will look at all parts of Pakistan and focus on stories across the social and class spectrum. The cost will include reporters’ story fees, travel expenses, editing, translation of stories into local languages.

News Lens Pakistan benefits not only journalists and their news outlets but the people of Pakistan. Its aim is to create, publish and distribute high-quality content throughout the country and to the rest of the world. In the process of creating that content, News Lens will improve the skills and raise the standards for Pakistani journalists, wherever they may be. Its members benefit from identification with this professional, nonpartisan, national news outlet, via its professional training opportunities as well as wide distribution of their best content.

One thing we do need help with is money. Serious news outlets are under tremendous financial pressures across the board. News Lens is no different in that sense.
We need to raise USD $5000. In Pakistan, a little goes a long way and this small amount of money will allow us to fund five reporters across the country to report on 12 stories. We will look at all parts of Pakistan and focus on stories across the social and class spectrum. The cost will include reporters’ story fees, travel expenses, editing, translation of stories into local languages.
News Lens Pakistan benefits not only journalists and their news outlets but the people of Pakistan. Its aim is to create, publish and distribute high-quality content throughout the country and to the rest of the world. In the process of creating that content, News Lens will improve the skills and raise the standards for Pakistani journalists, wherever they may be. Its members benefit from identification with this professional, nonpartisan, national news outlet, via its professional training opportunities as well as wide distribution of their best content.

story:
Ethical Nonconformity Education 

Developed and piloted at Columbia University with first generation college-bound teens (grades 9-12), Ethical Nonconformity Education (ENE) is accessible by a series of ten engaging workshops (also deliverable in a 3-day intensive), where we first aim to de-condition the learner in an effort to kindle an awareness of the harmful herd mentality ubiquitous in our society. We compare the ethics of being complicit with exploitative authority and social pressures, to staying true to one’s own moral compass, integrity and heart. Ultimately, we hope to embolden participants to courageously stand up for themselves and for those without a voice – even at the risk of alienation and unfair consequences.

First and foremost, at the foundation of our ENE philosophy, we learn to appreciate the art of mindfulness, graceful acquiescence and noble silence. In one sense, we believe strongly that learning to “love what is” and the practice of compassion and non-resistance is germane to peace, health and happiness for all. Once fully committed to this essential understructure, only then will we begin to examine how to earnestly tune into one’s heart and listen for indicators of when it might be more virtuous to move away from yielding acceptance and strategically embrace principled noncompliance and action, in an effort to advance humanism.

Finally, we cultivate the artistry of not only knowing when to make such an honorable calculated stand, but most importantly, how to do so in a manner most productive and positive, without shutting down dialogue. Together, we’ll learn that we can indeed practice poise, tact, self-control and respect for the opposition, while simultaneously keeping true to a sense of uncompromising audaciousness when confronting social injustice. Certainly a tricky tightrope to walk for certain, yet an indispensable life skill and art form we hope to help participants hone and master.

Nine sessions build up to the tenth and final workshop where families, teachers and friends are invited to attend participants’ creative and poetic “speak out” orations that address two fundamental questions: “What type of adult do I wish to unfold into?” and “Do I wish to be accepted and seek approval or make an impact?”

Guiding Precepts

  • Major obstacles to peace at both domestic and international levels are, pride & ego, blind allegiance, conformity, complacency and apathy.
  • Society is structured in such a way that many are often too afraid to speak out or stand up for themselves or others. Peers and authority figures often take advantage of this. This is especially troubling for females and minorities.
  • Maintaining personal integrity often coincides with a feeling of losing out on certain things. This is okay.
  • When one stands up for communities and populations one is not a member of, it sends a powerful message to both communities. It models for others, one united human front.
  • Unbridled rage, explosiveness and violent speech are rarely helpful when taking a stand.
  • Atrocities keep happening in the world because offenders are often not held accountable.
  • Being courageous enough to expose or denounce unethical actions of one’s own school, university, employer, religious organization or country, is a sign of sound health.

In this short clip, Jimmy Webb exemplifies most perfectly a NOCOFO stance when confronting exploitative authority:

Founder

Warm greetings! My name is Dave, the creator of NOCOFO (NOnCOnFOrmity). I really appreciate your time and would like to share a bit of my background with you.

I've enjoyed a unique opportunity to have worked as an international educator, counselor and humanitarian in various conflict zones around the world, with experience in over 40 countries.

Some of my work includes counseling and teaching at international schools, serving as an independent peacekeeper between Israelis and Palestinians in the West Bank, working with traumatized children in Afghanistan, consulting for Save the Children in the Gaza Strip and creating various youth initiatives for refugee children in the Middle East. I also consult on the Syrian refugee crisis and was very humbly honored (most likely by mistake!) by the United Nations Development Program and featured in the UNDP publication, “101 Stories: People Making a Difference.”

I hold a B.A. in Psychology, an M.Ed. in Counseling Psychology and reside in New York City.

The Story

Toward the end of a peacekeeping mission in the Occupied Palestinian Territories and after witnessing various amounts of physical violence toward children and civilians, I abruptly lost faith in humanity. Reflecting upon my experiences there, in other regions, and in my home country, I promptly concluded that the two most harmful shortcomings most destructive to humans, no matter where in the world, are conformity and blind obedience  – as demonstrated in the famous Milgram and Asche studies below:

Milgram Experiment

 

Asch Experiment


I left the turbulent region traumatized with a severely distressed mental state. From that point on, I struggled with a bleak outlook on life for quite some time before eventually winding up in India.

In Igatpuri, India, I took part in a Vipassana meditation retreat, committing to 10 days of noble silence while meditating for 10 hours each day. When I emerged on the other side, my perspective was refreshingly altered and I felt a poetic sense liberation. I learned from this craft new methods to help keep my mind clear and balanced. Enlivened by these new strategies, I felt the need to share them with others experiencing similar hardships. Soon thereafter I arrived in Afghanistan to train traumatized children in the very same techniques that helped me recover from much of my own trauma.

(Kabul)

Meanwhile, I was also pursuing intensive self-study in existentialism. I found numerous parallels between mindfulness and existentialism, such as the emphasis on authenticity, regaining a sense of freedom and control, de-conditioning one’s mind and taking one’s life back with a heightened sense of self-efficacy.

However, I noted one glaring paradox between the two. While meditation and mindfulness stress acceptance and “taking the path of least resistance,” existentialism on the other hand, asserts that one doesn’t have to (and perhaps shouldn’t) necessarily accept certain conditions of life’s absurdities. Existentialism considers that a person may freely create and shape one’s own authentic existence however one wishes, stomping on conformity, the status quo and social pressures. I felt that both concepts are essential to humanism and peace, yet still tussled with this contradiction. When confronting social injustice I thought, is it best to mindfully breathe and peacefully take the path of least resistance, or is it wiser to actively confront, challenge and existentially try to change the order at hand?

I sat with this conundrum for years and eventually set out to create a humanistic-philosophical model that intertwines existentialism and mindfulness, hoping to reshape the puzzling incongruity. I soon hatched Ethical Nonconformity Education (ENE), which I hope is part of the answer.

In the ENE curriculum, I endeavored to prove that one might discover that you can indeed confront authoritarian malfeasance or challenge the harmful status quo, while still keeping true to the tenderness and equanimity of mindfulness. ENE provides for young people strategies on how to approach the opposition with respect, grace and composure while utilizing what I call “constructive audaciousness.” Can learners develop a skillset that cradles a refined personal moral integrity and promote positive dialogue while also self-assuredly hold to one’s ground, refusing to back down from intimidation tactics?

My goal in creating NOCOFO wasn’t to set out to create mini-anarchists. Rather, my mission was to simply help young people blossom into humanists. There are times though that humanism calls for renouncing and disrupting the status quo, engaging in noncompliance and relentlessly insisting on compassion and fair treatment for all.

As a teen and even into much of my adult life, I was always easily unglued by any type of injustice. As a result, I've suffered the consequences of my unbridled outrage toward unkind adults, which often landed me in a lot of hot water. I felt that I learned about mindfulness and existentialism much too late in life and now have made it my mission to teach youth about these important concepts so they don’t experience the same trouble I encountered when revolting against inhumanity.

Important to note, I myself am not finished with my own continued development! There’s so much more work to be done – and I slip up quite often still! Simply, I humbly invite young people to join with me on this NOCOFO journey.

Risks & Concerns 

For some, NOCOFO will be controversial. Many adults and educators wish, insist and even coerce young people to conform and blindly obey – regardless of what's at stake for the youngster, for one main reason: they're easier to control this way!

At NOCOFO we provide space for young people to contemplate ethical nonconformity, where principled noncompliance and taking a stand is based solely on respect for themselves and kindheartedness for others. We offer young people to consider standing up to injustice in an effort to help develop humanism, not anarchism. This we're sure, will still be misread by some. It will be a risk that may deter certain sponsors from contributing and schools/youth organizations from signing on.

Where Your Donations Go

80% of funding will go directly toward free programming for low-income schools and youth organizations around the globe - from NYC to Afghanistan! The very warm-hearted BellyFire Productions will receive their fee of 13% of our goal, for shooting and editing our video. Thank you BellyFire for your good faith, trust and believing in us! The remaining 7% will be dedicated to admin operations costs and toward standardizing our curriculum so we can begin to train ENE facilitators in each region of the world for maximum impact!

Other Ways You can Contribute

If you work for a school or youth organization and would like NOCOFO to make a visit to enthusiastically train and inspire your students, contact us! And we're completely global! There's no region of the world we won't venture to. Let's partner!

story:
Short Summary

I am Kennedy Kanyi, a BSc Information Technology graduate at the Jomo Kenyatta University of Agriculture and Technology. I am currently running Oneplace Technologies Ltd, an ICT company in Kenya. I have always had passion teaching people how to code, something in which I have great knowledge. I started Brace Kids as a way of expanding my skills and knowledge to kids, who apparently hold the future of our continent.
Brace Kids offers hope for the technology industry of Africa. Many of the most successful software developers started coding while they were kids. However, getting this knowledge is not easy especially for African kids. Brace Kids offers to give this knowledge for free. The aim is to teach One Million Kids across the continent how to code.

photo courtesy of GeekWire

The funding received from this campaign will enable Brace Kids set up four educational hubs for kids in Kenya. This hub will be the first in a network of other proposed centers in every country in Africa. The hubs will act as educational centers which will run the kids educational campaigns for the respective country. The funding will also enable us in internal infrastructure installations for the hubs. 

More Information

The Brace Kids initiative intends to raise $50,000 that will enable us setup a coding education hub for kids in Kenya as mentioned above, setup internal infrastructure, get branded t-shirts for the campaigns and promote the educational campaigns and enroll more and more interested kids. 

The Project's Impact

This project will help nurture a generation of great young minds in the software world. Programming is the key to a better society. With kids learning how to create software, Brace Kids will have opened a door for a brilliant future of our continent where critical thinkers and problem solvers are young and gifted.

When I started Brace Kids, it was received with very open arms by the people who learnt about it. I got invited to talk about the same on National Television Channel K24. The willingness of parents to have their kids learn programming skills was so great that I hosted several parents and their kids in my office. Unfortunately, I didn't have enough space to host them all, hence the need for space. 

You can watch the full interview on National Television here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pJ2H0OQ360s

Photo courtesy of Beos Max Files

I appeal to willing donors to help me realize my dream for my continent by helping me reach out to kids who want to learn these skills. Brace Kids will be a great leap for the continent and its technology sector.

story:
Captain Corrosion is a free educational website, where students, teachers and companies can find the best video resources in the field of materials science and technology. In order to provide them with highest quality study materials, we use 3D animations to visualize complicated things in an easy way and always involve experienced professors, scientists and companies in the video creation process.
Education is the best investment in our future and it should be free for anyone in the world!

ABOUT THE VIDEO

Our upcoming educational video will be about plasma, which is one of the most common states of matter in the visible Universe. In the video we will discuss about the nature of plasma, where it occurs and how we can harness the power of the stars to improve our everyday life. For that purpose we will also visit a physicist, who will create plasma in a laboratory (hopefully in a controlled environment!).
The video will be intense, engaging and about 6 minutes long, filled with lots of animations. Once published in May on Captain Corrosion YouTube channel, it will be also be shared by us and our partners on various social media platforms (Facebook, Twitter, Google+, our website) in order to reach the target audience (students, lecturers, companies).

There are two goals we want to achieve with this video;

1. Popularizing science
Young people often waste their youth by playing computer games, listening music whole day or even worse - they turn to drugs and alcohol. This video however will wake their interest towards science and give them the courage to step into a university and make something useful with their lives.

2. Educational material for science classes and courses
Although there are images and plenty of books, there is a lack of videos that explain the phase transitions and states of matters with animations. Therefore this video will be a valuable tool for many lecturers and also students.


HOW IS THE MONEY SPENT?

Although we need about 5000$ to cover most of the costs, any amount we collect will help us a lot as it will greatly improve the quality of the video. For instance, the money would be spent on:

1. Animations
2. Music
3. Video making software
4. Hardware
5. Paying volunteers for spending so much time
6. Future science videos (only if we go over 5000$)

If we don`t reach the 5000$ goal then the collected funds will be spent based on the priority list above - starting with animations and music.

RISKS?

We have made already over 70 videos without additional funding and several of them have topped the YouTube search among similar videos (see AFM video). So even if we get only 1$ funding, we will push our dedication in order to make sure the video is good and is published in May 2016! With additional funding we have the resources to make it much better though.


WHAT WILL YOU GET FOR YOUR CONTRIBUTION?

Of course you will get to see the video for free when its published on our YouTube channel! However, we also offer you some treats and ways to be involved in video making process!

1$ - Thanks! Even a small amount helps us go a long way.

10$ - You can also get involved and let us know what video would you like to be created next!

50$ - Get one of the awesome images shown in the video such as the fusion reactor or phase transitions. You can also vote for an upcoming video topic!

500$ - Get a spot at the end of the video as one of the major sponsors. You will be visible to tens of thousands of people already within the first months.

Be sure to contact me to claim your perk!

WHAT ELSE CAN YOU DO TO HELP?

Spread the word in social media! That way we can reach more people who might be interested to help out. Also, be sure to comment and let us know what you think- that way we can make the video even better.

story:
First, what our Sat is capable of:

Electromagnetic Radiation: we have an electro-magnetometer, capable of detecting variations in electromagnetic radiation.

Ionized radiation: we have a scintillation counter, that enables us to measure the various radiation in our satellites environment.  This is significant as it enables us to detect high energy particles, radiation, and other phenomenon.

Cameras: we will use two cameras with parabolic lenses, giving us a clear 360 degree view around our satellite.

Our instruments will allow us to scientifically verify visual anomalies with correlated radiation.  This adds to the burden of proof required for extra-ordinary claims.

Our Team:

Costs:

Data will cost $3000+ / month, and we will be in orbit up to three months.  This is why we are raising funds.  Anything raised above our goal will go towards future launches, and this may turn into a yearly mission.
We have already raised $30,000 USD previously, and this has paid for the building of our CubeSat and our Launch.

Mission Objectives

  • Build a 2U CubeSat to search for anomalies in Low Earth Orbit

  • Must be capable of receiving command and transmitting telemetry and mission data down.

  • Experiments include:

    • Real-time magnetometer observations

    • Real-time geiger counter observations

    • On-orbit HD image capture of surrounding Low Earth Orbit

      • Capable of taking images in 5 second increments

      • Transmitting images down and release images to public raw(untampered/unedited)

      • Capable of coarse pointing accuracy
      • Global Shutter for capturing moving objects

LT Command and Data Handler/Electrical Power System Board

  • 32-bit AVR flash microcontroller featuring 512KB Flash, 68KB SRAM

    • Running OpenSAT FreeRTOS, lightweight multitasking architecture

  • Redundant µSD storage (2x 8GB)

  • Real Time Clock

  • On-board Temperature Sensor

  • 4x External Temperature Sensor(user mountable)

  • External(from µController) On-board Watchdog

  • USB Bootloader

  • Virtual USB for easy Debugging

  • On-board Inertial Measurement Unit - Magnetometer, Gyroscope, Accelerometer

  • Compatible with CMOS(UART) camera(TBD)

  • Compatibility with Lippert Technologies, LLC Flight Radio/Educational Radio

  • Compatibility with NSL: NearSpace Launch Inc. Eyestar Duplex Modem

  • Compatibility with Lippert Technologies, LLC OpenSat Educational Payload Board

  • Compatibility with Lippert Technologies, LLC Magnetorquer Board

  • Compatible with PC-104 mechanical Interface

LT Battery Pack

  • Li-Ion Battery Pack

  • Utilizes four 18650 series battery cells

  • 10000 mAh Capacity

  • ~7.4 V voltage Range

  • Temperature Sensors

  • Compatible with Lippert Technologies, LLC Command and Data Handler/Electrical Power System

  • Compatible with PC-104 mechanical interface

LT Magnetorquer Board

  • 3-axis magnetic torque rod system

  • 3-axis magnetometer

  • Coarse Control Pointing

  • Three actuators; two torque rods and one air core torquer

  • Current Sensors for each torquers

  • Telemetry over I2C

  • Detumble up to 3U

  • Direct analog control of actuators with direct PWM signal

  • Compatible with PC-104 mechanical interface

  • Compatible with Lippert Technologies, LLC Command and Data Handler/Electrical Power System

LT 1U Flight Solar Panel

  • 22% cell efficiency

  • Coarse Sun Sensor -ADC

  • Temperature Sensor

  • Protection Diodes

  • Voltage: ~12v

  • Current: 104mA

  • Power: ~ 1250 mW peak

  • Compatible with Lippert Technologies, LLC 1U, 2U,3U Chassis

LT Flight Imager Payload Board

  • BeagleBone Black header connector

  • BeagleBone Black with 8GB SD card included

  • Geiger Counter

  • 3MP CMOS Sensor Color Camera

    • 35mm lens/F1.9

    • Camera Mount included

    • 25.8 fps

    • Global Shutter for capturing moving objects

    • Rolling Shutter for low-noise, high-contrast images

    • Near InfraRed version with twice the infrared sensitivity

  • OpenSat Payload Software Package

    • JPEG Compression

  • Compatible with PC-104 mechanical interface

LT 2U Flight Chassis

  • AL 6061

  • Tight Tolerances TBD

  • Detachable Side Panels

  • Kill-switch mechanism

  • PC-104 compatible

  • 94mm x 94mm PCBs

  • Compatible with NSL’s Eyestar Duplex Modem

Now, on disclosure:

For the past 70 years, the topic of extraterrestrial intelligent beings and UFO's has been controversial, if not ridiculed.  Despite many sightings and events, government, military and media have made a strong attempt to discredit the idea of extraterrestrial "aliens".  And in the face of their apparent "disbelief" of the topic, the same military and governments have spent huge amounts of money secretly studying these "ridiculous" UFO's and aliens. Thanks to freedom of information, and the actions of many with first hand experience, thousands of documents, witness testimony and data have surfaced, making the ridicule posed on ufology by media and governments seem staged and forced, with a very secret intent.

To name a few reasons why this topic is important, and why it must be subjected to rigorous scientific study:

1) Countries are beginning to release highly classified documents proving their governments interest in aliens and UFO's.

2) Hundreds of highly credible witnesses have come forward with testimony that at least some UFO's are verifiable alien technology.  These witnesses

include a former Canadian Defense Minister, numerous astronauts, high ranking US military officials, pilots, ... Well, I could go on and on, but instead

I will provide a few links for those of you interested in learning more:

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Center_for_the_Study_of_Extraterrestrial_Intelligence

http://www.siriusdisclosure.com/

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7vyVe-6YdUk

http://www.citizenhearing.org/

https://www.youtube.com/user/CitizenHearing

What our project aims to do, is to use a low orbit satellite, controlled by us individuals, to study potential objects that emit high energy radiation.

Maybe we'll get data readings and pictures of solar-flare caused auroras.  Maybe we'll capture images of some very interesting meteors.  And maybe we'll actually capture a verifiable craft.  All we can do is try, and by doing this our way, we can open-source the data to you, the individuals.

Perks:

Name (get your name written on the CubeSat): $25

Data (real-time data - visual / radiation): $250

Data (get login benefits and real time data): $500


Join the Team (sit with us and build the CubeSat): $1000
story_txt:
First, what our Sat is capable of:

Electromagnetic Radiation: we have an electro-magnetometer, capable of detecting variations in electromagnetic radiation.
Ionized radiation: we have a scintillation counter, that enables us to measure the various radiation in our satellites environment.  This is significant as it enables us to detect high energy particles, radiation, and other phenomenon.
Cameras: we will use two cameras with parabolic lenses, giving us a clear 360 degree view around our satellite.Our instruments will allow us to scientifically verify visual anomalies with correlated radiation.  This adds to the burden of proof required for extra-ordinary claims.
Our Team:
Costs:Data will cost $3000+ / month, and we will be in orbit up to three months.  This is why we are raising funds.  Anything raised above our goal will go towards future launches, and this may turn into a yearly mission.We have already raised $30,000 USD previously, and this has paid for the building of our CubeSat and our Launch.


Mission Objectives

Build a 2U CubeSat to search for anomalies in Low Earth Orbit
Must be capable of receiving command and transmitting telemetry and mission data down.

Experiments include:

Real-time magnetometer observations
Real-time geiger counter observations

On-orbit HD image capture of surrounding Low Earth Orbit

Capable of taking images in 5 second increments
Transmitting images down and release images to public raw(untampered/unedited)
Capable of coarse pointing accuracy
Global Shutter for capturing moving objects

story:
Help The Katmint Expand Our School! 

The Katmint Learning Initiative was created based on the idea that a school should be independent, encourage creativity and allow options that actually fit the needs of the community. Providing a purposeful educational experience is our attempt. 

When students are nurtured in the right environment this experience prepares them for life’s challenges. So The Katmint strives to create that atmosphere everyday for early childhood education in the Bedford-Stuyvesant community.


The Katmint has become a pillar of light in the community, making us a symbol of peace, culture, progression and education. Our increasing popularity has made our program the number one option for parents and has fostered a waiting list of  more than seventy-nine families. 

WOW! That's major success thanks to you!

Due to our capacity limitation mandated by the State of New York's Department of Heath, we are unable to service our wait-list families and many other families in need at our current location. 

The Katmint is in  desperate NEED of a larger facility to meet the high demand for quality and affordable childcare in Brooklyn. This fundraiser campaign is The Katmint's final push to acquire a larger space for our new school. 


It will take alot of support, but with your help and faith we know we can make it happen and reach our funding goal of $40K to expand into a larger school for The Katmint. 





Our Need

The new facility gives us six more classrooms, an auditorium, an outdoor/indoor playground and urban garden.  This space would allow us to hold free community workshops, create new jobs and become a true support system for many families in the neighborhood. We need to meet our funding goal of $40K in 60 days to land the contract for this space as well as implement the much needed renovations inside of  the facility.

The Perks

In the spirit of The Katmint Way, we have lot's of treats in store for our donors! We're hosting our Annual Fundraiser Gala on May 5th at Dorsett located at 677 Washington Ave, Brooklyn NY 11238 to procure the necessary funds to step up to this exciting new phase in our trajectory. Not to mention a few cool perks such as new T-Shirts, silent auction and our web love for local businesses who support our campaign.
Risks & Challenges

This is a large project to accomplish but its  NOW or NEVER to do it! 

  • Our current space limits the activities we can implement simultaneously during school hours forcing our educators to improvise in the current space they have.
  • There is a limited timeline to meet our goal. If we can't raise the funds, we won't be able to expand our school putting families in a tough position when there is little to none alternative options.

Other Ways You Can Help The Katmint:

  • Please don't hesitate to share, share, SHARE this page! 
  • We are still accepting donations and from businesses and artists for our give away prizes and silent auction.
  • Contact us directly if you would like a flyer to advertise at your business.

To get involved, please email info@TheKatmint.com.

story:
Above video is to present the TeachPTY experience from the volunteer's view.
The text below explains TeachPTY's goals and ambitions.

 

Story

Hello! My name is José, TeachPTY's founder and director.

For many years I've had this idea, I wanted to do something meaningful and bring opportunities to my home town, Panamá. After spending most of my career working in tech corporations, I took the time to volunteer for three months in Bali, and fell in love with the “sensitive traveler” concept. Once in Panamá from my experience in Bali, I met with several volunteer program organizations and NGOs and began shaping my ideas one step at a time. And here was the beginning of TeachPTY.

My project offers a new way to get to know a country by submerging yourself in it and helping a community by sharing places and cultures they would otherwise very unlikely discover, through the introduction of a tool as valuable as a language.

What is TeachPTY ?

TeachPTY is a volunteer organization founded in Panama, Rep. of Panama, dedicated to teaching basic English using interactive/creative methods. Our objective is to attract young professionals, college students and recently graduated individuals who want an unforgettable experience while giving back to the community. We are located in the small town of Pedasi, in the province of Los Santos and our goal is to expand to the rest of the country in the future.

In Panamá, most of the countryside schools don’t teach English. However, if they do the level does not satisfy the needs of our children. This is when Teach PTY comes in, and prepares them to compete within an ever demanding technological environment by providing "the No.1 Educational Language: ENGLISH". In addition to information accessibility we encourage the integration of an constant growing multicultural society allowing for healthy communication, particularly in a country like Panamá which had a tourism increase of 20.9% in 2015; and it has been projected the same for coming years.

Teach PTY operates with international volunteers coming directly into PedasÍ to prepare classes and teach. The benefits for the children are double, as they learn a new language and also a new culture, thus allowing them to blend effectively with newcomers.

Why are we raising money ? 

TeachPTY is all about volunteers. Without volunteers/travelers the project is not viable and neither are the English classes for the kids. The aim of this crowdfunding operation is to accomplish a big partnership operation for TeachPTY to get as many volunteers as possible and get the ball rolling! By this we mean going to the World Youth and Student Travel Confederation (WYSTC) event in Montréal, which is the leading trade event for the global youth, student and educational travel industry, and expose TeachPTY in order to capture as much partnerships as possible.
Everything is up and ready to get running in Pedasí regarding volunteer's accommodation, food provision, transport, activities, etc.- The only piece we're missing is the actual volunteers.

We need to partner with organizations that allow us exposure channels, and the World Youth and Student Travel Confederation will grant us that.

And so, why WYSTC ?

What TeachPTY needs by now is visibility, and WYSTC is the global leading event in our area. Indeed, this event is the way for many volunteering programs to get in touch with organization looking to place volunteers (university, gap year program, etc...). The aim of going there is to get appointments with those organization and come back with partnerships. This is the way how TeachPTY will grow and offer the envisioned service for the children in Pedasí, Panamá.

Obviously, we do promote TeachPTY in other ways (Instagram, Facebook, Google, local fairs, etc.), but it is slower and harder to get some partnership and visibility as long as TeachPTY remains unknown. By experience, personally contacting potential volunteers is big work for little results. We need something way more efficient. This why we need your help to get TeachPTY to the WYSTC event.

How much does it cost to get there ?

The budget is detailed in the chart below. You can see that the main expenses are the booth and WYSTC registration. We obviously decided to take the most basic option (smallest booth) to cut the price as much as possible.

Impact

This business trip is vital for TeachPTY. The objective is to come back with solid partnerships and even maybe people motivated to volunteer. We work daily in building a strong, complete and sustainable program so our vision will expand in our district, and eventually in different spots in Panamá. If you believe -like us- education is the most precious gift we can give, and the solution to our current status as a species, please do not hesitate to help us get closer to accomplishing our dream.
Whatever help is precious: contributions, sharing, even joining us to volunteer if you're strongly motivated.

Thank you sincerely for your time.

Help us make this project glorious!

story:
HUREKA ASSOCIATION:

www.hureka.eu

The Hureka Association was founded in Croatia with the aim of facilitating learning and providing for children's developmental needs from the earliest age; also for the children with neurodevelopmental disorders to secure them a successful start and a safer future.

The success of each child is largely determined by the period of life between birth and age 7.

It is crucial how much a child has learnt, developed physically, mentally, emotionally and socially during these early years. This is not a theory, but a fact based upon a decade of research into the positive effects of early childhood education programs.

Children who are involved in contemporary early childhood education programs either in kindergarten, or in their home will acquire extremely large amount of general knowledge, develop their self-confidence, improve their communication skills and build a good basis for overcoming all the demands of formal school education.

Thanks to the early childhood education and intervention of the society every day, an increasing number of children with neurodevelopmental disorders are enrolled and graduated from the faculties. The phenomenon of the return rate of investment in such children in the long term affects the entire society. Therefore, introducing such children into early childhood education is crucial to their future.

At this moment there is no early childhood education program in Croatia!

 

 

UDRUGA HUREKA:

Udruga  Hureka  osnovana je u Hrvatskoj s ciljem da djeci omogući učenje i napredovanje već od najranije dobi, a djeci s neurorazvojnim  poremećajima  uspješan start i sigurniju budućnost.

Budući uspjeh svakog djeteta u mnogočemu se određuje u dobi  od rođenja do 7 godine.

Tijekom tih ranih godina, koliko je dijete učilo, razvijalo se tjelesno,  mentalno,  emocionalno i socijalno je ključno.  To nije teorija, već činjenica na temelju desetljeća istraživanja o pozitivnim učincima programa rane edukacije.

Djeca koja su uključena u suvremene programe rane edukacije, kroz  vrtić ili u krugu vlastitih obitelji, steći će izuzetno velike količine općeg  znanja, razviti  samopouzdanje, unaprijediti komunikativne vještine i stvoriti podlogu lakšem svladavanju zahtjeva koje će pred njih staviti formalno školsko obrazovanje.

Zahvaljujući ranoj edukaciji i intervenciji društva svakim danom sve veći broj djece s neurorazvojnim poremećajima se upisuje i završava fakultete. Fenomen stope povrata ulaganja u takvu djecu dugoročno utječe na cjelokupno društvo. Stoga je uvođenje takve djece u program rane edukacije ključno za njihovu budućnost.

U ovom trenutku program rane edukacije u Hrvatskoj ne postoji!

           

 

OUR OBJECTIVES:

  • Development of the early childhood education software that will be available to all children in Croatia, and eventually in other countries too.
  • Providing opportunities for children of Croats living in another country to learn Croatian, in a unique and enjoyable way
  •  Establishing an institute that would support parents with early home education (through education, seminars, workshops ...)
  • Establishment of a support group for the introduction of children with neurodevelopmental difficulties into early childhood education system
  • Development and distribution of educational cards for early childhood learning
  • The required amount will suffice for all the above and it will enable us to achieve these goals. If we raise less it will take significantly longer time. However, we believe that we will ultimately achieve our goals. The software development is our priority and our first goal. The funds raised will firstly go to achieving this goal.

 

NAŠI CILJEVI:

  • Razvoj softvera rane edukacije koji će biti dostupan svoj djeci u Hrvatskoj, a s vremenom i u drugim zemljama.
  • Pružanje mogućnosti djeci Hrvata koja žive u nekoj drugoj zemlji da nauče hrvatski jezik, kroz igru i na zabavan način.
  • Osnivanje centra koji će pružati podršku roditeljima oko provođenja rane edukacije kod kuće (kroz edukacije, seminare, radionice ..)
  • Osnivanje skupine  za pomoć oko uvođenja djece s neurorazvojnim poteškoćama u sustav rane edukacije
  • Razvoj i plasman paketa edukacijskih kartica za rano učenje
  • Traženi iznos pokrio bi sve naše planove i postigao navedene ciljeve. Ukoliko ćemo skupiti manje put će trajati značajno dulje, ali vjerujemo da ćemo u konačnici uspjeti sve ostvariti. Razvoj softvera je prioritet i prvi cilj te će prikupljena sredstva biti plasirana prvo u njega, a kasnije i na ostale aktivnosti.

             

 

HIPER SOFTWARE

Croatian Interactive Program for Education and Development - Revolutionary software with multidisciplinary approach to learning.

  • a practical and interactive program that leads parents and children through education
  • enables parents to achieve high goals set by the modern early childhood education programs in less than 10 minutes a day
  • adapted to easily fit into a formal kindergarten program and other educational institutions
  • immensely fun for children, and easy to use for adults on computers, laptops, or tablets

The program is divided into 6 modules, and the initial module is selected according to the child's developmental stage and age.

Through the use of the software children will learn about: colors, geometric shapes, animal types, body parts, means of transport, work machines, plants, traffic signs, weather, opposites, characteristics and species of animals, characteristics of homeland, sport characteristics, days of the week, year, planets, alphabet ....

They will also learn about friendship, dangers, behavior in traffic, occupations, seasons, telling time, sports, music instruments, rules of good behavior, useful objects, hygiene...

They will be introduced to continents, oceans, rivers, lakes, states and cities, historically important figures, cultural attractions, city institutions, most famous works of art, calendar, parts of computer, cultural institutions ...

 

HIPER SOFTVER:

 

Hrvatski Interaktivni Program za Edukaciju i Razvoj Revolucionarni softver s multidisciplinarnim pristupom učenju

Praktičan i interaktivan program koji roditelje i djecu sam vodi kroz edukaciju;

Omogućuje roditeljima da samostalno za manje od 10 minuta dnevno zadovolje visoke ciljeve postavljene suvremenim programima rane edukacije;

Prilagođen stručnim djelatnicima da ga lako mogu uklopiti u formalni program vrtića i drugih odgojno-obrazovnih ustanova;

Djeci neizmjerno zabavan, a odraslima jednostavan za upotrebu putem računala, laptopa ili tableta;

Program je podijeljen u 6 modula, te se početni modul odabire u skladu s djetetovim razvojem i starosti;

Kroz softver djeca će naučiti boje, geometrijske oblike, vrste životinja, dijelove tijela, prijevozna sredstva, radne strojeve, biljke, prometne znakove, koliko je sati, suprotnosti, karakteristike i podvrste životinje, obilježja zavičaja, karakteristike sportova,  dane u tjednu, mjesece u godini, planete, abecedu….

Učiti će o prijateljstvu, opasnostima, ponašanju u prometu, zanimanjima, godišnjim dobima, sportovima, glazbenim instrumentima, pravilima lijepog ponašanja, uporabnim predmetima, higijeni, vremenskim prilikama…

Upoznati  će se s kontinentima, oceanima, rijekama, jezerima, državama i gradovima, povijesno važnim ličnostima, kulturnim znamenitostima, gradskim institucijama, najpoznatijim umjetničkim djelima, kalendarom, dijelovima računala, kulturnim ustanovama ...

         

 

H I P E R is intended for:

  • Children from the age of 4 months to school age;
  • For parents who want to run early childhood education programs independently at home;
  • Educators who want to complement the formal kindergarten (or other educational institution) program with the contemporary early childhood education program;
  • Children with neurodevelopmental difficulties;
  • Gifted-children.
  • It is adapted to children with a decreased manual dexterity due to its eye tracking technology.

 

H I P E R je na namijenjen:

  • Djeci od navršenog 4. mjeseca života do polaska u školu
  • Roditeljima koji program rane edukacije žele provoditi samostalno kod kuće;
  • Odgajateljima koji formalni program vrtića/odgojno-obrazovnih ustanova žele upotpuniti suvremenim programom rane edukacije;
  • Djeci s neuro-razvojnim poteškoćama;
  • Naprednoj djeci.
  • Prilagođen djeci s otežanom motorikom šake jer će njime biti moguće upravljati i pogledom.

           

Expected results after the implementation of HIPER Early Childhood Education Program:

  • Multiplied intelligence
  • Dramatic expansion of vocabulary compared to children who are not included in early childhood education
  • Immense progress in communication skills
  • Perfect reading skills and mastering of implicit grammar rules before going to school
  • Above average encyclopedic knowledge
  • Bonding between parent and child
  • Positive attitude toward learning

 

Očekivani rezultati nakon provedbe H I P E R  programa rane edukacije:

  • Multiplicirana inteligencija djeteta
  • Dramatična ekspanziju u vokabularu u odnosu na djecu koja nisu uključena u ranu edukaciju
  • Drastični napredak u komunikacijskim vještinama
  • Besprijekorno čitanje i ovladavanje gramatikom prije polaska u školu
  • Natprosječno enciklopedijsko znanje
  • Dublja povezanost roditelja i djeteta
  • Stav prema učenja kao pozitivnoj i zabavnoj aktivnosti

 

            

 

Our team:

The HIPER Early Childhood Education program was conducted by the professional guidance of Sandra Grdić Bobinac, M.A. English and Italian, who runs a Helen Doron School in Zagreb. It's Sandra who is responsible for initiating the question of early childhood education in Croatia. She attended numerous seminars and tested the knowledge she gained in her teaching practice as well as with her three sons.

The successful strategies of other countries are the basis of the development of HIPER software in Croatia.

http://spansko.helendoron.hr/page.php?c=centar-...

 

Prof. Ph.D. Miroslav Vrankic, a professor at the Technical Faculty in Rijeka. Last year he was awarded the Google's Global Impact Award. HIPER software for early childhood education will be developed under the management of Prof. Vrankić. Along with his team he also developed the Servus device, which enables the user to manage his home by voice commands, device which changed the lives of many people with disabilities.

http://www.eglas.hr/

 

Sandra Kiš Broz is the editor of Baby Mall magazine and mom of two boys for whom she is actively involved in early childhood education issues in Croatia. Since her job description is to look at the needs of preschool children her role will be to make learning and preschool curriculum the most entertaining game ever.

www.babymall.hr

 

Milica Damjanović, Marketing Manager at Labud Zagreb and President of HUREKA. Her commitment and great desire to provide our children with a more stable future helped us progress to where we are today. All that seemed impossible two years ago is just another step away.

 

Jelena Šimić, mom of four boys, lived in many world metropoles and had the opportunity to become familiar with the practices of other countries. Upon her return to Croatia she became aware of shortcomings of pre-school education in Croatia. Because of her youngest child and the intention to live in Croatia, she is actively involved in providing the opportunities that are offered abroad to our little fellow citizens.

 

Petra Maskalan, the secretary of the HUREKA association and a mother of a one-year-old boy. With her engagement she greatly contributes to creating self-sustainability of the project, which will be of great benefit to kindergarten and pre-school children as well as for the new generations. Her role will also be to facilitate the adaptation of HIPER software to other languages ​​and to other countries.

 

Naš tim:

HIPER program rane edukacije vođen je pod stručnim vodstvom  prof. engleskog i talijanskog  jezika Sandre Grdić Bobinac, vlasnice Helen Doron škole stranih jezika u Zagrebu. Upravo je prof. Grdić Bobinac zaslužna za pokretanje pitanja rane edukacije djece u Hrvatskoj.  Prisustvovala je brojnim edukacijama i seminarima vođenim od strane inozemnih institucija. Prikupljena znanja  iz uspješnih praksi  drugih zemalja podloga su razvoja HIPER programa u Hrvatskoj.

http://spansko.helendoron.hr/page.php?c=centar-ucitelji

 

Prof. dr.sc. Miroslav Vrankić, profesor je Tehničkog fakulteta u Rijeci i osoba koja je prošle godine od strane Googla proglašena jednom od 100 najvećih pokretača pozitivnih, globalno važnih promjena u Europi. Pod njegovim  vodstvom će se razviti softver za HIPER program rane edukacije.  Prof. Vrankić sa svojim je timom razvio uređaj Servus koji  korisniku omogućava da pomoću glasovnih naredbi upravlja svojim domom i time promijenio život brojnim osobama s invaliditetom.

http://www.eglas.hr/

 

Sandra Kiš Broz urednica je dječjeg časopisa Baby Mall i mama dva dječaka zbog kojih se i aktivno uključila u rješavanje pitanja rane edukacije u Hrvatskoj.  Kako je u opisu njenog posla praćenje  potreba djece predškolske dobi i kreiranje sadržaja za njih, njena uloga će biti da učenje i predškolski kurikulum  pretvori u najzabavniju igru.

www.babymall.hr

 

Milica Damjanović, voditeljica marketinga tvrtke Labud Zagreb i predsjednica HUREKE. Svojim angažmanom i velikom željom da za našu djecu osiguramo stabilniju budućnost, razlog je što smo napredovali do toga gdje smo danas. Sve ono što nam se prije 2 godine činilo gotovo nemogućim danas je još samo jedan korak do stvarnosti.

 

Jelena Šimić, mama četvorice dječaka , živjela je u mnogim svjetskim metropolama te imala priliku pobliže se upoznati  s praksama drugih zemalja i iz prve ruke osjetiti  nedostatke predškolskog obrazovanja u Hrvatskoj. Zbog najmlađeg djeteta i namjere da ostanu živjeti u Hrvatskoj aktivno se uključila u to da se prilike koje se vani pružaju, pruže i našim malim sugrađanima.

 

Petra Maskalan, tajnica udruge HUREKA i mama jednogodišnjeg dječaka  svojim angažmanom doprinosi stvaranju okosnice samoodrživosti  projekta koji će biti od velike koristi djeci vrtićke i predškolske dobi kao i nadolazećim generacijama.  Njena uloga ujedno će biti osigurati prilagodbu HIPER softvera na druge jezike i za druge zemlje.

 

Project partners:

Dario Šimić and Mario Jurić, the founders of the "Football Union" in Croatia, retired professional footballers, were among the first ones to recognize and support the efforts of HUREKE for the development of early childhood education programs in Croatia. Their wish to draw attention to the fact that professional football is intended for only a small number of people, especially in a small country such as Croatia, thus received a new dimension. With the help of HUREKA association, they will enable all young footballers in Croatia, from the early age on when they start to play football, to parallelly build the educational background for additional career.

http://www.huns.hr/

            

 

Professional football players: Mateo Kovačić, Luka Modrić, Danijel Subašić and retired professional footballer Mario Stanić also support co-operation with HUREKA and the development of the HIPER early childhood education program in Croatia.

 

Partneri projekta:

Dario Šimić i Mario Jurić, osnivači „Nogometnog sindikata“ u Hrvatskoj, umirovljeni profesionalni nogometaši, među prvima su prepoznali važnost i podržali aktivnosti  HUREKE  za razvojem programa rane edukacije u Hrvatskoj.  Njihova nastojanja  da skrenu pažnju na to kako od nogometa može živjeti samo mali broj ljudi, osobito u maloj zemlji kao što je Hrvatska time su dobila i jednu novu dimenziju. Suradnjom s  udrugom HUREKA omogućit će svim mladim nogometašima u Hrvatskoj da od rane dobi kada se počnu baviti nogometom, paralelno grade i obrazovnu podlogu daljnjem školovanju i izgradnji druge karijere kojom će se moći baviti po završetku nogometne.

http://www.huns.hr/

Profesionalni nogometaši Mateo Kovačić, Luka Modrić, Danijel Subašić i umirovljeni profesionalni nogometaš Mario Stanić također su pružili ruku podršku suradnji  HUNS-a i HUREKE i razvoju HIPER programa rane edukcije u Hrvatskoj.

            

 

CONCLUSION:

HIPER software is mainly designed for the advancement of the Croatian children but will also be a great tool for those who want to learn Croatian, learn more about the Croatian culture and gain a rich general knowledge. If you are a Croat who has left your homeland and want to teach your children Croatian this is an ideal way to achieve it in less than 10 minutes a day, in a fun and interactive way.

Very soon after the completion of the Croatian version of HIPER software, the program will be translated into other languages (English, German, Italian, Slovenian, Serbian, Hungarian etc.)

The period required for the software development is 6 months.

The period required for the software to be translated into other languages is 12 months.

 

ZAKLJUČAK:

HIPER softver, osim za djecu u Hrvatskoj ujedno će biti odličan alat ako želite učiti hrvatski jezik i saznati više o Hrvatskoj kulturi i općenito steći bogatu opću kulturu. Ako ste Hrvat koji je napustio svoju domovinu, a želite da Vam djeca uče i hrvatski jezik ovo je idealan način da to postignete za manje od 10 minuta dnevno, na zabavan i interaktivna način. 

Veoma brzo nakon završetka  Hrvatske inačice HIPER softvera , program će biti ponuđen i na drugim jezicima (Engleski, Njemački, Talijanski, Slovenski, Srpski, Mađarski itd.)

Period potreban za razvoj softvera je 6 mjeseci.

Prilagodba na druge jezike u periodu od 12 mjeseci.

 

           

 

Udruga za ranu edukaciju - HUREKA

Gradiščanska 30, 10000 Zagreb

IBAN: HR9024840081135021434

SWIFT: RZBHHR2X

Thank you!
story_txt:
HUREKA ASSOCIATION:www.hureka.euThe Hureka Association was founded in Croatia with the aim of facilitating learning and providing for children's developmental needs from the earliest age; also for the children with neurodevelopmental disorders to secure them a successful start and a safer future.The success of each child is largely determined by the period of life between birth and age 7.It is crucial how much a child has learnt, developed physically, mentally, emotionally and socially during these early years. This is not a theory, but a fact based upon a decade of research into the positive effects of early childhood education programs.Children who are involved in contemporary early childhood education programs either in kindergarten, or in their home will acquire extremely large amount of general knowledge, develop their self-confidence, improve their communication skills and build a good basis for overcoming all the demands of formal school education.Thanks to the early childhood education and intervention of the society every day, an increasing number of children with neurodevelopmental disorders are enrolled and graduated from the faculties. The phenomenon of the return rate of investment in such children in the long term affects the entire society. Therefore, introducing such children into early childhood education is crucial to their future.At this moment there is no early childhood education program in Croatia!  UDRUGA HUREKA:Udruga  Hureka  osnovana je u Hrvatskoj s ciljem da djeci omogući učenje i napredovanje već od najranije dobi, a djeci s neurorazvojnim  poremećajima  uspješan start i sigurniju budućnost.Budući uspjeh svakog djeteta u mnogočemu se određuje u dobi  od rođenja do 7 godine.Tijekom tih ranih godina, koliko je dijete učilo, razvijalo se tjelesno,  mentalno,  emocionalno i socijalno je ključno.  To nije teorija, već činjenica na temelju desetljeća istraživanja o pozitivnim učincima programa rane edukacije.Djeca koja su uključena u suvremene programe rane edukacije, kroz  vrtić ili u krugu vlastitih obitelji, steći će izuzetno velike količine općeg  znanja, razviti  samopouzdanje, unaprijediti komunikativne vještine i stvoriti podlogu lakšem svladavanju zahtjeva koje će pred njih staviti formalno školsko obrazovanje.Zahvaljujući ranoj edukaciji i intervenciji društva svakim danom sve veći broj djece s neurorazvojnim poremećajima se upisuje i završava fakultete. Fenomen stope povrata ulaganja u takvu djecu dugoročno utječe na cjelokupno društvo. Stoga je uvođenje takve djece u program rane edukacije ključno za njihovu budućnost.U ovom trenutku program rane edukacije u Hrvatskoj ne postoji!            OUR OBJECTIVES:
Development of the early childhood education software that will be available to all children in Croatia, and eventually in other countries too.
Providing opportunities for children of Croats living in another country to learn Croatian, in a unique and enjoyable way
 Establishing an institute that would support parents with early home education (through education, seminars, workshops ...)
Establishment of a support group for the introduction of children with neurodevelopmental difficulties into early childhood education system
Development and distribution of educational cards for early childhood learning
The required amount will suffice for all the above and it will enable us to achieve these goals. If we raise less it will take significantly longer time. However, we believe that we will ultimately achieve our goals. The software development is our priority and our first goal. The funds raised will firstly go to achieving this goal.
 NAŠI CILJEVI:
Razvoj softvera rane edukacije koji će biti dostupan svoj djeci u Hrvatskoj, a s vremenom i u drugim zemljama.
Pružanje mogućnosti djeci Hrvata koja žive u nekoj drugoj zemlji da nauče hrvatski jezik, kroz igru i na zabavan način.
Osnivanje centra koji će pružati podršku roditeljima oko provođenja rane edukacije kod kuće (kroz edukacije, seminare, radionice ..)
Osnivanje skupine  za pomoć oko uvođenja djece s neurorazvojnim poteškoćama u sustav rane edukacije
Razvoj i plasman paketa edukacijskih kartica za rano učenje
Traženi iznos pokrio bi sve naše planove i postigao navedene ciljeve. Ukoliko ćemo skupiti manje put će trajati značajno dulje, ali vjerujemo da ćemo u konačnici uspjeti sve ostvariti. Razvoj softvera je prioritet i prvi cilj te će prikupljena sredstva biti plasirana prvo u njega, a kasnije i na ostale aktivnosti.

characteristics, days of the week, year, planets, alphabet ....They will also learn about friendship, dangers, behavior in traffic, occupations, seasons, telling time, sports, music instruments, rules of good behavior, useful objects, hygiene...They will be introduced to continents, oceans, rivers, lakes, states and cities, historically important figures, cultural attractions, city institutions, Prikupljena znanja  iz uspješnih praksi  drugih zemalja podloga su razvoja HIPER programa u Hrvatskoj.http://spansko.helendoron.hr/page.php?c=centar-ucitelji Prof. dr.sc. Miroslav Vrankić, profesor je Tehničkog fakulteta u Rijeci i osoba koja je prošle godine od strane Googla proglašena jednom od 100 najvećih pokretača pozitivnih, globalno važnih promjena u Europi. Pod njegovim  vodstvom će se razviti softver za HIPER program rane edukacije.  Prof. Vrankić sa svojim je timom razvio uređaj Servus koji  korisniku omogućava da pomoću glasovnih naredbi upravlja svojim domom i time promijenio život brojnim osobama s invaliditetom.http://www.eglas.hr/ Sandra Kiš Broz urednica je dječjeg časopisa Baby Mall i mama dva dječaka zbog kojih se i aktivno uključila u rješavanje pitanja rane edukacije u Hrvatskoj.  Kako je u opisu njenog posla praćenje  potreba djece predškolske dobi i kreiranje sadržaja za njih, njena uloga će biti da učenje i predškolski kurikulum  pretvori u najzabavniju igru.www.babymall.hr Milica Damjanović, voditeljica marketinga tvrtke Labud Zagreb i predsjednica HUREKE. Svojim angažmanom i velikom željom da za našu djecu osiguramo stabilniju budućnost, razlog je što smo napredovali do toga gdje smo danas. Sve ono što nam se prije 2 godine činilo gotovo nemogućim danas je još samo jedan korak do stvarnosti. Jelena Šimić, mama četvorice dječaka , živjela je u mnogim svjetskim metropolama te imala priliku pobliže se upoznati  s praksama drugih zemalja i iz prve ruke osjetiti  nedostatke predškolskog obrazovanja u Hrvatskoj. Zbog najmlađeg djeteta i namjere da ostanu živjeti u Hrvatskoj aktivno se uključila u to da se prilike koje se vani pružaju, pruže i našim malim sugrađanima. Petra Maskalan, tajnica udruge HUREKA i mama jednogodišnjeg dječaka  svojim angažmanom doprinosi stvaranju okosnice samoodrživosti  projekta koji će biti od velike koristi djeci vrtićke i predškolske dobi kao i nadolazećim generacijama.  Njena uloga ujedno će biti osigurati prilagodbu HIPER softvera na druge jezike i za druge zemlje. Project partners:Dario Šimić and Mario Jurić, the founders of the "Football Union" in Croatia, retired professional footballers, were among the first ones to recognize and support the efforts of HUREKE for the development of early childhood education programs in Croatia. Their wish to draw attention to the fact that professional football is intended for only a small number of people, especially in a small country such as Croatia, thus received a new dimension. With the help of HUREKA association, they will enable all young footballers in Croatia, from the early age on when they start to play football, to parallelly build the educational background for additional career.http://www.huns.hr/             Professional football players: Mateo Kovačić, Luka Modrić, Danijel Subašić and retired professional footballer Mario Stanić also support co-operation with HUREKA and the development of the HIPER early childhood education program in Croatia. Partneri projekta:Dario Šimić i Mario Jurić, osnivači „Nogometnog sindikata“ u Hrvatskoj, umirovljeni profesionalni nogometaši, među prvima su prepoznali važnost i podržali aktivnosti  HUREKE  za razvojem programa rane edukacije u Hrvatskoj.  Njihova nastojanja  da skrenu pažnju na to kako od nogometa može živjeti samo mali broj ljudi, osobito u maloj zemlji kao što je Hrvatska time su dobila i jednu novu dimenziju. Suradnjom s  udrugom HUREKA omogućit će svim mladim nogometašima u Hrvatskoj da od rane dobi kada se počnu baviti nogometom, paralelno grade i obrazovnu podlogu daljnjem školovanju i izgradnji druge karijere kojom će se moći baviti po završetku nogometne.http://www.huns.hr/Profesionalni nogometaši Mateo Kovačić, Luka Modrić, Danijel Subašić i umirovljeni profesionalni nogometaš Mario Stanić također su pružili ruku podršku suradnji  HUNS-a i HUREKE i razvoju HIPER programa rane edukcije u Hrvatskoj.             CONCLUSION:HIPER software is mainly designed for the advancement of the Croatian children but will also be a great tool for those who want to learn Croatian, learn more about the Croatian culture and gain a rich general knowledge. If you are a Croat who has left your homeland and want to teach your children Croatian this is an ideal way to achieve it in less than 10 minutes a day, in a fun and interactive way.Very soon after the completion of the Croatian version of HIPER software, the program will be translated into other languages (English, German, Italian, Slovenian, Serbian, Hungarian etc.)The period required for the software development is 6 months.The period required for the software to be translated into other languages is 12 months. ZAKLJUČAK:HIPER softver, osim za djecu u Hrvatskoj ujedno će biti odličan alat ako želite učiti hrvatski jezik i saznati više o Hrvatskoj kulturi i općenito steći bogatu opću kulturu. Ako ste Hrvat koji je napustio svoju domovinu, a želite da Vam djeca uče i hrvatski jezik ovo je idealan način da to postignete za manje od 10 minuta dnevno, na zabavan i interaktivna način. Veoma brzo nakon završetka  Hrvatske inačice HIPER softvera , program će biti ponuđen i na drugim jezicima (Engleski, Njemački, Talijanski, Slovenski, Srpski, Mađarski itd.)Period potreban za razvoj softvera je 6 mjeseci.Prilagodba na druge jezike u periodu od 12 mjeseci.             Udruga za ranu edukaciju - HUREKAGradiščanska 30, 10000 ZagrebIBAN: HR9024840081135021434SWIFT: RZBHHR2XThank you!

story:
At the age of 19, I became pregnant with my now 8-year-old son. This was a difficult time because although I was in college, I was unemployed and subsequently dropped out of college. I found part-time work when Shakur was 8 weeks, but learned a tough lesson in child care costs. The harsh reality was that I could not afford to go to work! I had to rely on family and friends to watch my son, but would also have to call in, often. I decided it was time to go back to school. My late father quit his job for some time to watch my son while I completed my first college degree. It was at this time that I had an epiphany: “Hey, this is very difficult! I don’t want other young girls to go through what I am going through.” But what will I do about this? First, I started a website, www.sherockinspired.com, and have been managing the site for 4 years and counting. However, I still felt as if there was more to do. From there, I envisioned the program. 

She Rock Inspired is a Leadership and Empowerment program teaching girls about Reproductive/Sexual Health. The organization seeks to empower girls to strive for economic independence, knowledge about their reproductive health with the goal of eradicating teen pregnancy,  thus alleviating the feminization of poverty.

The program is broken down into 4 parts: Reproductive/Sexual Health, Leadership, Self-Esteem, & Slaying. Each program is roughly 2 hours and will include workbooks, special speakers, and collaborations with other organizations that may suit a girl’s needs. Once She Rock Inspired secures a place where we work out of, one Saturday out of the month will be mentoring days from 9am-1pm. Initially, the program will be an after-school program that works with schools or other organizations. In addition, we will host an annual conference that broadens the topics that are discussed with young girls. 

FYI: 

Did you know that better access to contraceptive information and services can reduce the number of girls becoming pregnant and giving birth at too young an age? 

Did you know counseling and behavioral interventions offer primary prevention against STIs, including HIV? 

Did you know the rates of teenage motherhood remain highest in states that promote abstinence-only policies? Providing young women with insufficient and misleading information about their reproductive health has a dramatically negative economic impact on the nation’s teenage mothers and on the nation as a whole.

The economic implications of a girl becoming pregnant at a young age, statistically, devastates her economic future. This rings true in the economic powerhouse of The US as well as in developing countries. I have a life goal to help alleviate the feminization of poverty. Your help will contribute to this. 

We are asking for your help in funding this year’s program goals. First, we will host a girls conference in October 2017 with the goal of having 100 girls served. Second, I will continue to partner with other organizations hosting workshops with the goal of the program branching into schools in the Washington, DC area. Next, we will establish a voucher for low-income girls to receive access to feminine products. Finally, we will establish a $500 college scholarship fund in the name of Robert Louis Love Jr., for young girls entering college in the Fall of 2018 that have been affected by the loss or absence of a father. 


With Lots and Lots of Love,

Robinette L’Oréal Love
