story:
About This Project

Hello! My name is Jun Sugawara of the Animator Supporters.

This project is aimed to set up more dormitory facilities that animators who are new to the industry can use for 30,000JPY(250USD) per month (including utility expenses).

The animators who get to use the [Starting Out Animators’ Dormitory] will also get chances for social exchanges beyond the boundaries of companies, and also receive technical support for illustrations and drawing.

Currently, we are supporting 6 starting out animators at the dorm. And we are going to expand the dorm facility so that 8 animators can use this dormitory from March 2017.

For this project, we aim to raise part of the money to stably maintain the Animators’ Dormitory for startups, which is approximately 3600000JPY(30,000USD).

But as we are short in managing funds in order to maintain this dormitory, we would like to ask for your kind support.


Animation content has gained worldwide popularity. Also for Japan, it is an industry where the contents can be exported without importing any resources since Japan is a country which lacks in abundant natural resources.

Even now, many animation programs are shown both on TV and in theaters, and there are also many people who say they love watching Anime.

But behind that shiny center stage, the average salary of animators in their 20’s is said to be just around 90,000JPY per month.

**According to the research on the current situation (answered by 728 people) announced by the Japan Animation Creators Association (JAniCA) in 2009 states that the average monthly income of animators in their 20’s is a bit more than 90,000JPY(750USD).

Which makes it around 1,100,000JPY(9,000USD) on an yearly basis.




The reason why their salaries are so drastically low despite the hard workload, overtime work, holiday shifts at almost every field of work, is in most cases, animators are hired and paid according to the piece-work system(※2) based on the price per each frame an animator draws, and it takes time to become a skillful animator who can draw quicker and cover more frames within the given time and to have a fair amount of earnings per month.

※2For many cases, animators’ salaries are determined based on the number of the sketches they draw.

For a typical TV anime series, an animator makes ￥200 (About 2 USD) by drawing ONE picture.

If one draws 300 pictures per month,

his monthly salary is only: 300 drawings × ￥200 = ￥60,000($500).

However, drawing 300 sketches is a really challenging task for a startup animator.

In addition, animators generally do not have time to do a part time job, which makes it even harder to make a stable living.



In the hope to solve this problem, the NPO Animator Supporters,  opened the first Animator Dormitory that allow new, young animators to live on ￥30,000($250), including the expenses for water, gas, electricity, AC, and Internet and that encourage them to take lessons on drawing and painting.

Many animation studios are mostly located in Tokyo (especially in the Suginami and Nerima districts), and the high monthly cost for rent in Tokyo becomes a greater burden for startup animators who have moved to Tokyo from other parts of Japan.

Startup animators are in a state where they have to pay high rent in Tokyo to live, despite of their low income.


By establishing a dormitory where new animators can work without worrying about making a stable living, we can provide them with an environment in which they can focus on their work, take lessons and get support.


[NPO Animator Supporters : Achievements]

For the past 5 years, the Animator Supporters has provided the shelters to 12 start-up animators. 

When we first started this housing assistance, we helped startups pay their rents by simply providing a monetary assistance of 600,000 yen per year for the winner(s) of the Grand Prix for starting out animators. 


・Holding Grand Prix for starting out animators

 http://animator.main.jp/prize_2016.html

 This is our 5th year to host this contest. 


【Article from Asahi Shimbun, September 2011 】

The following article is about Shingo Tamagawa, the winner of the first Grand Prix for starting out animators. 

***Mr. Tamagawa became a character animation director for Gundam Reconguista G approximately 3 years after receiving assistance from the Animator Supporters. 

・Any start-up animator who will be working at an animation company/studio is qualified to apply to 【the Grand Prix for starting out animators】. A winner will receive a one-year housing assistance. 

【The 1st Grand Prix for starting out animators】
Winner: Shingo Tamagawa

【His works】

・"Gundam Reconguista G"(2014) - Character animation director 

・"Kabaneri for the Iron Fortress"(2016) -Design support  etc. 


【The 2nd Grand Prix for starting out animators】

Winner: Tatsuro Kawano

【His works】

・"Naruto Shippuuden" (TV series) - Digital key animation director 
・"GATCHAMAN CROWDS" (TV series/2013）-Key digital key animation director 

・"Yozakura Quartet -Hana no Uta-" (TV series/2013) -Digital key animation director 
・"Inishie no Megami to Houseki no Ite"（PV/2014）-Key animation director 

and a character designer 
・"PSYCHO-PASS 2（TV/2014）"　-Key animation director 

・"Kabaneri for the Iron Fortress" （TV/2016）-Key action animator etc.



Winner: Moeka Kuga 

【Her works】

・"Wish upon the Pleiades"（TV series/2015）-Key animation director 
・"Sansha San'yō"（TV series/2016）- Key animation director etc.



【The 3rd Grand Prix for starting out animators】

Winner: Namiko Ishidate

Winner: Ryosuke Kanai　


【About the Grand Prix selection committee 】

•Naoyuki Asano 
"Doraemon: Nobita and the New Steel Troops—Winged Angels" -Chief animation supervisor 

"Osomatsu san"TV/2015~2016）-Character design, storyboards, key animation director 

•Shingo Yamashita 
"Naruto Shippuuden"- Key animation 
"Yozakura Quartet -Hoshi no Umi-" -Action scenes, storyboards, and key animation 
"Birdy the Mighty: DECODE" -End roll, storyboards, and key animation
"Song of Warm Oden" -animator and director 
"GATCHAMAN CROWDS" -Key animation director 

Mr. Asano and Mr. Yamashita select the winner(s) of the Grand Prix for starting out animators. 


【Asahi Shinbum article from February 2015】

The Asahi Shinbum ran an article about the Animator Dormitory.



•Animator Dormitory Facebook 

https://www.facebook.com/AnimatorDormitory


(Interior of the 1st Dormitory opened on March 2014)


•Anime workshops

http://animator.main.jp/workshop_2015_001.html

We have always wished there was an opportunity where animators and those who want to work in the anime-making field can directly interact and help each other improve skills. However, the reality is, it is generally very difficult because of the demanding work required to organize such a thing.

Now, the Animator Supporters would like to take the "demanding" work to make it happen so that experienced animators can give startups advice and help them improve their drawing skills. We hope to make a place where animators can come and go freely and interact with one other.

*Startups who live in the Animator Dormitory can take the anime workshops for FREE!


[About the Perks]

[Perks for 150USD support]

・[The 1st Starting Out Animators’ Grand Prix / Catalogue] ×1 copy

 (32 pages / Color 2 pages)

・[The 2nd Starting Out Animators’ Grand Prix / Catalogue] ×1 copy

 (32 pages / Color 2 pages)

・[The 3rd Starting Out Animators’ Grand Prix / Catalogue] ×1 copy

 (32 pages / Color 2 pages)


•A mini movie by Kenichi Kutsuna

•A mini movie by Kenichi Kutsuna

A mini movie of explosion: a QT movie of each layer (HD1920×1080), an integrated QT movie for preview (HD 1920×1080), and a flash.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
【Kenichi Kutsuna】 
“Gurren Lagann” Key animation
“Naruto Shippuden” (TV) Key animation (OP 5-6, ED15) 
“Hori-san to Miyamura-kun” (OVA/2012-) Character design, chief animation director 
“A Certain Magical Index Movie: Miracle of Endymion” (2013) Effect animation director
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


[Perks for 300USD support]

・150USD worth of exchange coupon plus,

・[The 4th Starting Out Animators’ Grand Prix / Catalogue] ×1 copy

 (32 pages / Color 2 pages)


•Three mini movies and three projects by Kenichi Kutsuna.

A mini movie of explosion etc.- a QT movie of each layer (HD1920×1080), an integrated QT movie for preview (HD 1920×1080), and a flash. 

You’ll receive 3 of these from each.


[Exchange Coupons for 500USD support]

・300USD worth of exchange coupon plus,

•Five mini movies and five projects by Kenichi Kutsuna.

A mini movie of water etc.: a QT movie of each layer (HD1920×1080), an integrated QT movie for preview (HD 1920×1080), and a flash. You’ll receive 5 of these from each.


[Perk for 1,000USD support]

・500USD worth of exchange coupon plus,

・10 mini movies and 10 projects by Kenichi Kutsuna

A mini movie of smoke etc.: a QT movie of each layer (HD1920×1080), an integrated QT movie for preview (HD 1920×1080), and a flash. You’ll receive 10 of these from each.

・You will also get to talk with Kenichi Kutsuna via Skype!


[Perk for 3,000USD support]

・1000USD worth of exchange coupon plus,

・27 mini movie and a project complete set by Kenichi Kutsuna.

A mini movie of explosion etc.: a QT movie of each layer (HD1920×1080), an integrated QT movie for preview (HD 1920×1080), and a flash. You’ll receive 27 of these from each.


Thank you for reading!

We hope that you can lend a helping hand to the Japanese anime industry.

【Asahi Shinbum article from February 2015】
The Asahi Shinbum ran an article about the Animator Dormitory.

•Animator Dormitory Facebook https://www.facebook.com/AnimatorDormitory(Interior of the 1st Dormitory opened on March 2014)•Anime workshopshttp://animator.main.jp/workshop_2015_001.htmlWe have always wished there was an opportunity where animators and those who want to work in the anime-making field can directly interact and help each other improve skills. However, the reality is, it is generally very difficult because of the demanding work required to organize such a thing.Now, the Animator Supporters would like to take the "demanding" work to make it happen so that experienced animators can give startups advice and help them improve their drawing skills. We hope to make a place where animators can come and go freely and interact with one other.*Startups who live in the Animator Dormitory can take the anime workshops for FREE![About the Perks][Perks for 150USD support]・[The 1st Starting Out Animators’ Grand Prix / Catalogue] ×1 copy (32 pages / Color 2 pages)・[The 2nd Starting Out Animators’ Grand Prix / Catalogue] ×1 copy (32 pages / Color 2 pages)
・[The 3rd Starting Out Animators’ Grand Prix / Catalogue] ×1 copy (32 pages / Color 2 pages)•A mini movie by Kenichi Kutsuna•A mini movie by Kenichi KutsunaA mini movie of explosion: a QT movie of each layer (HD1920×1080), an integrated QT movie for preview (HD 1920×1080), and a flash.------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------【Kenichi Kutsuna】 “Gurren Lagann” Key animation“Naruto Shippuden” (TV) Key animation (OP 5-6, ED15) “Hori-san to Miyamura-kun” (OVA/2012-) Character design, chief animation director “A Certain Magical Index Movie: Miracle of Endymion” (2013) Effect animation director------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[Perks for 300USD support]・150USD worth of exchange coupon plus,・[The 4th Starting Out Animators’ Grand Prix / Catalogue] ×1 copy (32 pages / Color 2 pages)•Three mini movies and three projects by Kenichi Kutsuna.A mini movie of explosion etc.- a QT movie of each layer (HD1920×1080), an integrated QT movie for preview (HD 1920×1080), and a flash. You’ll receive 3 of these from each.[Exchange Coupons for 500USD support]・300USD worth of exchange coupon plus,•Five mini movies and five projects by Kenichi Kutsuna.A mini movie of water etc.: a QT movie of each layer (HD1920×1080), an integrated QT movie for preview (HD 1920×1080), and a flash. You’ll receive 5 of these from each.[Perk for 1,000USD support]・500USD worth of exchange coupon plus,・10 mini movies and 10 projects by Kenichi KutsunaA mini movie of smoke etc.: a QT movie of each layer (HD1920×1080), an integrated QT movie for preview (HD 1920×1080), and a flash. You’ll receive 10 of these from each.・You will also get to talk with Kenichi Kutsuna via Skype![Perk for 3,000USD support]・1000USD worth of exchange coupon plus,・27 mini movie and a project complete set by Kenichi Kutsuna.
A mini movie of explosion etc.: a QT movie of each layer (HD1920×1080), an integrated QT movie for preview (HD 1920×1080), and a flash. You’ll receive 27 of these from each.
Thank you for reading!
We hope that you can lend a helping hand to the Japanese anime industry.

story:
Thank you for all your support!

The campaign is now closed but you can still support by donating here.

Help our Children to Build a New World

Sulma was a very shy 12 year old girl who had never left her South Bronx neighborhood. Then she came to The Actors Theatre Workshop, an award-winning non-profit that has changed the lives of thousands of at-risk and homeless youth for over 26 years through drama and education programs.

Now 24 years later Sulma is the Director of Operations at the NYC Hispanic Chamber of Commerce. She attributes her successes to the lessons she learned from ATW’s Artistic Director and Founder Thurman E. Scott.

“I came from all the noise to a safe haven. Thurman saw who I really was 
and gave me that voice and power to say, ‘Sulma, you can change the world.’ From that moment on my voice mattered.”

Please Help Save this program . . . so more children can succeed

The Actors Theatre Workshop (ATW) guides and teaches some of our most vulnerable young New Yorkers. We created our award-winning Builders of the New World  program especially for children dealing with the tremendous instability of living in temporary housing facilities.

Today, our efforts to continue impacting our precious children are in jeopardy. We unexpectedly lost a long-time major funder because of economic pressure, while rent expense for our theatre has increased dramatically. 

We need your help today. Please make a tax-deductible donation and help us save our children’s program. Join with us to nurture and help our children overcome their present challenges. Save this program that ignites their ambition and helps our children to fulfill their potential as contributing citizens.

How We Change Lives

ATW was founded by Thurman E. Scott, a gifted theatre artist and award-winning actor, writer and director who believes that creativity is the great equalizer. Thurman’s original theatre techniques provide the foundation for our life-changing Builders of The New World  program. The children learn to strengthen their imaginations, develop a vision of their future success and take tangible educational steps today to achieve their dreams for tomorrow.

Today, 23,424 homeless children in New York City and 2.5 million homeless children throughout the United States are dealing with difficult issues of transience and instability. For example, homeless children go hungry twice as often as other children. ATW’s staff and diverse group of volunteer mentors help create a warm, stable, and homelike environment for the children. They love coming to our clean, respectful theatre facility in Chelsea to meet new friends, eat delicious food and grow.

Each program session starts with a family-style dinner of tasty, nutritious meals donated by top NYC restaurants.


Reading, Writing and a Vision for the Future

In the Builders of the New World, we teach the children original theatre and education techniques that improve their reading, writing and presentation skills. They learn to have an intention in life, and draw and write about their visions for the future.



A young Builder of the New World rehearses her presentation for the program


Making An Impact

The children rehearse their original monologues, and then have the unforgettable experience of presenting their visions to an invited audience of family, friends, and important NYC business government, and educational leaders.

This invaluable experience lets the children see first-hand their power to make an impact in the world. They learn they can be seen — an idea that strikes at the heart of homelessness, which can be an existential struggle of invisibility.

By the time the children graduate, they have fully embraced their new mantle as Builders of the New World. These proud, confident and poised young leaders have developed inspiring visions for the future . . . and most important, gained the tools to make an impact in the world and achieve their dreams.

Sulma . . . One of our many success stories

Like many children in our programs, when Sulma arrived at ATW she didn’t see herself as a leader, and didn’t know the steps to take to improve her life and her community. By the time she graduated from ATW's drama program, Sulma had found her voice and gained a foundation for future success that has served her for her whole life.

Sulma and her daughters visited us at ATW last month

Today, Sulma is a nationally recognized author, and stands as a progressive voice for her community in the South Bronx. She has created what she describes as a “beautiful life” with her wonderful husband and two curious and articulate daughters.

“I wanted my daughters to see where I come from. I’ll never stop talking about ATW and what you did for me.”

Sulma's story is not unique

Many of our graduates have turned their lives around and found success in positions such as fashion designers, social workers, musicians and teachers. Over the years countless young adults have come back to visit our theatre and share their stories of the difference we made in their lives.

BUILDERS OF THE NEW WORLD IS NOW IN DANGER

ATW is currently facing its first major financial crisis in 26 years that can stop our ability to offer this life-changing program to those children who need it most.

We’ve unexpectedly lost $150,000 in critical funding due to economic hardship . . . while the rent on our facility, which we designed and built with an outpouring of community support in 1990, has increased 60%.

When our children walk through ATW’s doors, not only do they benefit from life-changing theatre and education classes . . .  they start to feel a sense of ownership of one of NYC’s cultural institutions at a time of great instability in their lives. Please donate and help to preserve this valuable resource for our children.

HOW YOUR DONATIONS WILL BE USED

Please donate to fund the expenses to deliver our children’s program throughout the year, including art, food and office supplies; travel between ATW and the temporary housing facilities, cleaning and videography expenses; and studio rental expenses.  

Your charitable, tax-deductible donation will save the Builders of the New World Program, allow us to serve a larger number of temporary housing facilities and their young residents, and ensure that we can continue to help at-risk and homeless children achieve a better future.

We all have a responsibility to make sure that every child has
the opportunity to achieve their potential.

So please take this opportunity to participate in a wonderful celebration of hope, majesty and love that represents the lifting up of our most precious commodity — our children — before it’s too late, and donate today.

When our children have the right guidance, support and vision...

When they are taught tangible steps they can take each day...

When they develop the discipline to do those steps
and adhere to those philosophies...

...miracles can happen.

Help build a better world for our children through theatre and education.

Please donate and help us to achieve our goal. Our children thank you!

*********************

To Learn More . . . 

  • ATW Mission Statement: Click here to read ATW's powerful mission to uplift the community through drama. 
  • Our Leadership: Being directed and taught by a theatre artist of Thurman E. Scott's magnitude is a once in a lifetime opportunity for the children. 
  • Awards and Recognition: ATW has been endorsed by every NYC Mayoral administration and City Council since we were founded, and won numerous awards for our work in the community.  
  • Testimonials:  Read the heartwarming words of our students and volunteers as they reflect on their experiences at ATW.

story:
To us living in the Western world, it is hard to imagine a child being deprived the right to education. However, this is the potential reality for many students at the Redhill Baraka School in Kenya, a school of 160 students, 80 of which are orphaned, whose school is, as of 2015, failing to sustain itself. With this campaign, we hope to revive the self-sufficiency of this institution and provide its students with a stable future.

Redhill Baraka School, located in Gachie, Kenya , is a primary school that strives to give hope and support to orphaned children by giving them the education they need for their future. Unfortunately, funding for this program was withdrawn 7 years ago. Redhill Baraka School brought itself back from the verge of being closed. However, rent for the land the school sits on is rising, and a recent purchase of a school bus has left them struggling. Teachers and staff volunteer their services and scholarships are running out, leaving students stranded at the school without any resources to help them.

 

Redhill Baraka School

This is where we, Enactus University College Utrecht, stepped in. Enactus UCU is a team of committed international students located in the Netherlands. We are a part of a larger international non-profit organisation, connecting over 65,000 students worldwide with academics and business leaders in 36 countries. Our goal is to use the power of social entrepreneurship to target real world challenges.

Since taking this project on in 2014, we have raised over 11.000 euros, and with this money we have established the Baraka Fish Farm, a professional farm where 6000 Tilapia will be raised for commercial sale. With the sale of these fish, which will result in an annual profit of around 8000, the Redhill Baraka School would become fully self-sufficient. With the money we had raised, land was rented, employees hired, the pond constructed, and the first batch of fish were released in the pond in August 2015. The farm was performing very well and the fish were growing even faster than firstly anticipated, and we were expecting the first fish to be suitable for commercial sale in February 2016. However, after all the tireless work put in and the hope felt by the members Redhill Baraka School, disaster struck in the form of El Niño in december 2015, severly damaging the Fish Farm and making the first harvest untangiable.

Even though we have suffered this large setback, we are still determined to make this project a success, but we do need your help! Our plan is to rebuild the Fish Farm as soon as possible, to make sure that the school will receive their much needed boost to become self sustaining. Despite the fact that last december’s storm was unusually powerful, we want to make sure that the improved Fish Farm will be able to endure almost all possible weather conditions. We have therefore implemented a large number of improvements in collaboration with our local partners in Utrecht and Kenya, in order to put Baraka Fish Farm back on its feet. 

With your donations, you can be part of this amazing project and help raise the required sum to keep this program running!

                            Please Be Our BOOST
                                             And

Share this Campaign With the People Around You!


For more information, feel free to check out our website!

http://www.enactus-ucu.nl/projecten/fishfarm/

*NB: Because we are raising in euros, the only payment option that is currently available to us is PayPal. However, you do not need a PayPal account to be able to use this system! You can also donate money with your credit/debit card via PayPal's ''Guest Checkout'' function.

story:
Summary

As a Professor teaching at a #1 ranked MBA program I noticed an interesting trend: increasingly, already well-educated professionals like physicians, attorneys, engineers, scientists, etc. were taking time away from their professional work to enroll in an MBA program.  It occurred to me that there's a huge potential audience of professionals who would see the benefit of learning the fundamentals of business without having to incur the expense and opportunity cost of getting an MBA. MBA in a Day, published in 2004, (same year of Google IPO and “pre-Facebook”) has successfully met that need.  More than a decade later, it's time for MBA in a Day 2.0, an important update to my best-selling book.

What We Need & What You Get

Over the past year I have researched, written, woven-in and updated the content of business fundamentals for MBA in A Day 2.0.

85,000 words and 303 pages later, the draft is ready for final editing, and for the creation of engaging graphics, book production and distribution.

In today's disruptive market for books and intellectual content, it's all about generating awareness, interest and action to engage an audience and share with them meaningful work.  Most of the funding will be dedicated to developing, nurturing and sharing this new work that has a large audience and a big market opportunity.  Here is a breakdown of the use of funds:

  • $2,000 for final editing  ($.02 per word)
  • $2,500 for cover design, charts, graphs, design consulting
  • $3,000 for formatting and layout, final production version

The Impact

Organizations, and their leaders, are increasingly aware of the need to professionalize the way they are delivering their services or producing their product. This trend is affecting heretofore “not-a-business” organizations like nonprofits, hospitals, scientific research laboratories, etc. MBA in a Day 2.0 will provide important and necessary principles and concepts of business for leaders to apply in these organizations.

Sales of 15,000+ copies of the original 2004 version (available only in hardback at a $29) has validated market viability.  Having successfully obtained a reversion of the original book's publishing rights, a sub-$20 revision MBA in a DAY 2.0 will appeal to a wide and deep market.

Risks & Challenges

Today, it’s a risky environment in the world of content creation, marketing and distribution.  We live in a dynamic, sometimes chaotic world of information that’s shared in nanoseconds and often, in 140 characters or less. 

The greatest challenge will be to find a way to gain awareness, access and action to the MBA in a DAY 2.0 reader.  It’s a crowded, noisy marketplace.  The marketing plan budget, while generous, will need thoughtful development and effective execution—it’s a challenge that I am confident to meet and to be successful in sharing my work.

story:
(Check out the System in Action Above!)

Is your child a struggling learner? Or child with a disability? Help to give teachers the best technology around to make sure our children's needs are met so they can succeed!

Summary

Interventions On Track was something conceived around 5 years ago. While working as a special education teacher and coordinator I began creating RTI systems. During this process, I came to the conclusion that there really isn't effective RTI tracking systems out there. Teachers have no way of tracking the interventions they are doing and analyzing that data. Special Education goals, ESL goals, none of these vital channels of education are able to be tracked and analyzed effectively. So I teamed up with an RTI team member and a brilliant web designer and we created something that will help close the achievement gap. It's hard currently, without this system, to even analyze where the gaps are occurring. Help us to change this. 

-This system will identify and address the needs of struggling learners. 

-It will track anything, becoming the grade book for things that traditional grade books can't handle. 

-It helps to train new teachers, making recommendations on how to handle students with educational challenges. 

-It's as easy to use and update. We wanted to make is as easy to use as updating social media, knowing that teachers are busy and overwhelmed. We wanted to make the system save time and be enjoyable. (what the short sample of the system in action above)

A Few of the Benefits

For Students: Struggles will not go unnoticed, Students excelling will not go unchallenged. Interventions will happen and be structured and consistent. 


For Teachers: Time, hours will be saved EACH WEEK! Communications are done right through the system, information is easy to digest, tracking is intuitive, it's easy, painless, and will increase your teaching ability. This list could go on and on....

For Families: Never worry about your children slipping through the cracks. Never worry about your child's special needs or language goals going unnoticed or unattended to. Have a clear, tracked channel of communication with the school team members and more!

For the Schools and Districts: Time will be saved. In one schools analysis, 200-300 minutes per week will be saved PER TEACHER! The average new teacher spends around 45 min a week on the referral process for RTI, paper work, communications and tracking. This for 8-12 students is over 500  minutes. This system will be able to cut the work down to a 3rd of that time.  Time is money and that's more time for the teachers to be working directly with students. Administrators will be able to easily glide through all of the intervention data effortlessly. Seeing easy to read tables and graphs of an enormous amount of data. This and more are the benefits, act today!


What We Need & What You Get

We need 90,000 to complete the web build and get this system into the hands of teachers. The funds will go to the coding work needed to be completed, marketing and training. If this is not fully funded all funds received will go to the web build portion and we'll seek other avenues for marketing, outreach and all other business costs but this product is too important to our schools and children not to complete the construction of it. 

The funds will also go to being responsive of the feedback from teachers from the first iteration. We want to gather feedback and provide customization and truly meet the needs of practitioners so they can best meet the needs of the children. 

Our biggest perk is that if you donate 1000, we match that amount towards the cost of this system to the  school of your choice. Meaning if you donate 1000 you name the school that you want to have the credit for this system. Along with t-shirts and other swag! The school credit is the same for the 500 donations. Help us get our struggling learners the help they need. Every child learns differently, but EVERY child can learn!
Every little bit helps, all contributions will help this system change the lives of students and teachers!

The Impact

This has been a product that educators have needed for years. All schools have intervention programs and no way to track them effectively. 

Response To Intervention, RTI, is an expected school component but it's often unclear how to do it effectively and appropriately. The system guides users through the entire process. It helps to train and educate teachers about methods, resources and best practices.

It allows users to communicate to families and log every and compile EVERY piece of data connected to each student. 

It was created by educators. We are still in the field and wanted to create something we desperately need to take our students and capabilities to the next level. 

This system will change lives. I've seen the methods change lives. We manually have been doing some of tracking and things that this system can do for the past few years. 

Multiple principals, school and district leaders have signed on and want to use this system when it's available. 

Risks & Challenges

We set out with an ambitious amount of things we wanted the system to do. We have invested a lot of time and money to make this possible, if you are going to do something do it right! We know that we'll keep pushing the limits of what's possible but with the support of teachers and schools, we'll make it happen. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate, please share this campaign with friends and family and help us spread the word! We can help to serve all children and meet their needs. Every child can learn! We just need to meet them at their level.
story_txt:
(Check out the System in Action Above!)
Is your child a struggling learner? Or child with a disability? Help to give teachers the best technology around to make sure our children's needs are met so they can succeed!
Summary
Interventions On Track was something conceived around 5 years ago. While working as a special education teacher and coordinator I began creating RTI systems. During this process, I came to the conclusion that there really isn't effective RTI tracking systems out there. Teachers have no way of tracking the interventions they are doing and analyzing that data. Special Education goals, ESL goals, none of these vital channels of education are able to be tracked and analyzed effectively. So I teamed up with an RTI team member and a brilliant web designer and we created something that will help close the achievement gap. It's hard currently, without this system, to even analyze where the gaps are occurring. Help us to change this. 
-This system will identify and address the needs of struggling learners. 
-It will track anything, becoming the grade book for things that traditional grade books can't handle. 
-It helps to train new teachers, making recommendations on how to handle students with educational challenges. 
-It's as easy to use and update. We wanted to make is as easy to use as updating social media, knowing that teachers are busy and overwhelmed. We wanted to make the system save time and be enjoyable. (what the short sample of the system in action above)

A Few of the Benefits

For Students: Struggles will not go unnoticed, Students excelling will not go unchallenged. Interventions will happen and be structured and consistent. 


For Teachers: Time, hours will be saved EACH WEEK! Communications are done right through the system, information is easy to digest, tracking is intuitive, it's easy, painless, and will increase your teaching ability. This list could go on and on....

For Families: Never worry about your children slipping through the cracks. Never worry about your child's special needs or language goals going unnoticed or unattended to. Have a clear, tracked channel of communication with the school team members and more!

For the Schools and Districts: Time will be saved. In one schools analysis, 200-300 minutes per week will be saved PER TEACHER! The average new teacher spends around 45 min a week on the referral process for RTI, paper work, communications and tracking. This for 8-12 students is over 500  minutes. This system will be able to cut the work down to a 3rd of that time.  Time is money and that's more time for the teachers to be working directly with students. Administrators will be able to easily glide through all of the intervention data effortlessly. Seeing easy to read tables and graphs of an enormous amount of data. This and more are the benefits, act today!
   What We Need & What You Get We need 90,000 to complete the web build and get this system into the hands of teachers. The funds will go to the coding work needed to be completed, marketing and training. If this is not fully funded all funds received will go to the web build portion and we'll seek other avenues for marketing, outreach and all other business costs but this product is too important to our schools and children not to complete the construction of it. 
The funds will also go to being responsive of the feedback from teachers from the first iteration. We want to gather feedback and provide customization and truly meet the needs of practitioners so they can best meet the needs of the children. 
Our biggest perk is that if you donate 1000, we match that amount towards the cost of this system to the  school of your choice. Meaning if you donate 1000 you name the school that you want to have the credit for this system. Along with t-shirts and other swag! The school credit is the same for the 500 donations. Help us get our struggling learners the help they need. Every child learns differently, but EVERY child can learn!
Every little bit helps, all contributions will help this system change the lives of students and teachers!   The Impact This has been a product that educators have needed for years. All schools have intervention programs and no way to track them effectively. 
Response To Intervention, RTI, is an expected school component but it's often unclear how to do it effectively and appropriately. The system guides users through the entire process. It helps to train and educate teachers about methods, resources and best practices.
It allows users to communicate to families and log every and compile EVERY piece of data connected to each student. 
It was created by educators. We are still in the field and wanted to create something we desperately need to take our students and capabilities to the next level. 
This system will change lives. I've seen the methods change lives. We manually have been doing some of tracking and things that this system can do for the past few years. 
Multiple principals, school and district leaders have signed on and want to use this system when it's available.    Risks & Challenges We set out with an ambitious amount of things we wanted the system to do. We have invested a lot of time and money to make this possible, if you are going to do something do it right! We know that we'll keep pushing the limits of what's possible but with the support of teachers and schools, we'll make it happen. 
    Other Ways You Can Help If you are unable to donate, please share this campaign with friends and family and help us spread the word! We can help to serve all children and meet their needs. Every child can learn! We just need to meet them at their level.

story:
The Gist

Donald Trump is wrecking America, and it seems impossible to change his followers' minds with facts and truth. But, we have had success with one group - Evangelicals. 
We are grass roots digital organizers that are effectively changing a large group of Trump's supporters through social media. For every $5 contributed, we can reach 1,000 people with this message!


The Nightmare of Trump

If Donald Trump becomes president of the United States, not only will minorities, religious freedom, and freedom of the press be in a whole new league of attack, but our country and our political system as we know it will be undermined.

Trump supporters do not seem to care about the facts, and the frustration of attempting to convince low information, angry, and irrational people is both real and troubling. 

But we have had success. 

Using social media platforms, and going to the one group of Trump supporters that are somewhat cohesive and can be swayed by their leadership - Evangelicals.

Our plan is simple - we are using Facebook to target Evangelical voters in order to expose the truth about Trump's character and record, and how that is in direct contradiction with Christian teaching. 

Additionally, we are working to draw out and create a PR nightmare for the Evangelical leaders that have supported Trump openly and the institutions they lead - men like Jerry Falwell Jr and Liberty University, Robert Jeffress and First Baptist Dallas, & Franklin Graham and Samaritan's Purse.

Whether you are a person of faith or not, it doesn't matter. We chose this strategy because we have seen it work. Prior to the first Super Tuesday, Trump was polling double digit lead in Virginia. By utilizing this strategy, we pressured the executive leadership of the largest Christian college to publicly condemn their president's open endorsement of Trump in the Washington Post. The result? Trump won by a mere 3 points - down from a 16 point polling average in 3 separate polls  the week before.

Our strategy works, support our campaign, and we will take this strategy to every upcoming primary state and take Trump out of the presidential race.


The Skinny on Trump

Donald Trump is not just another candidate for President. He represents an existential threat to American democracy. He has made hate his platform. He has threatened to undermine the basic constitutional rights to freedom of religion and freedom of the press. He has introduced a distinctly fascist brand of politics into our political discourse, and he has encouraged his followers to commit acts of violence against people who disagree with them. We believe America is better than this.

We believe that when people really understand what Trump represents, they will turn against him. Our mission is to tell the truth about Donald Trump to anyone who will listen. In particular, we want to use social media to target voters who might be on the fence and convince them that voting for Trump would be a mistake.

This is a grassroots effort. We are not political professionals. We aren't affiliated with a party organization or outside funding groups. This is a movement of the people, by the people, and for the people. 


What We Need & What You Get

Every dollar we raise will go directly to highly targeted ads on social media platforms. Unlike TV ads, which are extremely expensive and imprecise, social media ads can be targeting to exactly the people who need to hear the truth about Donald Trump: voters in upcoming primaries who are leaning toward Trump but who still might change their minds. Using this extremely precise model allows us to make ever dollar go much further than traditional advertising ever could.


The Impact

For every $5 we raise, we can reach 1,000 potential Trump voters in upcoming primaries. Because of this, a $1 donation to our campaign has the same impact as a $50 donation to a traditional PAC focusing on TV and radio ads. We are lean, focused, and motivated by our desire to protect the country we love.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can make even a small financial contribution, we will make sure it has a big impact. If you can't, there is still plenty you can do. Help us by making your voice heard on social media. 

- We are on Twitter at @NeverTrump as well as @Trump_Truther

- Sign up for our email list at NeverTrump.org

Get out and talk to your friends and family. Go to a rally. Support a candidate. Cast a vote! And please, tell your friends about us! Thank you! 


Some Nitty Gritty Stuff

We have gone through all of the legal channels to do this campaign. We are "officially" the NeverTrump.org PAC. We are accountable to FEC rules for fundraising and spending, and more importantly, accountable to you. We will post reports daily about how our campaign is going, and we welcome your feedback and input on our strategy!

Our Team

We are an entire team of grassroots organizers that have one common purpose - to deny Trump in his bid to wreck American ideals and democracy. We are led by two graduates of Thomas Jefferson's Universtiy of Virginia.

Jon Copper - Fork Union Military and UVA graduate. Former college football player. Social entrepreneur. Husband and father. Social media guru. Twitter @JonCopper


Jedidiah Crews - Born and raised in Tennessee. Educated in Virginia and London. U.S. Military veteran. Husband and father. Social media activist.




The Disclaimers and Things We Have to Say to be Legal:

Contributions or gifts to NeverTrump.org are not tax deductible. Contributions will be used in connection with a Federal election.  Contributions by foreign nationals, federal government contractors, and national banks are prohibited. Federal law requires us to use our best efforts to collect and report the name, mailing address, occupation and name of employer of individuals whose contributions exceed $200 in a calendar year.

By submitting a donation, I hereby certify that the following statements are true and accurate: I am a United States citizen or a lawfully-admitted permanent resident ("green card holder"); this contribution is not being made in another person's name; and this contribution, whether personal or corporate, will not be reimbursed by another person or entity.

story:
AYKIS

Aykis is an online, interactive meeting point and shop that highlights and gives a different approach to creativity and sustainability. Aykis consists of an inspiring blog with street fashion, presentations of creative profiles, relevant articles and more inspirational posts. Aykis helps small passionated designers, from around the world, to showcase their latest designs at Aykis. In the shop it is possible to purchase a selected range of secondhand products. In addition Aykis has its own label with sustainable basics within apparel and jewels. Aykis is working hard, to inspire and supply you with a more sustainable approach along with inspiration and conscious shopping.


AYKIS X INDIEGOGO

We are very passionate about raising awareness to sustainability and creativity. All donations will be spend on these matter and help us to create a green platform where designs, knowledge and inspirations can be shared. There are many logistical costs and challenges when starting a new business - Indiegogo can help us to overcome these. We will spend any surplus from Indiegogo on charity organizations that can supply Aykis second hand shop and our designers with recycled clothing and materials for new designs.


WANT TO HELP? 

If you want to help us, we are very grateful! If you pledge more than 30 € we will sent you a graphic design poster with your own Ayki or Gaya. There are three options - please write your adress, witch poster you want in the comment, and what size you have pledged for. They come in three sizes: 30x40 cm (more than 20 usd), 50x70 cm (more than 30 usd) and 70x100 cm (more than 40 usd) Thank you so much! See your options bellow: 

GRAPHIC DESIGN POSTERS


A1


A2

G1

K1

K2


Want to know more about the project? Keep reading!


WHO IS AYKI?

Ayki is the name of Karina and Nanna’s ethical and visual muse. She represents Karina and Nanna’s common sense and helps them make decisions and find the best solutions. Ayki is illustrated in the logo and will appear more places on the platform. She is their imaginary ambassador who stands for creativity, transparency, consciousness and an open mind. It will be possible to purchase illustrations of Ayki with family and friends in the shop. Ayki’s family will continue to grow, in more ways than one.

AYKIS BLOG

Aykis blog will be a place for you to get inspired.

We want to portrait happy people, with personality and an attitude. You might even get a boost of happiness from looking at the street photo images of the beautiful people.

We will also interview people with new interesting views on sustainability and fashion, and share different and interesting approaches. By sharing knowledge and guidance from different people around the world, we hope to provide you with new ethical angles on your wardrobe and ways of consuming.


AYKIS SHOP

Aykis shop is a platform where small designers from all over the world can expose their designs. Aykis gives a helping hand to the small dedicated designer, that works consciously to create unique designs. 

Aykis also has a department of carefully selected second hand items. Reusing items is deeply rooted in both Nanna and Karinas lifestyle. In Nanna and Karina’s experience you are more likely to take better care and hold on to second hand items, it isn’t an item you can just replace. 

Aykis own label has an selection of carefully designed apparels, made from reused or new durable materials that will last a lifetime or more. All items sold at Aykis is made or curated with thought, we put love and care into our work.


NEWSLETTER

The newsletter will give you an update when something new is happening at Aykis.


FOUNDERS

Karina and Nanna are the founders of Aykis. Together they strike to create something meaningful with a geographic broad appeal. They wish to create an international platform, for those who care about creativity, sustainability and wants to be inspired from around world. They want to spread useful and meaningful knowledge together with inspirational and creative initiatives, and make room for quirky and different angles.

Karina is an self taught jewellery designer. Karina has worked full time with her jewellery designs the past three years. She has a great passion for experimenting and learning new ways. Karina cares a lot about the process of creating and is focused on every single detail. She creates all her jewels herself in her home based studio. She creates slow fashion products and strikes to make timeless and long lasting designs. www.karinazimmer.com


Nanna graduated with a bachelor's degree from Copenhagen School of Design and Business in January 2015 and is specialized in Sustainable Apparel Design. Nanna debuted with her first collection In The Hood in 2008; hoodies made from recycled fabrics. Nanna’s head is full of ideas, and she loves to explore and create innovative solutions. She is open minded and always ready to try new things of. Most of all she loves to create meaningful designs, and challenge current ways. www.nannazimmer.wix.com/design

story:
Welcome to The GAP

We are The GAP Arts Project and we're an independent, youth-led arts organisation supporting young people to be creative and build community in Birmingham in the UK. We're campaigning to make our temporary arts space in the city centre a permanent civic space for young people to meet, make and manage their creative projects.

All we need to do to stay open beyond our pilot period is to install heating, running water, a kitchen and some IT equipment. So we need  to raise £10,000 by 20 July 2016 to get that all in place before the autumn. 

With your help we can make The GAP an ongoing facility for all young people of Birmingham, a gap for exploration, for creativity and the building of community and resilience - the only one of its kind in the UK's second city and the youngest city in Europe.


Shaping the future through creative learning and sharing

When young people have the opportunity to steward their own learning they learn to take responsibility - for their work, for themselves and for their world. Creative learning in particular, provides them with opportunities, the skills and experiences to counter the often divisive and destructive impact of austerity and a largely commercially driven world. In producing art and creative work they shape new realities, forge new connections and build community - they literally change the world!

We believe culture is a human right, and access to public space a human necessity in urban living. There is a clear gap in provision for young people, but together we can bridge that gap and realise a simple and workable solution.

What are we planning?

So we need to raise £10,000 to transform this temporary warehouse space into a permanent and flexible arts centre and venue for young people, where they will feel safe, welcome and creative. We plan to have a community cinema, a theatre space, craft workshop, technology hub and a creative playground, as well as social space and cafe. So we need to install heating, running water, a kitchen, and IT equipment - all the basic stuff that will enable young people to use the specialist equipment and resources such as staging, filming and screening equipment that we already have.


The importance of belonging

We want to facilitate more young people, share our skills and grow our already healthy community of young people and develop a culture of creating and sharing so that our vision becomes even more sustainable in the longer term. Young people only ever get to occupy a space on a temporary basis - how can you build on that sustainably? We need a PERMANENT space, that we can belong to, call our own, feel safe and at home in, manage ourselves and invite people like you to come and see exactly what we're capable of. 

Handcrafted rewards

We've got a whole range of creative rewards for our contributors as a very special thank you for making our vision a reality, from hand-embroidered handkerchiefs and bespoke poetry to a copy of our hardback photography book and special annual awards for creativity made in your name.


Why we are confident we can do this

The GAP Arts Project is a small core team of young people 20-25, but we are committed, diverse and long standing members with BIG ideas. With the help of our professional mentor we have worked really hard - studied management, administration, finance, skills-sharing and peer mentoring, as well as our individual artforms - and have acquired exceptional skills and experience, making us a formidable force with an excellent reputation on the arts scene of the city. 

Creativity, Quality and Meaning

We have been successfully delivering arts projects with young people from all over Birmingham since 2009, from drama, creative writing and photography, to curation, musical composition and creative play, and lots more. We've also engaged many of them in international projects with partners in Hungary, Malta, France and China. All our work is rooted in our core principles of Creativity, Quality and Meaning.


Our priorities

If we don't reach our full target we will prioritise making the space warm and dry in winter and cool and comfortable in summer, so that we can sustain The GAP as a welcoming, go-to space for local youth. If we exceed the target, we'll be doing all the above plus running even more creative leadership sessions, participatory projects and networking events, widening our membership and building our community of creative 16-25 year olds. MOREOVER, we will develop a bursary scheme for supporting the realisation of some of the best ideas, arts projects and creative initiatives designed by our members, giving our backers even greater value for their money, and maximising impact for young people.

Be part at the start!

We'd love you to be part of our story, to help us achieve our target and get The GAP on the road to long-term success and sustainability. If you can't contribute to the fund, don't worry - we know times are tough for everyone right now. But you can still make a massive difference to our project by sharing it widely and shouting about it loudly!

Thank you

Thanks so much for watching, reading and considering supporting us. If you're local - come and see us! You'd be really welcome. If you're not - we look forward to updating you on our progress. 
Again - thank you!

In producing art and creative work they shape new realities, forge new connections and build community - they literally change the world!We believe culture is a human right, and access to public space a human
necessity in urban living. There is a clear gap in provision for young people,
but together we can bridge that gap and realise a simple and workable solution.What are we planning?
So we need to raise £10,000 to transform this temporary warehouse space into a permanent and flexible arts centre and venue for young people, where they will feel safe, welcome and creative. We plan to have a community cinema, a theatre space, craft workshop, technology hub and a creative playground, as well as social space and cafe. So we need to install heating, running water, a kitchen, and IT equipment - all the basic stuff that will enable young people to use the specialist equipment and resources such as staging, filming and screening equipment that we already have.

The importance of belonging
We want to facilitate more young people, share our skills and grow our already healthy community of young people and develop a culture of creating and sharing so that our vision becomes even more sustainable in the longer term. Young people only ever get to occupy a space on a temporary basis - how can you build on that sustainably? We need a PERMANENT space, that we can belong to, call our own, feel safe and at home in, manage ourselves and invite people like you to come and see exactly what we're capable of. 

Handcrafted rewards
We've got a whole range of creative rewards for our contributors as a very special thank you for making our vision a reality, from hand-embroidered handkerchiefs and bespoke poetry to a copy of our hardback photography book and special annual awards for creativity made in your name.





Why we are confident we can do this
The GAP Arts Project is a small core team of young people 20-25, but we are committed, diverse and long standing members with BIG ideas. With the help of our professional mentor we have worked really hard - studied management, administration, finance, skills-sharing and peer mentoring, as well as our individual artforms - and have acquired exceptional skills and experience, making us a formidable force with an excellent reputation on the arts scene of the city. 
Creativity, Quality and Meaning
We have been successfully delivering arts projects with young people from all over Birmingham since 2009, from drama, creative writing and photography, to curation, musical composition and creative play, and lots more. We've also engaged many of them in international projects with partners in Hungary, Malta, France and China. All our work is rooted in our core principles of Creativity, Quality and Meaning.




Our prioritiesIf we don't reach our full target we will prioritise making the space warm and dry in winter and cool and comfortable in summer, so that we can sustain The GAP as a welcoming, go-to space for local youth. If we exceed the target, we'll be doing all the above plus running even more creative leadership sessions, participatory projects and networking events, widening our membership and building our community of creative 16-25 year olds. MOREOVER, we will develop a bursary scheme for supporting the realisation of some of the best ideas, arts projects and creative initiatives designed by our members, giving our backers even greater value for their money, and maximising impact for young people.Be part at the start!
We'd love you to be part of our story, to help us achieve our target and get The GAP on the road to long-term success and sustainability. If you can't contribute to the fund, don't worry - we know times are tough for everyone right now. But you can still make a massive difference to our project by sharing it widely and shouting about it loudly!
Thank you
Thanks so much for watching, reading and considering supporting us. If you're local - come and see us! You'd be really welcome. If you're not - we look forward to updating you on our progress. 
Again - thank you!

story:
I'm a single mom with full custody of her child, who decided at 37 to quit a lucrative career I've built since i was 18 to follow my dream and become a massage therapist.  I fell in love with the gift I was given to heal and help people.  The positive energy I receive has helped me to overcome massive anxiety and panic attacks, as well as pulled me out of a fully diagnosed major depressive disorder.  I want to continue my education to be able to offer as many kinds of services as I can.  I want to make a life with this new career I've chosen.  I want to show my son that following your heart is the only way to be happy.

Upon graduation in Feb. in Swedish massage, I was left with about 6000$ in debt and without an income (can't always pay a babysitter in massage!) I was not able to work the required evening hours most spa or clinics were offering.  I work out of my home and currently, I am building a small client base.

This summer, I have enrolled to further my massage education to chair massage, something I can do at sporting events, trade shows and social gatherings of all kinds.  Thai yoga massage, which can be incorporated into my Swedish practice, or done as a clothed alternative to Swedish.  Finally, I also decided to take maternity massage, which changed my own pregnancy experience so much that I can't imagine not offering it to others.

I love what I do, and I love being able to show my son that he can do anything he wants with hard work.  I just need a little help funding this dream. 

Breakdown of costs for the funding I'm asking for.

6000$ debt repayment from 5 month intensive Swedish class (including child care for that time)

200$ 15 hour thai yoga instruction

350$ 30 hour chair massage instruction

600$ 60 hour maternity massage instruction

200$ daycare fees for my son for school days

600$ babysitter fees for my son for weekend classes

164$ 2 months bus fare

200$ massage chair

150$ maternity cushion adapted for massage table

=8464$

story:
Short Summary

Muyambi is an engineer, sustainable transportation (bicycles) activist, economic development advocate and founder of Bicycles Against Poverty. This children's book titled "The wooden bicycle" will chronicle some of Muyambi's experiences with bicycles. Love superheros? Worry not, there will be a hint of fiction. 

What We Need & What You Get

    • Additional funding for manuscript evaluation, proofreading, rewriting and editing.   
    • Securing illustrators from around the globe
    • Unique perks include gifts such as thank you cards, Ugandan gifts, copies of the book 
    • If not enough funds are raised we will still use the funds towards what is needed to complete the book. Any excess funds will be donated to Bicycles Against Poverty. 

The Impact

In addition to showcasing the power of bicycles, the book will also serve to provide an outlet for young international illustrators;

  • The plan is to have a different illustrator for every page of the book. We live in an interconnected world, our children ought to get the experience of seeing work from all over the world. 
  • Through engaging with schools, the book will take the message of Bicycles Against Poverty globally all the while exposing the many illustrators to new audiences.
  • We will build a website with more works from all the illustrators involved.
  • 40% of the revenue from the book will be donated to Bicycles Against Poverty to keep financing more bicycles for smallholder farmers. 

Risks & Challenges

Coordinating artists from across the globe might be a challenge but we are ready for it;
  • We will have a lead illustrator to ensure there is a common theme throughout the book while maintaining illustrator's uniqueness.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please help get the word out and make some noise about our campaign (@muyambi1).
  • If you have any illustrators you think would love to be part of this, share the campaign with them and ask them to reach out. 
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

Parents have the power to shape the educational paths of their children.

What is an IEP?

IEP is the acronym for Individualized Education Program (or Individualized Education Plan). It is mandated by the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (IDEA) and is a legal document that outlines a student’s learning needs, the services the school will provide and how progress will be measured. A student is eligible for an IEP if he or she has a disability and needs special education services.

The Project

If only parents knew what to expect on their IEP Journeys! When my son started school, I had no idea what an IEP was nor did I know it would be essential to his success in school. After realizing that my son needed help, I struggled to get the assistance he desperately required as a student. 

Last year, I documented my experiences so that I could share with others. My IEP Journey tells my story and provides the resources that helped me. My goal is to share the book with advocacy organizations and parents so that they can feel empowered.

“Lia Martin has done all the legwork to make the IEP process much simpler for you and your child. Part research, part experience, and all motherly love, this practical, heartwarming book is a gift to all parents of children who color outside the lines.”

Aimee Russ Jannsohn

Mother, Editor – Pilgrim Press

What We Need & What You Get

We need for parents to feel empowered!

We're raising $5,000 to publish an easy-to-read book about IEPs for parents that’s part inspiration/part resources.

Your donation will be used to publish a paperback and an e-book edition of My IEP Journey for parents that can be distributed to advocacy organizations, schools and anywhere parents are. 

Your donation will also cover the cost of marketing and the website currently under construction, www.myiepjourney.com. At www.myiepjourney.com, we are building a community of parents and advocates to share tools and support each other.

For your $5 donation, you will receive a link to download the e-book and a shout out on Facebook.

For your $25 donation, you will receive a signed copy of the paperback book and a shout out on Facebook.

For your $50 or more donation, you will receive a signed copy of the paperback book, a mention on our website and some My IEP Journey swag.

Impact

The book is just the beginning. By supporting the launch of My IEP Journey, you will impact the lives of many parents! 

Some books will be sold to cover publishing costs not raised by the campaign and MANY books will be donated to advocacy organizations and schools through the website. 

Risks & Challenges

Self-publishing is time consuming and expensive. But there is a chance we will exceed our funding goal. This means book will still be distributed to even more parents. Any help will just move us closer to the goal of impacting the lives of parents.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, that doesn't mean you can't help. Please share this campaign with every parent you know! Please tweet, share on Facebook and on Instagram! You can follow me at: https://twitter.com/lamediocremommy or on Facebook at: https://www.facebook.com/iepjourney/ Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

  • Ashari P. Wallace is from Los Angeles, California and holds a B.A. in Child, Adolescent, and Family Studies (CAFS) and a minor in Women and Gender Studies (WGS) from California State University of Bakersfield. She received her Master of Social Work (MSW) degree from Simmons College. She is the author of From the Dark Shadows to A Vibrant Light: Poems for the Victims and Survivors. The book falls under several categories which are advocacy, poetry, and self-help. #author #socialworker #advocate #mentor #survivor
  • You can find a more in depth information about Ashari  by visiting  www.asharipwallace.com and clicking on the about tab on the tool bar or by visiting  IG@ashariwallace.
  • Contributors will help Ashari reach audiences that she is not able to reach and help fund the campaign. The venue for the event is the most expensive, yet an important aspect to host 45 attendees, volunteer team, speakers, and vendors. Your contribution will also go toward tables and chairs, which is another important aspect for the event. 

What We Need & What You Get

Please see Faqs for Q&A in regards to the needs for FV2S event and what you will receive. 

The Impact

In the last year or two discussions on sexual assault (SA) has become more of an open topic for social issues. SA has always been one of those taboo topics. Ashari found herself discussing the topic with certain individuals.  The more she discusses this topic the more she grows in her purpose, by using her past as a driving force.  She has found that everyone should be educated on SA.  Ashari has a vision to raise awareness, prevention, and educate others in their own physical community/social media community. She really did not know in what capacity or if she was qualified enough, but after making small presentations in classes during her graduate school journey she knew that a workshop would be her goal. So she is doing the work, saving funds for FV2S as a nonprofit, and also asking for help with this specific event presented by FV2S, because she can't do this alone. 

  • This is her first event, campaign, and speaking engagement as an independent author/writer, advocate and social worker. 
  • Although this is not a spiritual event. the Spiritual life and God is essential to dream this vision after healing from the sexual assault she faced. FV2S is based around hope...there is hope that a victim will survive, hope that someone will believe them, hope that you won't feel like this forever,  hope that there are people and spaces that support you, hope that this was for a reason and not in vain.
  • FV2S is rooted Faith, Hope and Love. Three things will last forever—faith, hope, and love—and the greatest of these is love. (1 Corinthians 13:13)
  • 1 Corinthians 13:13 helped Ashari create the name of the luncheon. Her hope is for event attendees to grasp a hold of hope, embrace faith and feel love.  As she interacts with others she also wants to exude these areas to show up in her everyday life. The name of nonprofit (From Victim TOO Survivor aka FV2S) was formed in hope and faith that as she healed and eventually coped with her trauma in a positive way fulfill her purpose. The love that she received from her friends and family and even strangers who embraced her as a survivor has allowed her to thrive. Ashari embodies and stands firm in faith, hope and love that helped her to become a survivor.  

    Romans 5:3-5 says, We can rejoice, too, when we run into problems and trials, for we know that they help us develop endurance. And endurance develops strength of character, and character strengthens our confident hope of salvation. And this hope will not lead to disappointment. For we know how dearly God loves us, because he has given us the Holy Spirit to fill our hearts with his love.  This verse is the foundation to the mission for FV2S in regards to the three Es (Educate, Empower,& Embrace) and the 1 P (Promote).  Romans 5:3-5 also speaks to why she as the President values integrity, character, compassion, experience, and purpose.  

    Lastly, Matthew 5:14 &16 You are the light of the world—like a city on a hilltop that cannot be hidden.  In the same way, let your good deeds shine out for all to see, so that everyone will praise your heavenly Father.  This verse speaks to the vision of the workshops/luncheon.  People in Ashari's life and people in passing have told her that her vision for this event is confirmation from God. She believes everyone has some light that can rule out some of this darkness in the world as long as they are hopeful, have faith, build character, share love & tap into the light to exuberate/superabound  perpetual radiance.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please share this campaign to help make this event successful as well as to help raise money for survivors to enroll in a yoga class. If she would have known that yoga could have been a way to take back her body she would have had a different view point on yoga as more than just something to help her exercise and learn how to breathe properly. This is a practice used for coping and healing holistically. 
  •  Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • If you not able to donateto this event you can also purchase a book from me and those funds will go towards this cause.
  • Another way to help is to educate yourself and others about sexual assault and rape culture. You can visit rainn.or or nsvrc.org for stats and even get a SAAM kit for April Sexual Assault Awareness Month (One reason why this event is hosted during the month of April)
  • Please tell people about the event if they would like to attend. The event can be found on EventBrite under Ashari Wallace and FV2S Tap-In Luncheon & Workshop or https://apw-fv2s-tap-in.eventbrite.com
  • As of right now donations will simply be seen as family and friends donating. Ashari is in the process of acquiring a 501 (c) (3) status and with positive vibes she hopes to get it setup before the end of 2019. If it is in place before the end of 2019 she will send out contribution letters to all who have donated to the event. 

Thank you for supporting me in all that I do and thank you in advance for helping make my vision come to light in a beautiful and passionate manner. I also thank you for being my village and my extended village and for allowing and helping me to walk in my purpose of sharing love and shining light. 

With Love & Light, 

Ashari & FV2S

This is a practice used for coping and healing holistically. 
 Use the Indiegogo share tools!
If you not able to donateto this event you can also purchase a book from me and those funds will go towards this cause.
Another way to help is to educate yourself and others about sexual assault and rape culture. You can visit rainn.or or nsvrc.org for stats and even get a SAAM kit for April Sexual Assault Awareness Month (One reason why this event is hosted during the month of April)
