story:
"Growth cannot be considered “inclusive” if inequalities between men and women persist or worsen"- James Heintz

Major Concerns Around Lack of Women Education & Skills Around the Globe (UNESCO)

Women and girls often have very low status in developing countries and empowerment and education are central to enabling them to make their own decisions and allowing them to access maternal health and family planning services.
  • Educating girls can save millions of lives 
  • Educated women are less likely to die giving birth to newborns
  • Girls with higher levels of education are less likely to have children at an early age 
  • Girls with higher levels of education are less likely to get married at an early age
  • Educated women are more likely to find work

Source

“There are still 31 million girls in the world who should be in school but are not, an even higher number out of secondary and there remain still 493 million illiterate women”- Irina Bokova- Director General of UNESCO

  How Can Our ACADEMY Help Increase Women Empowerment in India

The Impact of our project is massive. This project is divided into two Phases. The contribution we are asking today is just for Phase I of this project. The Phase I involves establishing a SKILLS DEVELOPMENT ACADEMY for WOMEN EMPOWERMENT  (SDAWE) for the Tribal Girls of North East India in Kolkata. These girls are over the age of 18, haven't completed schooling and are unemployed. These girls want to be liberated and want to learn and achieve something in life, but due to the financial constraints, improper training and lack of opportunities they have not been able to do so. Some of these girls have never been outside of their tribal villages. These girls will be relocated from their villages to the closest metropolitan city, Kolkata, so that we can provide them with the best training facilities. Our goal is to start with an enrolment of 150 girls.
"Our team strongly believes that educating women and providing them with the right skills will benefit them, and will also benefit the whole community, and possibly the whole world. You never know, which one of these women might have a baby that grows to become a scientist who cures extreme diseases or solves humanity's grand challenges"

                     OUR MISSION

Our MISSION is to provide the Best Quality International Standard Skills Development and Training to these girls, so that they can work in both India and overseas. We are an energetic, experienced, dedicated, strong and committed team which strives to provide these girls with the knowledge and skills that will transform their lives, the life they would have only dreamt of. Our philosophy can be described by the words of Zig Ziglar, one of the best personal development mentors the world has ever witnessed. "You will get all you want in life, if you help enough other people get what they want". If you look at our team, our Advisors are highly respectable, committed pioneers in their field related to solving humanity's greatest challenges. Our founders are experts in their area of skills development, training, teaching and mentoring. Your generous help can create endless possibilities. 

The gap between women and men in India is still severe. According to the statistics by the census of India, 82.14% of adult men are educated, only 65.46% of adult women are known to be literate in India. Not only is an illiterate women at the mercy of her husband or father, she also does not know that this is not the way of life for women across the world. Additionally, the norms of culture that state that the man of the family is the be-all and end-all of family decisions is slowly spoiling the society of the country.

                                                                                                Source

WHAT ARE WE PROVIDING IN OUR ACADEMY 

Our Skills Development Academy will provide these tribal girls skills training and we are also committed for their employment. We are providing 100% guarantee for their jobs. We have a strong team of founders with International experience and expertise in recruitment, training, development, coaching and mentoring. You can see this further in our team section below. We have personally developed the skills training program in coordination with the current and future demands of the industry. Executives within the various industries will be regularly visiting as guest speakers to encourage and motivate the girls.

                      

WHAT SETS US APART

Apart from the Skills Development Training, our training program includes work life balance training, such as yoga classes for health and karate classes for self protection. They will be provided with clean accommodation facilities and a good catering facility. Every girl that gets trained with us will be trained in self development and they will be provided self development books such as "Take Me Home: The Inspiring Stories of 20 Entrepreneurs from Small Town India with Big time Dreams" (Rashmi Bansal), "Poor Little Rich Slum: What We Saw in Dharavi and Why it Matters" (Rashmi Bansal & Deepak Gandhi), "Think and Grow Rich for Women: Using Your Power to Create Success and Significance" (Sharon Lechter),  "You Can Trust Yourself" (Louise Hay & Cheryl Richardson), "Thrive: The Third Metric to Redefining Success and Creating a Life of Well-Being, Wisdom, and Wonder" (Arianna Huffington), "You Can Create An Exceptional Life" (Louise Hay & Cheryl Richardson), "The Secret" (Rhonda Byrne), "Lean In: Women, Work and the Will to Lead" (Sheryl Sandberg), "Rich Women" (Kim Kiyosaki), "Unleash the Power Within" (Anthony Robbins), "How to Win Friends and Influence People" (Dale Carnegie), "The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People" (Stephen Covey), "The Alchemist" (Paulo Coelho), "The Monk Who Sold his Ferrari" (Robin Sharma) and more.

These girls will also learn the basic and necessary skills of professional communication, professional grooming, computer skills and using the internet, skills to work in call centres, work as housekeepers, waitresses, flight stewardesses, and receptionists. Furthermore, these girls will be assisted in developing their resumes and organising interviews with major Hotels and Airlines in India to get the placements in the hotel, tourism and aviation sectors. Our Co-Founder has been in this industry for 8 years and has expertise and contacts with all the major industry leaders in India.

                                           

Our training school will be set up as BENEFIT CORPORATION which is a type of for-profit corporate entity that includes positive impact on society and the environment as stated in its legally defined goals. The purpose of a benefit corporation includes creating general public benefit, which is defined as a material positive impact on society and the environment. Some of the operational costs such as teaching and boarding fees will be reimbursed in quarterly instalments by the government of North East India after the first 3 months of   the Academy's operations. The final funding by government will be released on successful employment of the girls in the industry. As we suggested  before that we a Phase II to this project. Whatever profits made from Phase I of the project will then be invested into further expansion of the Academy to create space for more equipment and better training facilities for the girls. 


                                                                        Source

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP

Despite having support from the Indian Government, we must show that the Academy will actually make a difference to these girls in the region. We want this to be a ‘public’ endeavour relying on socially responsible start-up funding from the global community rather than private investment funds who primarily focus on their own personal financial return-on-investment.

OUR TEAM



Namaste! My name is Vishal Rana. I am the Founder and CEO of Skills Development Academy for Women Empowerment. I am originally from India but migrated to Australia 10 years ago, and now I am going back to help empower the women in the community. I am 31 years old and a Doctorate Student in Organisational Behaviour in Australia. I have also been teaching, mentoring and doing professional development coaching with my University students for the past 3 years.
                                

ADVISORY TEAM

Our Advisory team includes Tanvi Jain. Tanvi is currently a Senior Tax Consultant for Deloitte Corporation. She has a MBA (Finance and Marketing) from Entrepreneurship Management Processes International (EMPI) College in India. She has a passion towards Women Empowerment and providing free education to the underprivileged children. She has participated in various CSR projects in Indian villages providing education to the uderpriveleged children. She will be contributing her knowledge and sharing her experiences related to providing skills development and training to the girls in our Academy.

                  


Our Advisory team includes Dr. Clarence Tan. Dr. Tan is currently the Asia Pacific Ambassador of Singularity University, a think tank based in NASA Ames Research Park in Silicon Valley, USA. The mission of Singularity University is to educate, inspire and empower leaders to apply exponential technologies to address humanity’s grand challenges. He is an Entrepreneur in the area of wireless technology and holds a number of patents in mobility technology globally. Dr. Tan has an MBA (Finance) from University of Southern California, and a PhD from Bond University, Australia. He has been an invited keynote speaker in a number of events including the London Business School Alumni event in Singapore, the Awesomenest Fest in Bali, the Global Investment Panel for Singularity University at NASA Ames Research Park, the World Computer Congress in Brisbane and TEDxYouth, Kuala Lumpur.


The Process and How You Can Be a Part of it

The first major step for us is to relocate the tribal girls to a metropolitan city closest to their home town. The relocation is necessary because of a lack of resources available in tribal regions for giving them the best training and employment opportunities. Further, my mentor, Jim Rohn said "you are the average of five people you spend the most time with". Hence, it is very important for the girls to spend more time out of their tribal community during their development stage. The girls are very happy to be relocated as they understand that to achieve bigger goals in life, sometimes small sacrifices have to be made. 

In order for us to get this project up and running, we need to cover the following expenses:

***Of course there are more expenses but these are the major ones. Any amount you contribute goes to the above mentioned expenses.

Source

4 WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Here are 4 ways in which you can make a difference in the lives of these Tribal Girls-

Contribute!

Check out our awesome perks available in return for your contributions to our Indiegogo campaign. Ranging from the  Certificates of Appreciation and Thank You Letters signed by the girls themselves to International Bestseller Books autographed by their authors to A PERSONALISED TRIP OF A LIFETIME TO INDIA, we want to express our appreciation for your generous contributions! 

Share!                                              

No problems if you don't have the funds, you can still contribute by sharing this campaign's link on your Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn and any other social media platforms you use.

Refer Friends and Win Prizes

Would you like to win an all-expense paid trip to our Academy in Kolkata, India or an 11 inch Macbook Air or a 13 inch MacBook Pro with Retina Display?
Scroll down to find out more!

Spread the Word!

No worries if you are not active on social media, you can still spread the word around about this campaign with your friends and families through word of mouth and request them to share on their social media.  

WIN A TRIP TO KOLKATA, INDIA OR MACBOOK AIR OR MACBOOK PRO

We are running a referral contest where you could win an all-expenses paid trip to KOLKATA, India for the inauguration ceremony of the Academy or Apple Macbook Air or Apple Macbook Pro.

Participating is simple:

1. Make sure you are logged in to your IndieGoGo account

2. If you don't have an IndieGoGo account, go and register one by clicking here When you are finished, come back to this page.

3. At the top of this page use the share buttons to share this campaign. You can use the social media buttons, but also the Link button to generate your unique link that points to this page.  

Each time you share the campaign with these links - we will track them.

4. Important! We are awarding 3 prizes (Kolkata Trip and 2 Apple Laptops)  to those who get the most people to contribute to this campaign (to qualify - your network should donate together at least $15,000).

So spread the word as far and wide as you can!

Every person who clicks on your link gets you closer to visiting us in Kolkata and helps these girls in India fulfil their greatest potential!

FAQ'S

Why the $78000 goal?

This is NOT our final goal, of course. This will cover the initial major expenses.

How much money from the crowdfunding actually goes to the prize?

With the exception of the IndieGoGo/PayPal fees, every dollar goes towards the campaign.

What payment methods do you accept?

We accept all major credit cards and PayPal

Can I donate from anywhere in the world?

Absolutely!

When will my perk prizes be delivered?

We are currently estimating shipping in November/December 2015.

I love what you are doing! How can I help?

Great question! Go and see the 4 ways in which you can help, all listed above. 

Is shipping included in the perks?

Yes.

Can I write-off my contribution with my taxes?

No, we are a benefit corporation, so you cannot claim taxes. 

I am a celebrity or public figure and would like to endorse the perk or help in some other way. How do I get in touch with you?

Please email Vishal Rana our Co-Founder who can discuss this further with you.


Finally, Just imagine....How many girls we can train to make them independent for the rest of their lives with our effort and your contribution.

These girls will also learn the basic and necessary skills of professional communication, professional grooming, computer skills and using the internet, skills to work in call centres, work as housekeepers, waitresses, flight stewardesses, and receptionists. Furthermore, these girls will be assisted in developing their resumes and organising interviews with major Hotels and Airlines in India to get the placements in the hotel, tourism and aviation sectors. Our Co-Founder has been in this industry for 8 years and has expertise and contacts with all the major industry leaders in India.

                                           

Our training school will be set up as BENEFIT CORPORATION which is a type of for-profit corporate entity that includes positive impact on society and the environment as stated in its legally defined goals. The purpose of a benefit corporation includes creating general public benefit, which is defined as a material positive impact on society and the environment. Some of the operational costs such as teaching and boarding fees will be reimbursed in quarterly instalments by the government of North East India after the first 3 months of   the Academy's operations. The final funding by government will be released on successful employment of the girls in the industry. As we suggested  before that we a Phase II to this project. Whatever profits made from Phase I of the project will then be invested into further expansion of the Academy to create space for more equipment and better training facilities for the girls. 


                                                                        Source
WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP

Despite having support from the Indian Government, we must show that the Academy will actually make a difference to these girls in the region.  We want this to be a ‘public’ endeavour relying on socially responsible start-up funding from the global community rather than private investment funds who primarily focus on their own personal financial return-on-investment.




OUR TEAM





Namaste! My name is Vishal Rana. I am the Founder and CEO of Skills Development Academy for Women Empowerment. I am originally from India but migrated to Australia 10 years ago, and now I am going back to help empower the women in the community. I am 31 years old and a Doctorate Student in Organisational Behaviour in Australia. I have also been teaching, mentoring and doing professional development coaching with my University students for the past 3 years.
                                






ADVISORY TEAM

Our Advisory team includes Tanvi Jain. Tanvi is currently a Senior Tax Consultant for Deloitte Corporation. She has a MBA (Finance and Marketing) from Entrepreneurship Management Processes International (EMPI) College in India. She has a passion towards Women Empowerment and providing free education to the underprivileged children. She has participated in various CSR projects in Indian villages providing education to the uderpriveleged children. She will be contributing her knowledge and sharing her experiences related to providing skills development and training to the girls in our Academy.

                  

Our Advisory team includes Dr. Clarence Tan. Dr. Tan is currently the Asia Pacific Ambassador of Singularity University, a think tank based in NASA Ames Research Park in Silicon Valley, USA. The mission of Singularity University is to educate, inspire and empower leaders to apply exponential technologies to address humanity’s grand challenges. He is an Entrepreneur in the area of wireless technology and holds a number of patents in mobility technology globally. Dr. Tan has an MBA (Finance) from University of Southern California, and a PhD from Bond University, Australia. He has been an invited keynote speaker in a number of events including the London Business School Alumni event in Singapore, the Awesomenest Fest in Bali, the Global Investment Panel for Singularity University at NASA Ames Research Park, the World Computer Congress in Brisbane and TEDxYouth, Kuala Lumpur.







The Process and How You Can Be a Part of it
The first major step for us is to relocate the tribal girls to a metropolitan city closest to their home town. The relocation is necessary because of a lack of resources available in tribal regions for giving them the best training and employment opportunities. Further, my mentor, Jim Rohn said "you are the average of five people you spend the most time with". Hence, it is very important for the girls to spend more time out of their tribal community during their development stage. The girls are very happy to be relocated as they understand that to achieve bigger goals in life, sometimes small sacrifices have to be made. 
In order for us to get this project up and running, we need to cover the following expenses:






***Of course there are more expenses but these are the major ones. Any amount you contribute goes to the above mentioned expenses.



Source

  
4 WAYS YOU CAN HELP
Here are 4 ways in which you can make a difference in the lives of these Tribal Girls-
Contribute!
Check out our awesome perks available in return for your contributions to our Indiegogo campaign. Ranging from the  Certificates of Appreciation and Thank You Letters signed by the girls themselves to International Bestseller Books autographed by their authors to A PERSONALISED TRIP OF A LIFETIME TO INDIA, we want to express our appreciation for your generous contributions! 

Share!                                              
No problems if you don't have the funds, you can still contribute by sharing this campaign's link on your Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn and any other social media platforms you use.
Refer Friends and Win Prizes
Would you like to win an all-expense paid trip to our Academy in Kolkata, India or an 11 inch Macbook Air or a 13 inch MacBook Pro with Retina Display?Scroll down to find out more!

Spread the Word!

No worries if you are not active on social media, you can still spread the word around about this campaign with your friends and families through word of mouth and request them to share on their social media.  
WIN A TRIP TO KOLKATA, INDIA OR MACBOOK AIR OR MACBOOK PRO




We are running a referral contest where you could win an all-expenses paid trip to KOLKATA, India for the inauguration ceremony of the Academy or Apple Macbook Air or Apple Macbook Pro.
Participating is simple:
1. Make sure you are logged in to your IndieGoGo account
2. If you don't have an IndieGoGo account, go and register one by clicking here When you are finished, come back to this page.
3. At the top of this page use the share buttons to share this campaign. You can use the social media buttons, but also the Link button to generate your unique link that points to this page.  
Each time you share the campaign with these links - we will track them.
4. Important! We are awarding 3 prizes (Kolkata Trip and 2 Apple Laptops)  to those who get the most people to contribute to this campaign (to qualify - your network should donate together at least $15,000).
So spread the word as far and wide as you can!
Every person who clicks on your link gets you closer to visiting us in Kolkata and helps these girls in India fulfil their greatest potential!
FAQ'S
Why the $78000 goal?
This is NOT our final goal, of course. This will cover the initial major expenses.

How much money from the crowdfunding actually goes to the prize?
With the exception of the IndieGoGo/PayPal fees, every dollar goes towards the campaign.
What payment methods do you accept?
We accept all major credit cards and PayPal
Can I donate from anywhere in the world?
Absolutely!
When will my perk prizes be delivered?
We are currently estimating shipping in November/December 2015.
I love what you are doing! How can I help?
Great question! Go and see the 4 ways in which you can help, all listed above. 
Is shipping included in the perks?
Yes.
Can I write-off my contribution with my taxes?
No, we are a benefit corporation, so you cannot claim taxes. 
I am a celebrity or public figure and would like to endorse the perk or help in some other way. How do I get in touch with you?
Please email Vishal Rana our Co-Founder who can discuss this further with you.

Finally, Just imagine....How many girls we can train to make them independent for the rest of their lives with our effort and your contribution.

story:
Friends, Family, and the Indiegogo community, I am calling on you to help me change the lives of 20 Nepali families. The average Nepali earns little more than $1 per day. Image living on 30 dollars a month! Yet these incredible people do it month after month year after year.

With the recent earthquake in Nepal many families will lose months of income that will set them back years. My goal is to provide 20 Nepali with at least 1 month of this lost income. I have been planning a trip to Nepal for the last two months to visit this beautiful country and climb to the Mt. Everest Base Camp and would like to capitalize on this opportunity to help those in need. Therefore, upon arrival in Kathmandu I will random select at least 20 families who have been devastated by the earthquake that took place on April 25th. The families will be chosen with the help of locals who know best were the most devastation has occurred. 

Many of us viewing this page right now can not imagine living on 30 dollars per month, and probably have spent that along today on coffee, lunch and an on-demand movie. This is your chance to help change the lives of those impacted by the recent earthquake and know that 100% of your donations will go straight towards families in need; no administration costs, no material cost, no NOTHING! 100% of your donation will be handed over to a Nepali family in need. 

Every family donation will be filmed and posted to my blog, along with a description of trip, so that you can see where your valuable donation is going. Subscribe at the top of the page to be alerted via email when they have been posted. 

http://michaeltgately.blogspot.com

Please help me reach my goal of giving 20 Nepali families (or more!) a months income to help them rebuild their lives. God Bless and please send prayers for Nepal! 


Note: In the case some unexpected even occurs (again) and prevents the trip, the money raised will be donated to the RedCross.

If the target goal is reached and surpassed families will begin receiving a pro-rated 2nd, 3rd and so on months income until all donations have been used.

Finally, if you feel uncomfortable donating to this specific cause please do not let that stop you from helping those in need. Below is a link to the RedCross's donation for Nepal Relief, thank you and God Bless Nepal.

RedCross Nepal Earthquake Relief

story:
Hello World. 

I am Sri, a documentary filmmaker. I have been taking photos of people around the world, because I believe that we are the creators of the best stories--and each one of us is a unique thread in the fabric of the world. 

I was in Kathmandu when the earthquake hit on 25 April 2015. Personally, it has changed my relationship with the earth, but for many others, the repercussions of the event are still being felt with many places completely cut off from all facilities and resources. 

In the days following the quake, a spontaneously-born network called the Himalayan Disaster Relief Volunteer Group was formed in Kathmandu as a unique team of local and expatriate volunteers reaching out to disaster-struck areas with shelter, food, water, sanitation and medical support. In most of the villages they are trying to reach, they are often the first on the scene.

Every morning in an office in Patan, south of Kathmandu, the team meets up to discuss various projects at hand. Here they assign priorities and assemble teams to pack supplies and head for the small villages that have been badly affected. They operate mainly through private donations, and try to stay under the radar to avoid having their funds being diverted by the government. You can learn more about their current projects on their Facebook page: www.facebook.com/pages/Himalayan-Disaster-Relief-Volunteer-Group

Postcards from Nepal. 

We all love to receive postcards from friends afar, and what better than to receive a custom made card sent to your address? Each postcard will have on it a face, a moment, or an encounter representing the unique magic and charisma of the Nepalese people. 

How you can help?

A small amount goes a long way in being able to purchase supplies, be it food, tarps, and make-shift shelters to prepare displaced families in the light of the impending monsoon season. 

So here is how it goes: 
STEP ONE: You can pick your favourite photo from the options below (or receive a surprise!)
STEP TWO: Pick the amount you would like to contribute (please keep in mind postcard printing and postal charges, though I will try to keep this to the absolute minimum)
STEP THREE: Send me your address and await the snail mail :)

ONE

TWO 

THREE


FOUR


FIVE


SIX


SEVEN


EIGHT


NINE


TEN


Other Ways You Can Help:

If you wish to donate directly, here are links to some other charities/organisations: 
http://karuna-shechen.org/news/help-earthquake-...
http://www.nrcs.org/
https://www.mercycorps.org/donate/survivors-nee...
http://www.care.org/donate

And please, don't forget about Nepal.
Thank you, 
Namaste
Sri

story:
Nepal has been hit by not one but two earthquakes of over 7.0 magnitude, within a month of each other.

The first earthquake on 25th April, of 7.8 magnitude, caused utter devastation to the capital city and remote villages in north-eastern Nepal. Shocking reports and images of the capital city, reduced to rubble, flooded our screens immediately - historic buildings that defined the essence of the city had been completely destroyed. The destruction, loss and subsequent grief was something our generation have never experienced before!
Then news of the surrounding remote villages started to emerge one by one. We learnt that entire villages had been wiped out. People were trapped in the rubble for days, not knowing whether they would make it out alive. People lost their homes, their livelihood.
Despite such chaos, a lot of people immediately came together to each other's aid. Support poured in from all over the world. People on the ground started working on clearing rubble, finding missing people a got to organising relief efforts. Their work on the ground is hugely inspiring and commendable.
Few weeks later, just when people were starting to regain some sort of normality and hope, another earthquake of 7.3 magnitude hit the country again - this has left the people devastated, their confidence shattered. They live in constant fear of what is still to come.
My Fundraiser
Like many who have close ties with Nepal, I have been in shock and despair since the earthquakes, but am compelled to help in any way I can.  In an attempt to make a difference I have decided to do my own fundraising - I have joined the local Park Run group and will be doing their weekly 5K run for 3 weeks. My first one is on 16th May and I am joining #RunforNepal - a group of people all running to raise money for Nepal, or to show solidarity and support.  
100% of the funds raised will be donated to organisations and people who are working tirelessly on the ground, day and night, trying to reach everyone who are in dire need of shelter, food and medicines. They need the money for access to helicopters to be able to deliver relief to villages not easily reachable by road. They need the money to buy foods and shelter for people who have gone without for many days. I will also donate the money to organisations who are working on regeneration of the country - through rebuilding better, more suitable houses, rebuilding better roads and networks.
The process of rebuilding will be a very long one and Nepal needs all the help we can give.
Please donate generously and please spread the word. If you don't want to donate to my fundraiser please do give to other people/organisations who are doing wonderful work in Nepal.

story:
Dagara Music and Arts Center

The Dagara Music Center is a locally-owned and operated arts and culture organization in Medie, Ghana that emphasizes the role of artists as agents of positive social change. Bernard Woma, founder and director of the center, has established a strong foundation for community empowerment, economic enrichment and sustainability, and the preservation of Ghanaian cultural traditions through his work in Ghana and abroad. Over the past 17 years the center has:

-implemented ongoing youth arts programs in Medie and around Ghana

-hosted hundreds of Westerners for arts and cultural immersion
experiences and instruction

-shared Dagara traditions abroad while touring the USA, Europe and Africa,

-provided opportunities for a variety of research and study opportunities for ethnomusicologists, performers, music, dance and art teachers from around the globe.

The success of our work to date has encouraged us to seek financial support to expand our operations.

The New DMC Campus

  1. The new DMC Campus will include:
    1. First floor
      • An administration block to accommodate office space
      • Kitchen
      • Dining hall/Community gathering space
      • A library/computer center in which all school children and members of the Medie community can come and study for free
    2. Second floor
      • Housing for visiting students
    3. Third floor
      • Housing for visiting students
    4. A performance theatre and dance studio
    5. An art studio and workshop
    6. A pool for local community members and foreign guests

Help us as we BUILD a Center, BUILD a Community 

With the kind support from our partners, donors and students in Spring 2016, we are glad to say that the new DMC campus project is on a good footing: the first floor structure is up and plastering has begun. However, we need $15,000 to complete construction on the first floor and begin construction on the second. This #GivingTuesday You can help us reach this goal by purchasing the following items.

  • Cement (1 bag = $10)
    • Help us finish plastering the interior and exterior first floor walls!
  • Cinderblocks (1 load = 50 blocks = $50)
    • Help us begin building our second story
  • A day of work (1 day = $250)
    • Help us pay our incredible construction workers to make our dream materialize 

The Impact

By contributing to our campaign, you will help ensure:

  • The new DMC campus will be able to accommodate students and community members by Summer 2018 (our goal is to be using all the communal spaces on the first floor by May!).
  • School children in Medie are able to access the first ever Community Library by Summer 2018
  • The new DMC campus is built with the help of an international community of musicians, scholars, activists, and global citizens.
  • The DMC will be able to significantly increase our offerings for foreign and domestic students and support for the local economies
  • The DMC can expand our work in training local artisans and teachers, and to continue to share the Ghanaian/Dagara cultural traditions in a professional capacity.
  • The preservation of traditional Ghanaian music and promote arts education both locally and internationally

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this campaign with family friends! Be sure to highlight the ways that the Dagara Music Center has impacted you and why you think it is important that the DMC is able to impact more people. 
  • Engage with us on social media (our handles are listed below) throughout the day. Post pictures, share material, like updates etc. Help us get some #GivingTuesday love. Be sure to use the tags: #dmc #ghana #GivingTuesday and #buildacommunity
  • Catch Saakumu Dance Troupe during their upcoming USA Tour: the more your social circle is able to interact with us in person, the more likely they will be to donate to future campaigns!
  • VISIT US IN GHANA! We would love to have you back. Check out our website for more information or email Bernard at bbwoma@yahoo.com.

Social Media Handles

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/dagaramusic/

Instagram: @dagaramusicctr

story:
Hi, my name is Amy and I have a confession to make.

I love learning about diseases! I love learning about the things that cause diseases and how we can recognise and hopefully stop them.

After finishing my degree in Biology with geology in 2010 I had the choice to do a Masters but couldn’t afford it. Instead I went to complete a PGCE in post-compulsory education, after that I moved to Birmingham to work at a college. I’d never really come across microbiology and infectious diseases in great detail before as they weren’t a major part of my degree. However, when I began teaching I was given the entire disease and infection unit. I really enjoyed learning about the different diseases so that I could teach my students, and they responded to my enthusiasm as we discussed things from dysentery to the difference between HIV and AIDS. The next year I was given responsibility for Microbiology as well. Although I enjoyed the practicals and the theoretical side, I felt there was something missing. A desire to know more grabbed me and I began looking into Masters near where I lived but I knew I would never be able to afford it.

After becoming deeply unhappy at work, battling stress and depression due to working conditions and the knowledge that I would no longer have a job after August I began to have therapy and get help.

My therapist encouraged me to accept a long term supply post and they also pointed out that, after we did some calculations, I would just be able to afford the Masters fee – especially if I worked part time whilst studying so I didn’t have to dip into my savings.

So, I went to open evenings and open days, I badgered course leaders about my suitability and the fees for their courses and now have recieved and accepted an offer! I’m feeling pretty confident! I’d be one of the first people in my family to get a Masters. I’m also looking at different groups and charities to see if I can qualify for any extra funding.

Why, I hear you ask, if you’re saving so much and should have saved enough for the Masters fee are you doing a project on Indigigo?

Several reasons:

1)  I’m currently working as a supply teacher, this means over the summer holidays I won’t get paid, and September is a very slow month for work. I will do exam marking but it wouldn’t be enough to support me over the summer unless I manage to get a part time job (I’m working on it but can’t guarantee it!) The money, depending how much raised would help me not dip into my savings.

2)  Fuel to get to university, a parking permit, car expenses. I would need to catch at least 2 buses to get to either of the universities I want to go to, keeping my car would mean I could carry more books, stay later on campus doing work, be able to drive from campus to work (when I get work!)

3)  Textbooks, stationary, printing – Textbooks are expensive, I’m hoping to get disabled student allowance (on account of my dyslexia) but if I don’t, I won’t be able to claim back for any textbooks I buy. I require my own copies of textbooks as because of my dyslexia I find it hard to absorb information from a written format, this means I usually have to highlight in books. If push comes to shove I can always photocopy, but even that will cost extra money.

4)  Things not-covered in my Masters course that are required, I keep hearing words along the lines of ‘lab bench fees’ ‘they’ll be listed in your offer letter’ This worries me!

What’s in it for you? I was trying to think of something I could offer you that you might like and wouldn’t be too dull, I know some people offer copies of their Masters dissertations but I didn’t want to make you wait 2 or three years for your reward! I don’t claim to be a brilliant artist... or a fantastic poet but I will try my best! I’m open to sensible suggestions as well.

Perks


£1GBP

Shout out on my twitter (@sleepyamyw.)

£5GBP

A PDF of one of my 5 chosen microbes (Ebola, shigella (dysentery), Salmonella, Athletes foot or the common cold)

£5GBP

A PDF poem about; Ebola, shigella (dysentery), Salmonella, Athletes foot or the common cold.

£10GBP

A postcard print of one of the microbes.

£10GBP

An A3 PDF featuring my artwork of five diseases; Ebola, shigella (dysentery), Salmonella, Athletes foot or the common cold, also featuring facts about each of the microbes.

£10GBP

Five PDF's of my 5 chosen microbes (Ebola, shigella (dysentery), Salmonella, Athletes foot or the common cold)

£15GBP

Handwritten thank you letter, 1 A5 sheet covered in my handwriting and possibly a doodle.

£20GBP

Choose a disease and I will write you a short poem, to be emailed to you in PDF format.

£25GBP

Choose a disease and I will write you a short poem (in my best handwriting with a possible doodle) and I will then post it to you!

£40GBP

The original artwork of one of my chosen microbes (Ebola, shigella (dysentery), Salmonella, Athletes foot or the common cold)

£45GBP

A drawing of a microbe of your coice. You will need to be able to direct me to images to use. You will recieve the original artwork.

Nasty beast, gives you food poisoning!

Otherwise known as bacterial dysentery.

Ephidermophyton floccosum - one of the main causes of Athlete's foot. 

Rhinovirus, the thing that gives you a cold.

Infamous by now, the disease that's got everyone on high alert.


So, just to summarise:

1)  I will have saved up enough for to fees for doing the Masters part-time for two (or two and bit years depending on the uni).

2)  I am hoping to work part time to supplement my income. (I already tutor, do ‘gigs’ on fiverr (
https://uk.fiverr.com/amyworlds) and offer ‘services’ on fivesquids (http://www.fivesquid.com/user/amysworlds))

3)  Any money you give me will help me not to spend my fee savings.

Thank you for reading my page, you can use the contact buttons to get in touch with any comments. Hopefully together we can make reaching my Masters less of a financial struggle.

I love learning about diseases! I love learning about the
things that cause diseases and how we can recognise and hopefully stop them.
After finishing my degree in Biology with geology in 2010 I
had the choice to do a Masters but couldn’t afford it. Instead I went to
complete a PGCE in post-compulsory education, after that I moved to Birmingham
to work at a college. I’d never really
come across microbiology and infectious diseases in great detail before as they
weren’t a major part of my degree. However, when I began teaching I was given
the entire disease and infection unit. I really enjoyed learning about the
different diseases so that I could teach my students, and they responded to my
enthusiasm as we discussed things from dysentery to the difference between HIV
and AIDS. The next year I was given responsibility for Microbiology as well.
Although I enjoyed the practicals and the theoretical side, I felt there was
something missing. A desire to know more grabbed me and I began looking into Masters near where I lived but I knew I would never be able to afford it.
After becoming deeply unhappy at work, battling stress and

story:
Untapped Potential

New Orleans has over 25,000 youth aged 16 - 24 who are neither in school nor part of the workforce. Because of the lost opportunity they represent, this demographic of youth are described as Opportunity Youth. 

Opportunity Youth represent a vast amount of potential but lack options due to lack of education and job skills. We're helping them bulldoze a path to careers in tech.

On the workforce side, the outlook for jobs in the software industry is twice that of the national average (22%) but only one in ten New Orleans schools teach any software curriculum. 


You can help change the lives of low-income youth by supporting Operation Spark's Prototype Program that will enable 10 of our students to find employment in the software industry this year.


Prototype is a program where our students work on real client projects alongside professional developers and get the experience needed to become truly employable. The program provides a buffered environment between the challenges students face in their lives and the anticipated demands of the workforce.  

At-a-glance, Prototype is a:

  • 6-month apprenticeship with real client projects
  • Practical application of software skills with professional guidance
  • Mentorship program
  • Try-out to get hired

What your donation will do

Operation Spark needs a third employee to head up the Prototype program. We've raised half of that money already and need another $25K to bring someone on. The Prototype program is already up and running with our first student, Melvin, working on two paying client projects. We want to scale up to 10 students and that means bringing someone else on board.  


Goals for 2015

  • Teach 50 young adults how to code 
  • Help 10 young adults get real software jobs
  • Train 50 K-12 teachers who will teach Computer Science curriculum in 30 local schools directly impacting at least 1000 students
  • Give away 50 laptops to qualified students 
  • Work with state legislators to make Computer Science required curriculum in Louisiana's schools


Operation Spark: What we do

STUDENT BOOTCAMPS

Operation Spark runs coding Bootcamps where students are immersed in the daily workflow of a professional developer. Teams of four professional software engineers volunteer their time to teach our Bootcamps.

  • 8 weeks; 1.5 hour sessions twice a week
  • Learn proficiency in HTML, CSS, JavaScript
  • Learn commandline, node.js, git, Github
At the end of Bootcamp students are empowered with an invaluable new skill-set and can either continue learning on their own or enter into Prototype, our next level of programming.


PROTOTYPE

  • 6-month apprenticeship with real client projects
  • Practical application of software skills with professional guidance
  • Mentorship program
  • Try-out to get hired

TEACHER TRAINING BOOTCAMPS

Only 1 in 10 K-12 schools across the U.S. teach any computer science courses. We’re working with teachers from a number schools to bring our curriculum into their classrooms. Teacher Training focuses on best practices for teaching software skills in a K-12 classroom setting.


CONNECT

Connect is Operation Spark’s coordinated effort to address the ‘digital divide’- lack of access to computers, internet connection, or digital literacy- by offering hardware and internet access to low-income families across New Orleans. 

The 'digital divide' prevents students from coding at home.  Operation Spark students who don't own laptops can sign up to receive a free Acer C720 Chromebook that comes loaded with the Ubuntu operating system - an ideal digital environment for coding.  



What we've done so far

  • Taught over 100 young adults the fundamentals of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript through immersive coding Bootcamps
  • Trained 12 K-12 teachers on bringing software curriculum into their classrooms
  • Gave 10 free Chromebooks to students (with many more on the way!)

What we're working on now

  • We're currently running two Student Bootcamps
  • Starting up another Teacher Training Bootcamp 
  • Starting up a class for incarcerated youth (more info below)
Operation Spark is working with the City of New Orleans to pilot a program at the youth detention center (Youth Study Center) to teach JavaScript to incarcerated youth so they will be workforce ready upon release. The superintendent of the facility is hopeful that this will become a model program for other detention centers in Louisiana and the rest of the country. 

Consider hiring Operation Spark to build your minimum viable product!


How did this all start?

Operation Spark was started in September 2013 when John began teaching young adults in community centers how to build simple video games with the aim of igniting the pursuit of an employable passion.

During the summer of 2014 Operation Spark was accepted into one of the premier ed tech incubators in the U.S. called 4.0 Schools. At that time we ran our first Bootcamp where students were immersed in the fundamentals of HTML, CSS and JavaScript. In August 2014, the program culminated in a pitch event where Operation Spark received both the Judges' Prize and the Audience-Choice Award. That same month we received our 501(c)(3) tax-exempt status from the IRS!


Our Team

John Fraboni, CEO

John has 18 years of professional experience in software built software for clients such as Tabasco, Microsoft, Disney, and Sony. Beginning in 2009, his work in the video game industry in Montreal contributed to some of the most successful games on social platforms. John holds a Bachelor of Music from McGill University and a Master of Music degree from the Manhattan School of Music.

Max Gaudin, COO

Max is a native New Orleanian, software developer, and previously founder of two tech companies, a software consultancy and a product that trains restaurant employees online called Sidework. He is an active member of the New Orleans tech community and organizer of 1 Million Cups. Max focuses on overall strategy, fundraising, volunteer happiness, building partnerships, and keeping John on his toes. He studied Hotel, Restaurant, and Tourism at the University of New Orleans.

Volunteers!

We're able to scale effectively thanks to an evergrowing team of volunteer software engineers, mentors, grant writers, and curriculum development professionals. We love our volunteers and certainly couldn't get very far without them!


Other ways you can help:
  • Stay up to date by connecting with us on Facebook and Twitter
  • Use Amazon Smile when shopping on Amazon.com to give Operation Spark .05% of your total purchase.
Maybe you didn't see it the first time, but we love volunteers!
You can volunteer with us in person or virtually. Sign up here!

  • Geeky volunteers who can help students with code, write or review curriculum, and teach classes
  • Non-geeky volunteers to help mentor students, test curriculum, or write grants
Our Perks:

Stickers:

Our T-shirt:

Our hoodie:

Special thanks to:

Our amazing sponsors:

story:
In 2000 I had the honour of spending 9 months living in Madagascar.  What an amazing country! During this time I met a remarkable young woman, with a passion for the Lord and a love for ALL people.  Andrea is now married with three beautiful boys.  While working in rural Madagascar, Andrea and her husband were involved with a village where the children have not had access to schooling.  Upon starting a "school" 120 children have come, eager to learn.  

They would like to build a school building for these children.  While they have access to builders and supplies, they do not have funding.  That is where you come in - it is estimated that a 5 classroom building would cost about $10,000 to build.  Please join me in making this school a reality!


In addition, the families living in the surrounding area do not have access to clean drinking water. At present most people are walking to the river, or hiking into the mountains to get water everyday, which takes a great deal of time.  They would like to build wells. One has been successfully built.  
It is planned that 3 more wells would cost about $300 to build and provide 30 families with water!  Make a difference here today.

story:
Clinton E. James Memorial TKE Scholarship

Clinton James was a spirited individual who exhibited passion in just about every endeavor he tackled in life, especially in regards to his fraternity. Through the creation of this scholarship, our organization wants to encourage fellow fraters to let their passion for TKE shine. 

Our goal is to create a scholarship through the TKE Educational Foundation ($5,000) and establish a tradition of awarding an annual scholarship ($500) to a deserving TKE Delta-Pi frater.

If we raise more than our goal, our plan is to be able to give out multiple scholarships to deserving members. It is hoped that we can continue this tradition for years to come in honor of Clinton, along with encouraging young men towards putting their finest efforts into the organization.

story:
Summary

My name is Ana Victorino, 22 years old freelance hair & makeup artist, YouTube beauty guru and blogger. I graduated five years ago with a course of Computer Graphics Design. I started my profession while I was still in college, doing side jobs to pay for my tuition fee and daily allowance. I also have a daughter named Zara "Sofie" Sofia who's about to turn five this coming July 18th. I'm really thankful to her because she is the main reason why I have my career right now---watching YouTube makeup tutorials while I was carrying her. I was out of college back then and when I came back to school, because of too much watching YouTube, I decided to be a makeup artist. Things were smooth sailing for the first four years until I got an investor to build a studio named after me. Apparently, the partnership didn't work between us. I found myself walking out of that place and never coming back again. 

Someday I hope I'll give my daughter the life she deserves. That's why I want to build a new studio where I'll manage everything and promote it full force to gain new customers, followers, and eventually family and friends. 


The Basics

For this campaign, I would like to rent a warehouse/commercial space where all the filming will happen. The maximum price per month is P40,000 for 12 months. I'd like to pay in advance so there's a whole year, which means more time, to earn it back. Im hoping that includes the electricity bills and miscellaneous fees(in the building/lot) already. I will also hire an assistant with a wage of P8,000/mo. He/she will handle bookings, take calls and messages, manange the website(P10,000 worth for domain, hosting, design) and be there during shoots to assist clients.

The rest will be spent on studio equipment like 10 backdrops, flash and continuous lighting, ring light, audio equipment, mirrors with lights, tables and chairs for workshops, air-conditioning unit, minimalist furniture, and an iMac to edit photos and videos on.  

If I didn't reach my goal though, I will buy necessary studio equipment like Yetti microphone for better voiceovers, a ring light and a GoPro for second angle shooting and vlogs so I can make better content for my YouTube channel. 

If I do reach the goal, I'll forever be grateful to each and every one who made a contribution or shared the campaign at least. 


Your Role

I have to be honest, when I lost my studio, I also lost my self-esteem. I've always thought I could do everything in order to be successful. Losing the studio is one of the reasons I lost motivation and my passion to do makeup tutorials. This studio is where I will spend most of my day filming, organising makeup workshops, and shooting photos for my blog. 

You can help not only rebuild a studio but bring back my confidence as well. Everyone deserves a second chance so I hope that YOU can make this campaign alive! 

I owe me and my daughter's future to YOU. In exchange, I'm giving away a lifetime of free consultations for your beauty needs. I love sharing what I know, especially my own tips, to everyone! <3


Risks & Challenges

One of the challenges I had when I used to have the studio is finding more customers. My old studio was located inside of a condominium where no one would really notice it so this time I want it to be convenient for clients. 

Also, we had very small studio lights so it was hard for me to film when I wanted to light up the whole room. This time, I'm getting professional equipment. 

Advertising I had before also wasn't strong. Now, I've created my own strategies in order to promote the studio offline and online. 


You Can Help in Your Own Way!

Please help me spread the word, either you may or may not contribute. I would really appreciate it as a way of helping me rebuild my future. Thank you so much and God bless!

I'm really thankful to her because she is the main reason why I have my career right now---watching YouTube makeup tutorials while I was carrying her. I was out of college back then and when I came back to school, because of too much watching YouTube, I decided to be a makeup artist. Things were smooth sailing for the first four years until I got an investor to build a studio named after me. Apparently, the partnership didn't work between us. I found myself walking out of that place and never coming back again. 
Someday I hope I'll give my daughter the life she deserves. That's why I want to build a new studio where I'll manage everything and promote it full force to gain new customers, followers, and eventually family and friends. 
   The Basics For this campaign, I would like to rent a warehouse/commercial space where all the filming will happen. The maximum price per month is P40,000 for 12 months. I'd like to pay in advance so there's a whole year, which means more time, to earn it back. Im hoping that includes the electricity bills and miscellaneous fees(in the building/lot) already. I will also hire an assistant with a wage of P8,000/mo. He/she will handle bookings, take calls and messages, manange the website(P10,000 worth for domain, hosting, design) and be there during shoots to assist clients.
The rest will be spent on studio equipment like 10 backdrops, flash and continuous lighting, ring light, audio equipment, mirrors with lights, tables and chairs for workshops, air-conditioning unit, minimalist furniture, and an iMac to edit photos and videos on.  
If I didn't reach my goal though, I will buy necessary studio equipment like Yetti microphone for better voiceovers, a ring light and a GoPro for second angle shooting and vlogs so I can make better content for my YouTube channel. 
If I do reach the goal, I'll forever be grateful to each and every one who made a contribution or shared the campaign at least. 

    Your Role I have to be honest, when I lost my studio, I also lost my self-esteem. I've always thought I could do everything in order to be successful. Losing the studio is one of the reasons I lost motivation and my passion to do makeup tutorials. This studio is where I will spend most of my day filming, organising makeup workshops, and shooting photos for my blog. 
You can help not only rebuild a studio but bring back my confidence as well. Everyone deserves a second chance so I hope that YOU can make this campaign alive! 
I owe me and my daughter's future to YOU. In exchange, I'm giving away a lifetime of free consultations for your beauty needs. I love sharing what I know, especially my own tips, to everyone! <3

    Risks & Challenges One of the challenges I had when I used to have the studio is finding more customers. My old studio was located inside of a condominium where no one would really notice it so this time I want it to be convenient for clients. 
Also, we had very small studio lights so it was hard for me to film when I wanted to light up the whole room. This time, I'm getting professional equipment. 
Advertising I had before also wasn't strong. Now, I've created my own strategies in order to promote the studio offline and online. 

    You Can Help in Your Own Way!
Please help me spread the word, either you may or may not contribute. I would really appreciate it as a way of helping me rebuild my future. Thank you so much and God bless!

story:
Short Summary

We're a group of university students seeking for a meaningful change in Guatemala. We believe that the best way to change our country is through education. That's the main reason why we are starting a movement to fund a college student through a scholarship.

We study at Universidad Francisco Marroquín (UFM), a private university in Guatemala City and one of Latin America’s most prestigious institutes of higher learning. This university has created an undergraduate scholarship program known as ITA. In Spanish, the acronym stands for promoting academic talent.

ITA was founded to attract the country’s most talented students and those most likely to become leaders. The program seeks out passionate and committed students who cannot afford to attend university.

Guatemala's current situation

For children living in the poorest rural areas, getting an education is almost impossible. Usually, children have to work to help their family’s income. Although some of them are lucky enough to get a high school education, the probabilities of getting a university education are almost null.

Why we need your help

The stories of many of the ITA students are dramatic: parents murdered, families abandoned, children whose parents refuse to let them go to school (especially girls), villages with no schooling beyond sixth grade, parents who can’t read or write, malnutrition, dirt floor huts, no running water or electricity.

What sets ITA students apart from the hundreds of thousands of poor students with similar stories is attitude and character.  And by the time they finally achieve that dream (say, graduating from UFM), they have already set themselves another much bigger one.

Challenge for the ITA program


In the last few years, due to lack of funding UFM has not been able to offer scholarships to everyone who qualifies. Up to 80 students have applied and qualified for the program but sadly the program has only been able to award a scholarship to 4% of these students.

  • Since 1996 ITA Scholarships Program has helped 172 students from 19 Guatemalan provinces 
  • 81% of these students have been honor students

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $20,000.00 that will fund one year of a complete scholarship for one student. The funds will go directly to Universidad Francisco Marroquín.

What does this scholarship includes?

Tuition and fees

    $9,000

Residency and food (12 months)

    $6,000 

Books

    $800 

Health Care 

     $300

Transportation and personal expenses

    $1,900 

Indiegogo fee:

Total: 

Other Expenses 

TOTAL

    $1,620

    $19,620 

    $380

    $20,000


The impact of ITA scholars

After graduating from UFM, their impact ripples through families, villages, and the business community as they assume new responsibilities as role models, project leaders, and professionals.

Each ITA graduate takes a different path. Many jump right into social and development projects that have an immediate impact on their communities, others take up professional careers, some teach, become entrepreneurs, create jobs, and earn scholarships to pursue graduate studies abroad.

  


Read Edwin's story and see how he has made an impact in his community.

Thank you for your support!

Other ways to help

Donate directly to the ITA scholarship program on the university's website ita.ufm.edu.

Spread the word and share this campaign with everyone you know!

For more information about the ITA program, visit ita.ufm.edu or e-mail us at ita@ufm.edu.
